text: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia slammed Congress-led state government over disrupted law and order situation in the state and said, "Why does this type of incident happen only during Congress rule?" Referring to violent incidents that took place on Ram Navami and Eid-ul-Fitr in Karauli and Jodhpur respectively, Poonia said, "Due to appeasement politics, peace...has been disturbed in the state."
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Data based on Centre's NPP: Satyendar Jain to Union Minister on 'wrong figures' remark
text: Responding to Union Power Minister RK Singh's claim that the coal stock data presented by Satyendar Jain had "incorrect" figures, the Delhi Power Minister said that the figures were taken from portal managed by Centre. The figures mentioned in my letter for some of the NTPC stations were based on daily coal report of National Power Portal, Jain said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rahul & Priyanka Gandhi do part-time politics: BJP's Rajyavardhan
text: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi do part-time politics, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore said on Tuesday. "Rajasthan government is useless. Do as many press conferences or give as many justifications about his (Rahul Gandhi) partying as you want, why is your government not working on its responsibilities?" Rathore added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Home Minister Amit Shah pays tribute to Lingayat saint Basaveshwara in B'luru
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah paid floral tributes to the bust and statue of Lingayat saint Basaveshwara on his birth anniversary as he arrived in Bengaluru on Tuesday. Tweeting photos from the event, Shah hailed the saint and wrote, "He devoted his entire life to the service of humanity...His great teachings on harmony, brotherhood and compassion...continue to guide us."
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: MNS bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maha: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that Maharashtra Navnirman Sena bagged a contract from BJP to disturb peace in Maharashtra. "The government must find out the political party that has given the contract to the 'Hindu Owaisi' to disturb the peace and harmony in the state. The government is standing on solid footing," Raut said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Shivaji memorial at Raigad Fort wasn't built by Lokmanya Tilak: Sambhaji
text: BJP MP Sambhaji Chhatrapati has reacted to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's statement that Lokmanya Tilak built Chhatrapati Shivaji's memorial at Raigad Fort near Pune. "I can state with some authority that Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's memorial was not built by Lokmanya Tilak," he said. Sambhaji is a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and the great-grandson of Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Will take action against Raj Thackeray today itself: Maha DGP
text: Maharashtra DGP Rajnish Seth said action will be taken against MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday itself based on his speech calling for removal of loudspeakers from mosques. "Aurangabad Commissioner is looking into the speech. He'll take whatever legal action that is needed," Seth said. We're prepared to deal with issues arising out of Thackeray's call for agitation, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Taught him to walk, he trampled us: Shivpal amid reports of rift with Akhilesh
text: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia chief Shivpal Yadav, in an apparent reference to his nephew and Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav, on Tuesday said he compromised on self-respect to "satisfy" him, but was still hurt. Taking to Twitter, he added, "We taught him how to walk and he went on trampling us." His remarks came amid reports of a rift with Akhilesh.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: PM Modi defamed past govts, hid BJP's failures in Berlin: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi for "defaming" past governments in order to hide the "shortcomings and failures" of the BJP-led Central government while addressing the crowd in Berlin during his Europe visit. It is not right for the PM to raise internal issues of India in other countries and criticise past governments, he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Jharkhand MLA Saryu Roy booked for allegedly leaking secret documents
text: Jharkhand Independent MLA Saryu Roy has been booked for allegedly leaking secret documents, an officer said on Tuesday. The FIR was lodged against the Jamshedpur (East) MLA by Under Secretary of state health department Vijay Varma. This comes almost three weeks after Roy accused state Health Minister Banna Gupta of corruption by misappropriating COVID-19 funds.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: All will be well if power is given to people: Ghulam Nabi Azad on J&K polls
text: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Tuesday said "all would be well" if elections are held in Jammu and Kashmir. "If election happens and...power is given in...hands of people, then I believe all will be well," he said. Notably, Home Minister Amit Shah had earlier said that elections will be held in the Union Territory following the delimitation process.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Ex-Cong MLA Ashwin Kotwal joins BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
text: Ahead of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, former Congress MLA Ashwin Kotwal joined the BJP on Tuesday. The ex-Khedbrahma MLA tendered his resignation to the Gujarat Legislative Assembly Speaker Nimaben Acharya earlier today. Kotwal, who hails from the tribal community, said that he was "very upset" with Congress, adding that the party "pretends to be within tribal society".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Punjab land of martyrs; seeds of hatred don't bloom here: CM Mann
text: CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said that Punjab is a land of gurus and martyrs, adding that seeds of hatred don't bloom in the state. "Punjab's social bonding is very strong. We live in brotherhood and those who spread hatred find no place here," he said. Mann added the people will see a more vibrant Punjab in the coming years.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP bulldozing India's secular nature, making mini-Pakistans: Mufti
text: BJP is "bulldozing the secular nature of the country and in the process making many Pakistans within India", said former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti. "They have failed on all fronts, whether it is employment or inflation, the only thing they are using now is the Hindu-Muslim divide," she said. They have no vision for the county, she added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP sent demolition notice to 4 Delhi temples to extort money: Atishi
text: Aam Aadmi Party's Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the BJP-led Central government posted demolition notices on the walls of four temples in Delhi in order to extort money. She said that the BJP government had issued the order to demolish the Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Sriniwaspuri and a similar order has now been issued against four temples of Sarojini Nagar.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Loudspeaker row created to divert focus from Centre's failures: Ex-MP CM
text: Ex-MP CM Digvijaya Singh said on Tuesday that the ongoing loudspeaker controversy has been created to deflect focus from Centre's failures. "All these are useless talks...People’s attention is being diverted from issues like...inflation and unemployment," he added. MNS leader Raj Thackeray had said that Hanuman Chalisa will be played outside mosques if loudspeakers there aren't removed by May 3.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Rahul parties more & works less: BJP's Shahnawaz on viral video
text: After a video went viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at a nightclub in Kathmandu, BJP leader Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said Gandhi parties more and works less for his party. "He parties every day, no one stops him anyway," Hussain added. "The Constitution doesn't have any such rule where anyone can be stopped from partying," Hussain stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Smriti Irani visits Rahul Gandhi's constituency Wayanad to review development
text: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani reached Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Lok Sabha constituency Wayanad in Kerala to review developmental projects in the district. Prior to her arrival in Wayanad, Irani took to Twitter and said, "Hello Wayanad! I will be there soon to attend meetings and other public events related to the development of the district."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Not a crime to attend friend's marriage: Surjewala on BJP criticising Rahul
text: After BJP leaders criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for being at a nightclub, the latter party's leader Randeep Surjewala said that Rahul was attending the marriage function of a journalist friend in Nepal and it's still "not a crime" to do so. "Maybe after today, BJP may decide it's illegal to attend...marriage and a crime to have friends," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Punjab announces recruitment to 26,454 posts, approves ration delivery scheme
text: The Punjab Cabinet on Monday gave its approval for recruitment to 26,454 posts in various departments in the state. The Cabinet has also approved one MLA-one pension and door-to-door ration delivery schemes, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann announced. He added that compensation of ₹41.8 crore has been approved for soft crop failure in Sri Muktsar Sahib.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Haryana BJP MLA takes oath to make India 'Hindu Rashtra', video surfaces
text: Bharatiya Janata Party MLA Aseem Goel on Sunday took an oath in Haryana's Ambala to make India 'Hindu Rashtra'. Video of incident was shared online. The pledge that was administered by Sudarshan News' Suresh Chavhanke, said, "We pledge to...make Hindustan Hindu Rashtra...If needed...we will make or take sacrifice for it but at any cost...we will declare Hindustan as Hindu Rashtra."
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: You'll waste life on court dates: Mumbai Mayor to MNS on loudspeaker issue
text: MNS workers should not take the law into their hands, "otherwise their life will be wasted attending court dates", said Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar in response to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker ultimatum. "Loudspeakers will be removed from temples and mosques...No one, including Muslims, opposed Hanuman Chalisa," she said. Loudspeakers must be used as per noise pollution rules, she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cong's Punjab in-charge recommends disciplinary action against Sidhu
text: All India Congress Committee (AICC) in-charge of Punjab Harish Chaudhary, in a written letter to Congress President Sonia Gandhi, sought disciplinary action against former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu. In his letter, Chaudhary wrote Sidhu continued to criticise Congress, even as the party was contesting elections, adding that Sidhu had a "hand in glove with Shrimoni Akali Dal."
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: AAP members arrested after clash with BJP workers in Gujarat
text: A clash broke out between workers of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and BJP in Gujarat's Surat on Monday. Several AAP members, including its state unit chief Gopal Italia, were arrested on charges of rioting. The incident occurred when AAP workers marched to the BJP headquarters to protest against the alleged assault on their councillors at Surat Municipal Corporation.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Hardik Patel removes 'working president of Gujarat Congress' from his Twitter bio
text: Congress' Hardik Patel has removed the mention of "working president of Gujarat Congress" from his Twitter bio amid reports that he is unhappy with the party. Patel's Twitter bio now reads "Proud Indian Patriot. Social and Political Activist". Earlier, Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor had said that Patel is not making himself available to resolve differences when invited for talks.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Conspiracy against me designed by PMO: Jignesh Mevani
text: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani on Monday said it was a "pre-planned conspiracy" to "destroy" him. "You're using a woman to lodge FIR against me. This is a conspiracy designed by the PMO in view of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections," Mevani stated. Earlier, an Assam court granted bail to Mevani in a case of alleged assault on a policewoman.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Uniform Civil Code is not required in India, says Owaisi
text: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi said that the Uniform Civil Code is not required in the country. "As per the Goa civil code, Hindu men have the right of second marriage if wife fails to deliver a male child by the age of 30. BJP has the government in that state too but they are silent over the matter," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Himachal will implement UCC soon, move won't harm Muslims: CM
text: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said on Monday that the state will implement Uniform Civil Code (UCC) soon, adding that the move won't harm the Muslim community. "I think everyone especially Muslim women will welcome this step...It will be beneficial for them," he added. Neighbouring Uttarakhand decided to set up a panel comprising of experts to draft UCC last month.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: 'Chalo Ayodhya' posters put up in Mumbai ahead of Raj Thackeray's visit
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena has put up 'Chalo Ayodhya' posters in Mumbai, appealing to people to join party chief Raj Thackeray on his visit to Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on June 5. Amid the ongoing loudspeaker row, Thackeray on Sunday warned that if they aren't taken down, then 'Hanuman Chalisa' would be played with double volume from May 4.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Debates on Uniform Civil Code will bear constructive outcome: Naqvi
text: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said on Monday that holding debates on Uniform Civil Code (UCC) will bear constructive outcome for the country. "UCC is not being introduced for the first time in the world, our constitution-makers said that we must move towards adopting [it]," he added. Naqvi's comments come amid proposed implementation of UCC by Uttarakhand, among other states.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Check loudspeaker usage at religious places: BJP MP to Delhi LG
text: BJP MP from West Delhi Parvesh Sahib Singh on Monday requested Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal, Delhi Police and MCDs to ensure loudspeakers installed at religious places are either removed, or used at permissible levels. The Uttar Pradesh government has followed the Supreme Court order appropriately, Verma said, adding, "The same needs to be done by other states as well."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: AAP expels leader for pro-Khalistan tweets, says it backs India's unity
text: AAP has expelled its Himachal Pradesh unit leader Harpreet Singh Bedi over his alleged pro-Khalistan tweets. The move came after BJP accused Bedi of supporting Khalistan cause, citing his past tweets which allegedly included demand for new currency for Khalistan. "AAP...believes in...unity & integrity of [India]...& [won't] tolerate anyone writing anything against our country," the party tweeted.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Electricity issues to be resolved within 10 days: Haryana CM
text: Speaking about the power crisis in Haryana, CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said the power-related issues will be resolved within next 10 days. "We've already provided 24-hour electricity to 5,600 villages and 800 are next…The power demand has increased by 50% as compared to the last year and of this, 30% has been fulfilled by state government," Khattar added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Religious issues being created to hide Centre's failures: Maha Cong chief
text: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Monday said religious controversies were being created in the country to hide the failures of the central government. The last eight years of BJP-led central government has led to inflation, unemployment and farm distress, Patole added. Further, while reacting to Raj Thackeray's loudspeaker removal demand, Patole said that no one is above the law.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Before election mode, BJP workers get 3-day vacation in Gujarat
text: BJP's Gujarat leadership has given its workers a three-day break, from May 2 to 4, to spend time with their families before switching to election mode for the upcoming Assembly polls. There are no party functions in Gujarat till May 5, a senior BJP leader said. The workers have been working relentlessly for the last two years, he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Political crisis in Maha, won't give them an inch of land: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday urged politicians of Maharashtra not to use border issues for their political survival, adding that the state will not give an inch of its land. "The politicians of Maharashtra raise the border and language issue whenever they face a political crisis in their state," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Rampant corruption in H'yana, people forced to pay bribes: AAP leader
text: AAP leader Sushil Gupta stated that rampant corruption is going on in all departments in Haryana and people are being "forced" to pay bribes to get their works done. "Corruption, crime and unemployment have been soaring in the state," Gupta added. He further said that corruption is rampant in Haryana with the "support" of ministers.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kejriwal must visit RSS shakhas to learn about nationalism: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Parvesh Sahib Singh invited Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal to visit the RSS headquarters to "learn about nationalism". "Nationalism must be in our heart and mind. We know how nationalist he is. He raises questions about surgical strikes and opposes 'The Kashmir Files'. What about the riots that happened under his government in Delhi and Patiala," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Raj Thackeray's speech was divisive, police will decide action: Minister
text: Maharashtra Minister Dilip Walse Patil has said that MNS leader Raj Thackeray's recent speech in Aurangabad on loudspeaker controversy was divisive. "Police will listen to his speech...decide what's objectionable and...decision will be taken," he added. Thackeray has warned that if loudspeakers aren't removed from all mosques in state, Hanuman Chalisa will be played at a louder volume from May 4.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Country’s atmosphere not good, we want unity: Mamata on Eid
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said the atmosphere of the country is not good. "Divide and rule policy is not good..Isolation policy is not good...We want unity," Banerjee added. She was addressing people at the Red Road in Kolkata on the occasion of Eid-ul-Fitr. "We are not scared, we know how to fight," Banerjee stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP lists AAP's 'failures' in Delhi after 7 years of being in power
text: BJP on Sunday listed the alleged failures of the Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi, which has been in power for the past seven years in the city. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said that CM Kejriwal opened only 200 mohalla clinics and Leader of Opposition Ramvir Singh Bidhuri said that 63% of people don't get DJB filtered drinking water.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Karauli incident on Ram Navami was an experiment by BJP: Raj CM
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that violence cannot be the answer to violence and what happened in Karauli on Ram Navami was "an experiment by the BJP". "The RSS and BJP have decided to divide this country between Hindus and Muslims, between religions, castes. This is part of their agenda and this is just the beginning," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Claims of normalcy in J&K self-serving lies, contradictions: Mufti
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said that claims of normalcy in the Union Territory by the Centre are "self-serving lies and contradictions"."Eid prayers are disallowed yet again in Jama Masjid tomorrow. Stripping people not only of their fundamental rights but also religious freedom symbolises their ruthlessness," she tweeted.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Maha Minister Nawab Malik hospitalised, condition serious: Lawyer
text: Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik, arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case, was admitted to a Mumbai hospital as he was suffering from diarrhoea, vomiting, and fever for the last three days, his lawyer informed a court. The lawyer said the minister's condition was serious. The hospital said the minister is under observation at the Intensive Care Unit.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Don't perform 'Maha Aarti' on May 3: Raj Thackeray to MNS workers
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Monday appealed to his party workers to not perform 'Maha Aarti' on loudspeakers on May 3 so that no social tension is created during the Eid festival. "The loudspeaker issue is not a religious matter but a subject of public interest. What further needs to be done, I will inform tomorrow," Thackeray added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP leader urges Delhi CM to remove loudspeakers from religious places
text: BJP leader Adesh Gupta on Monday wrote to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal urging him to immediately remove loudspeakers from religious and other places as per the Supreme Court’s guidelines. "Wrote a letter to CM Arvind Kejriwal…Due to noise pollution, children, elderly people, patients and people working in offices have to face difficulties every day," Gupta tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will play Hanuman Chalisa twice loudly if loudspeakers not removed: MNS chief
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray while addressing a rally in Aurangabad on Sunday said all loudspeakers at mosques in the state must be removed by May 4. He said if it doesn't happen, the Hanuman Chalisa will be played twice loudly. He added that it's a social issue not religious.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Time to go to people, the real masters; will start from Bihar: Prashant Kishor
text: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Monday tweeted, "My quest to be a meaningful participant in democracy and help shape pro-people policy led to a 10-year rollercoaster ride!" "As I turn the page, time to go to the Real Masters, THE PEOPLE, to better understand the issues," he wrote. "Will start from Bihar," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: My visit to Europe comes at a time when it's facing many challenges: PM Modi
text: Ahead of his three-day trip to Denmark, Germany and France, PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said he is travelling to Europe at a time when the region faces many challenges and choices. "Through my engagements, I intend to strengthen the spirit of cooperation with our European partners, who are important companions in India's quest for peace and prosperity," he said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Balasaheb told Advani 'if Modi is removed, you'll lose Guj' after 2002 riots: Uddhav
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has revealed that after the 2002 post-Godhra riots in Gujarat, his late father Balasaheb Thackeray supported PM Narendra Modi (then the state's CM). There was a demand to remove PM Modi as Gujarat CM then, Uddhav said, adding, "Balasaheb told (LK) Advani...'Modi shouldn't be touched. If Modi is removed, (the BJP) will lose Gujarat'."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP fooled innocent Bal Thackeray in guise of Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said BJP fooled his 'innocent' father, the late Bal Thackeray, in the guise of Hindutva. "I am not going to get fooled because I've seen their tactics," Uddhav added. Speaking about the loudspeaker issue he said, "I don't give importance to this new player of Hindutva. Sometimes he (Raj Thackeray) plays Marathi card and sometimes Hindutva."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: NSUI protests, seeks permission for Rahul's visit to Hyd's Osmania University
text: NSUI members held a protest at the Hyderabad's Osmania University seeking permission for Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's visit on May 7. An NSUI member alleged that despite the state government's order, the university's Vice-Chancellor isn't giving permission to hold the event inside the campus. Notably, several protesting NSUI members were detained by the police on Sunday.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Won't give barren land without water to our next generation: Haryana CM
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday inaugurated the Amrit Sarovar scheme which aims to develop and rejuvenate 75 water bodies in the state. "Water is the core of a healthy land...We would not like to give barren land without water to our next generation," Khattar said. He further said that every drop of water will be saved and used.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: HC stays Kumar Vishwas' arrest over remarks against Kejriwal
text: Former AAP leader Kumar Vishwas, who has been booked for making alleged inflammatory statements against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, was granted protection from arrest by the Punjab and Haryana High Court. Vishwas had moved the court demanding quashing of the FIR filed against him by Punjab Police. Vishwas had reportedly accused Kejriwal of supporting separatists ahead of Punjab elections.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Muslims facing onslaught from BJP, its 'militant' arms: Mufti
text: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said Muslims are facing an "unprecedented onslaught from BJP and its militant political arms". "While the bulldozer became the symbol of state terror against the community, the demons of hate unleashed by the government seem to be on a rampage," Mufti said. She added that her party would continue to fight its democratic and political fight.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Break BJP's arrogance once in Guj & vote for AAP: Delhi CM Kejriwal
text: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls due later this year, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday appealed to voters that they should break BJP's arrogance once and vote for the AAP. "They (BJP) feel that if they give us time till December, Gujarat will turn towards AAP. But I am telling you I am a 'fakkad'," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Free entertainment: Uddhav in apparent reference to Raj's speeches
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, in an apparent reference to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's speeches, on Sunday said, "Theatres and cinema halls were shut due to pandemic. So, if one is getting entertained for free, why shouldn't he/she enjoy it?" This comes amid the loudspeaker row in the state. Uddhav also alleged that BJP deceived his father, the late Bal Thackeray.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Will bring back old pension scheme if we win 2023 polls: Kamal Nath
text: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath has said that the old pension scheme will be reintroduced if the party wins the state Assembly polls in 2023. "The old pension scheme for government employees will be implemented like how other states ruled by our party have done," Nath said while speaking at a Madhya Pradesh Shikshak Congress' event.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP MP starts campaign seeking withdrawal of quota for tribal converts
text: Madhya Pradesh BJP MP GS Damor said tribals who convert to any other religion mustn't be given reservations mandated for Scheduled Tribes.  "We have been organising delisting rallies in all tribal-dominated districts," Damor said. Reacting to Damor's comments, state Youth Congress chief Vikrant Bhuria said Damor should be "ashamed as he himself is an MP from an ST reserved seat".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: PM's misgovernance spanning 8 yrs is a case study: Rahul on inflation, power crisis
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi's "misgovernance" spanning eight years is a case study. "Power crisis, jobs crisis, farmer crisis, inflation crisis - PM Modi's eight-years of misgovernance is a case study on how to ruin what was once one of the world's fastest-growing economies," Gandhi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP creating artificial issues to divide country: Congress' Abhishek Singhvi
text: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi said that the BJP is creating "artificial issues" like the hijab and national language issues to divide the country. "BJP is fishing in troubled waters…they want to divide, scare, provoke and antagonise people," Singhvi added. "They draw you into the debate because it suits them...Don't fight on their terms," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Won't participate in MNS' Hanuman Chalisa event in Maha: VHP
text: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) National Spokesperson Vinod Bansal on Sunday said VHP and Bajrang Dal activists won't participate in the event being organised by Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) to play Hanuman Chalisa outside mosques on May 3. "[VHP] doesn't support any political party", Bansal said and added that VHP believes there shouldn't be a ban on recitation of Hanuman Chalisa.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: All parties should work together in this direction: Raghav Chadha on coal shortage
text: Moving apart from politics, all parties should work together towards the coal shortage issue, AAP leader Raghav Chadha said. "Not just one or two states but 16 states of the country are facing a huge coal shortage and electricity crisis," Chadha added. "Coal, Railway and Power Ministries should work under PM's leadership," Chadha stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: DMK stands for upliftment of workforce: TN CM Stalin on Labour Day
text: Speaking at an event on International Labour Day in Chennai, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Sunday that the DMK government stands for the upliftment of the workforce. "It is...DMK...that brought the use of bicycle rickshaws instead of hand-pulled rickshaws...For the first time in India, the DMK government provided free electricity to farmers in [Tamil Nadu]," he added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Assamese Muslims don’t wish to be mixed with migrant Muslims: Assam CM
text: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that Assam's indigenous Muslim population does not wish to "mix" with migrant Muslims living in the state. "It [state government] will take a decision in the future on who is a Muslim and who is a migrant Muslim. There is no opposition to this in Assam," CM Sarma said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP's purpose behind UCC is to target minorities: CPI(M) leader
text: Senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Hannan Mollah on Sunday said that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh and BJP's purpose behind bringing the Uniform Civil Code is to target the minorities of the country. His response came following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's comment stating, "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives. Ask any Muslim woman."
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP asks Punjab CM to step down for 'failing to maintain law & order'
text: BJP on Sunday asked Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to resign as the Home Minister for failing to maintain "law and order" after the violence in Patiala. BJP general secretary, Subhash Sharma asked why didn't CM Mann take responsibility for the violence despite removing the Inspector General of Police, Senior Superintendent of Police and Superintendent of Police in Patiala.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: AAP has Khalistani mentality people: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil
text: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil a "non-Gujarati", the latter responded by alleging that AAP has members with a "Khalistani mentality". "Giving responsibility in his party to people with Khalistani mentality and believing that making a demand for Khalistan is a constitutional right, Arvind Kejriwal is a threat to security of the country," Paatil tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP MLA arrested from official residence for assaulting Odisha officer
text: Odisha BJP MLA Subash Chandra Panigrahi has been arrested from his official residence in Bhubaneswar for allegedly assaulting a block development officer (BDO) in Deogarh. His two aides have also been arrested. The BDO alleged that the MLA and his associates attacked him when they could not find him at his office as he was busy with some official work.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Why option of merging Pawan Hans with ONGC wasn't explored?: Cong
text: Congress on Sunday questioned disinvestment of the Centre's 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited (PHL) and asked why the Centre didn't explore merging PHL with Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC). Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh said the Centre is "committing a series of blunders" and that the Pawan Hans employee union had also recommended merging PHL with ONGC.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LPG cylinder price hike attack on poor, labour class: Yechury
text: Communist Party of India (Marxist) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury criticised the Centre over the hike in petroleum prices and termed it an "attack on the labour class and poor". "Today, when it is Labour Day, there is a new attack on the workers. Not only on the labourers but also on the working people of the entire country," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: I was there to bring Babri Masjid down, not Shiv Sena: Fadnavis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said he was in Ayodhya when Babri Masjid was razed and no Shiv Sena leader was present. "I am saying with pride that, yes, I was there to bring the structure down...No Shiv Sena leader was present there," Fadnavis said. He added, "[Shiv Sena] got scared...when they were asked to remove loudspeakers from mosques."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Same Xiaomi allowed to donate ₹10 cr to PM-CARES Fund: Moitra on ED seizure
text: TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Saturday reacted to the Enforcement Directorate's seizure of Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore over Forex law violations. Moitra said the same Xiaomi was earlier "allowed to donate ₹10 crore to opaque PM-CARES Fund". Notably, Congress had earlier questioned why PM Modi's COVID-19 fund was accepting donations from Chinese companies.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: You were silent on WB post-poll violence: Ex-bureaucrats to group that criticised PM
text: Responding to 108 ex-bureaucrats who questioned PM Narendra Modi's "silence" on recent incidents of communal violence, 197 ex-bureaucrats and judges said the group maintained a "studied silence" over post-poll violence in West Bengal. "It lays bare their cynical, unprincipled approach to issues," said the open letter. Major communal violence incidents have reduced under BJP government, it claimed.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 21 Naga People's Front MLAs in Nagaland join CM Neiphiu Rio's NDPP
text: As many as 21 out of 25 MLAs of the Naga People's Front (NPF) have joined Chief Minister Neiphiu Rio-led Nationalist Democratic Progressive Party (NDPP) in Nagaland. The state Assembly speaker Sharingain Longkumer approved the merger on Friday. Following the approval, NDPP now has 42 MLAs in the 60-member Assembly and NPF is left with four MLAs.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Poll announcement soon?: Kejriwal on reports of Guj BJP leaders meeting PM
text: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday took to Twitter and asked if the BJP is going to announce fresh elections in Gujarat after dissolving the Gujarat assembly next week. Kejriwal's statement comes as PM Narendra Modi reportedly held a meeting with Gujarat BJP leaders in Delhi on Saturday. "Are they so scared of AAP?" Kejriwal added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Fuelling politics of hate: Ex-bureaucrats respond to open letter criticising PM
text: Some 197 former judges and bureaucrats have responded to an open letter by a group of 108 ex-bureaucrats who had criticised PM Narendra Modi's "silence" amid a "frenzy of hate-filled destruction". "Their 'anger' is...empty virtue-signalling...they're fuelling the politics of hate they seek to combat by attempting to engineer hate against the government with...false portrayals," said the group.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: No one from Bollywood called me on bypoll win, they're scared: Shatrughan
text: During an interview, actor and TMC leader Shatrughan Sinha said that no one from Bollywood called him after he won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls. He said, "I have not received a single congratulatory call from the film industry." "These people are so scared, they didn't even try to call...(they must've thought) What if the telephone is tapped," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Balasaheb must be happy seeing us fight against those trying to divide India: Raut
text: Reacting to Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey's "Bal Thackeray's soul would have been hurt seeing people getting arrested for reciting Hanuman Chalisa" remark, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said, "They don't have to worry about Balasaheb ji." "Balasaheb will surely be happy to see that Shiv Sena is fighting against those who are...dividing the country and defaming Maharashtra," Raut added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP mismanaging power crisis like COVID-19: Congress' Kamal Nath
text: Congress leader Kamal Nath condemned the BJP in Madhya Pradesh and at the Centre over the power crisis and accused the party of taking the issue lightly, saying the crisis was being 'mismanaged like COVID-19'. "This is the consequence of the corruption they (BJP) have done in the last two years," he said. BJP is denying the crisis, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP trying to divide Hindus in Maha: Uddhav amid Hanuman Chalisa row
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday accused BJP of trying to divide Hindus in the state. Thackeray said, "It is the BJP's conspiracy to divide Hindus and Marathis and non-Marathis in Maharashtra." His remarks came amid the controversy surrounding MP-MLA couple Navneet Rana and Ravi, who were arrested after they gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Thackeray's home.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: K'taka Home Minister should resign: Ex-CM on PSI recruitment scam
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah demanded the resignation of state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra a day after the Karnataka government announced its decision to annul the PSI recruitment exam and conduct a re-examination. "On what moral grounds can (Jnanendra) continue as Home Minister?" he tweeted. He also sought Karnataka CM's clarification over the government's decision to re-conduct the exam.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Will loudspeaker demand solve unemployment issue?: Sharad Pawar
text: NCP supremo Sharad Pawar said that an attempt was being made "to take the country backwards in the name of caste and religion". Hinting at Raj Thackeray's demand to remove loudspeakers from mosques, Sharad Pawar questioned if this would solve unemployment. Pawar's comment comes ahead of the MNS chief's visit to Aurangabad, where he will address the issue.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: No Muslim woman wants husband to get 3 other wives: Assam CM on UCC
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) isn't his issue but an "issue for all Muslim women". "No Muslim woman wants her husband to bring home three other wives," he added. To provide justice to Muslim women, triple talaq has to be removed and UCC needs to be brought in, he further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: JD(U) doesn't interfere in religion: Bihar CM on loudspeaker issue
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday spoke about the BJP's demand for the removal of loudspeakers from religious places, saying, "Everyone's aware of [JD(U)'s] view, we never do any sort of interference in any religion." BJP leader Janak Ram earlier said that if a law on loudspeakers has come into UP, it'll have its effect in Bihar as well.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: There's peace as of now: Punjab CM after Patiala clashes
text: A day after clashes broke out between two groups in Patiala over an anti-Khalistan march, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said, "There's peace in [the city] as of now". "Shiv Sena, Congress and Shiromani Akali Dal...workers clashed with each other," he said. Police officials have been transferred and peace committee meetings are being conducted, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Economy is in shambles, but BJP more concerned about UCC: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the BJP on domestic economic issues. "The country's economy is in shambles, passenger trains are being cancelled to transport coal, unemployment is rising but you're more concerned about the Uniform Civil Code (UCC)," Owaisi said. "Why is the Hindu Undivided Family tax rebate not there for Muslims and Christians?" the 52-year-old politician asked.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Is Nehru ji to blame for PM Modi's failure?: Rahul on power crisis
text: Criticising PM Narendra Modi over the ongoing power crisis in India, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday asked if he would be blaming "Nehru ji or states or people" for his "failure". He also shared a video of an earlier speech by the PM in which he promised 24-hour electricity, writing, "PM's promises and intentions have always been disconnected."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Action must be taken if loudspeaker is used to provoke: Kamal Nath
text: Congress leader Kamal Nath, spoke on the issue of loudspeakers on Saturday, saying that it is a "private matter" and "should not be made a public issue because peoples' sentiments are attached to it". He however stated that the loudspeakers shouldn't be misused and that action must be taken "if loudspeakers are used with the intention of provoking".
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Andhra Education Minister must resign: TDP on class 10 exam paper leak
text: Telugu Desam Party (TDP), which is the main Opposition party in Andhra Pradesh, demanded the resignation of the state's Education Minister Botcha Satyanarayana over the class 10 exam paper leak case. The TDP also questioned why the CM was 'silent' over the issue. "They [YSRCP] were playing dangerous games with the lives of lakhs of students," a TDP leader said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Ex-MLA PC George held for making controversial remarks against Muslims
text: Former MLA and senior Kerala politician, PC George, was taken into police custody for allegedly making controversial statements against Muslims. The six-time MLA was booked under Section 153A of the IPC for allegedly making the remarks at an event organised by the Ananthapuri Hindu Maha Sammelan. The 70-year-old politician had alleged that tea sold in Muslim-run restaurants cause "impotence".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: SP MLA assaults power station worker over outage in UP; booked
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Ashutosh Maurya and his supporters have been booked for allegedly assaulting a power sub-station operator in UP's Budaun. Maurya reportedly claimed that he visited the station after receiving complaints about power outage from local residents. A video that surfaced on social media showed the MLA misbehaving with the operator, said police.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Took risk of quitting Shiv Sena for benefit of OBCs: NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal
text: NCP leader and Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Chhagan Bhujbal said that he took a big risk by quitting Shiv Sena and joining Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) for the sake of the Other Backward Classes (OBCs). "For the last several years, I have been working for the OBC community. I risked my political career for their benefit and switched over," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Don't tell reason, solve the problem: Akhilesh to UP govt on power crisis
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the UP government for "telling reasons" instead of solving the power crisis problem in the state. Yadav said this by tweeting an excerpt of information shared by state's Urban Development & Energy Minister AK Sharma which revealed the closure of a few power generation units in the state due to technical reasons.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Ensure coal availability at power plants: Chhattisgarh CM to Centre
text: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said that the Centre should ensure the availability of coal at power plants across India amid the power crisis. Baghel's comment came after the Ministry of Power released a statement saying the country was facing a power crisis wherein the peak power demand for electricity touched an all-time high of 2,07,111 MW on Friday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Some people giving communal colour: Tejashwi on loudspeaker row
text: Amid the ongoing controversy around the use of loudspeakers in religious places, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that some people are giving a "communal colour to unnecessary issues". "I want to ask a question...They (loudspeakers) were invented in 1925 and have been used in temples and mosques...since the 1970s. Didn't God exist when loudspeakers were not there?" Yadav tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Law & order deteriorating in Punjab: Anurag Thakur on Patiala clash
text: Condemning the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over the clashes that broke out in Patiala, Punjab, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that it reflects the deteriorating law and order situation in the state. "Even before polls, questions were raised about the intentions and capabilities of AAP," Thakur said. He questioned if AAP would take action against those trying to disrupt peace.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Lord Ram had bow, Yogi Adityanath has bulldozer: Sakshi Maharaj
text: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Sakshi Maharaj said, "While Lord Ram and Krishna had 'dhanush' (bow) and 'sudarshan chakra' respectively, our baba (Yogi Adityanath) has a bulldozer, which is being used against land mafia." Meanwhile, talking about leaders of opposition parties visiting Samajwadi Party's Azam Khan in Sitapur jail, he said, "I'm keeping an eye on it...and government...is aware of it."
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: TN's Sri Lanka aid resolution shouldn't be for political mileage: BJP
text: BJP's Tamil Nadu unit wrote to state CM MK Stalin on Sunday saying that it welcomes the state assembly's resolution to seek permission from the Centre to provide humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka. However, it claimed that recently, the state government's actions were aimed at getting "political mileage" and it's "only afraid" this resolution shouldn't be for the same reason.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Stop hitting on me: Musk to US politician on 'billionaire with ego problem' tweet
text: After US' Democratic congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez took to Twitter and blamed hate crimes on "some billionaire with ego problem" who "unilaterally controls a massive communication platform", Elon Musk tweeted, "Stop hitting on me, I'm really shy." Alexandria replied, "I was talking about Zuckerberg, but ok," before deleting it. Musk recently reached a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Shah Faesal will serve same govt that imprisoned him: Omar Abdullah
text: Former J&K CM and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Friday congratulated former IAS officer Shah Faesal on his return to the government service. He, however, added that Faesal will now be serving the same government that imprisoned him. Faesal, who had quit the government service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, was detained after Article 370 was abrogated.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Sidhu lauds Punjab govt as it frees 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded the Punjab government for freeing 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali. The land had been encroached on since 2007, the Department of Rural Development and Panchayats said. "My accolades to Panchayat Minister Kuldeep Dhaliwal...This is the way forward for Punjab...seize properties of...illegal...occupants, no matter who they are," Sidhu tweeted.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: BJP, PFI are behind Hubballi violence: Congress' DK Shivakumar
text: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has accused the BJP and the Popular Front of India (PFI) of staging violence in Hubballi. "BJP and PFI are behind (the) Hubli riots. Congress does not support (the) Bajrang Dal, VHP, SDPI, or any organisation that creates unrest in society. We are strongly committed to the Constitution," Shivakumar tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: MP-MLA couple's intent was to challenge law and order: Mumbai Police
text: Mumbai Police today opposed the bail pleas of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana. Police claimed the couple's announcement to recite Hanuman Chalisa in front of CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence was with an intention to challenge law and order. Their acts were part of the larger conspiracy to get Maha Vikas Aghadi government dissolved, police added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Punjab CM never met me over coal crisis: Union Coal Minister
text: Reacting to a comment made by AAP MP Raghav Chadha, Union Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said that AAP "has a habit of lying." He added that Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann "never met" him to discuss the coal crisis. "They have never met me and they're saying that they have. [They are] taking my name and spreading lies," Joshi said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Loudspeaker banned not Azaan, people free to follow their religion: BJP's Shahnawaz
text: Speaking on the loudspeaker row, BJP's Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said that some people are spreading the illusion that Azaan is banned but that's not the truth. "There is no ban on Azaan anywhere in the country. People are free to follow their religion," Hussain said. "When Azaan was done for the first time, it was not on loudspeakers," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Hindi is a link language: K'taka minister on nat'l language debate
text: Referring to Ajay Devgn and Kiccha Sudeep's exchange over the national language, Karnataka minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan said, "Hindi is nothing but a link language." He said, "We need to love our language and at the same time, respect other languages and coexist." We are here to promote the local language as it is our identity, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: He couldn't even become UP CM: Mayawati on Akhilesh's 'PM' remark
text: After Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that he wanted BSP chief Mayawati to be PM, the latter reacted by saying, "They need to stop making such childish statements." She tweeted, "When (Akhilesh) couldn't fulfil his own dream of becoming (UP CM) even after securing...votes of Muslims and Yadavs...how would he manage to meet someone else's aspiration to become PM."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Haryana CM meets Union Power Minister, discusses power supply issue
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar and Union Power Minister RK Singh met and it was agreed that 300 MW from the Kameng Hydro Electric project will be supplied to Haryana. "Haryana has decided to set up a new unit of 750 MW at its Yamuna Nagar plant for which the Ministry of Power will extend...assistance," the ministry's statement said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Bulldozers & swords given to people in name of religion: Mufti
text: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti on Friday said that people have been 'given bulldozers and swords in the name of religion'. She added that the situation was similar to a neighbouring country which "gave guns to people in name of religion". She further alleged that the Centre was 'pitting Hindus and Muslims against each other to hide job crisis and inflation'.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: He has become a fake astrologer: BJP leader on Rahul's coal crisis remarks
text: BJP leader Pralhad Joshi criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his remarks on India's coal crisis and called him a "fake astrologer". "Instead of telling what is going to happen due to coal shortage in the country, he should tell the country how big a coal scam happened during his government and how much loss the country incurred," Joshi added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: CID arrests BJP's Divya Hagargi in Karnataka PSI recruitment scam
text: BJP leader Divya Hagargi was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka. Divya was reportedly caught from a hideout in Pune in Maharashtra. She runs Jnana Jyothi Institution which is an educational institution in Kalaburagi and was the 18th accused to be arrested in the case.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: If you don't speak Hindi leave this country and go: Sanjay Nishad
text: Responding to a media query about the ongoing language debate in the country, Uttar Pradesh Fisheries Minister Sanjay Nishad said that Hindustan is not a place for people who don't speak Hindi. "They should leave this country and go somewhere else," he said. "If you do not love Hindi, it will be assumed that you are a foreigner," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Statehood demand for North Bengal justified: BJP MLA amid heatwave
text: Condemning West Bengal government's decision to announce early summer vacations in schools due to heatwave, BJP MLA Sankar Ghosh said the demand for separate statehood for North Bengal was "justified". He called North Bengal's weather "moderately pleasant". The "step-motherly" treatment of the TMC government towards North Bengal has led to this demand, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Cong leader meets Azam Khan's family, says 'SP didn’t stand with him'
text: Congress leader Pramod Krishnam on Thursday met jailed Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan’s family in UP's Rampur and said that SP didn't perform its duty to stand with him. He further urged BJP to reconsider its decisions citing Khan's ill health and said, "We're standing with him and his family. It should be seen from...perspective of humanity and not politics."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Chidambaram criticises Centre over power crisis, says 'Modi hai, mumkin hai'
text: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday criticised the Centre over the power crisis in the country. "Government has found the perfect solution: cancel passenger trains and run coal rakes! Modi hai, mumkin hai," the former Union Minister tweeted. Chidambaram further alleged that the country is facing acute power shortage despite having a large railway network and abundant coal.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Not much difference between governance of Yogi, Mamata: Cong leader
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said there is not much difference between the governance of UP CM Yogi Adityanath and that of Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "Both...have failed in maintaining a law and order situation," Chowdhury added. His reaction came after Mamata Banerjee said she will not let West Bengal become Hathras or Unnao amid recent rape cases.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP wants to create disturbance over louspeaker issue: Sanjay Raut
text:
Accusing the BJP of creating disturbance over the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra,
Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the BJP opposed an all-party meet called by the state government to discuss the issue. "[This] means you (BJP) want to do politics and want to create a disturbance on the matter of loudspeakers in [Maharashtra]," Sanjay Raut said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Owaisi breaks down during speech, says 'Muslims are being wiped out'
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday broke down while addressing a gathering in Hyderabad and alleged that "Muslims are being wiped out of the country". Speaking on the bulldozer row, Owaisi said that he gets calls every day about the "instances of injustice" happening in India. "One shouldn't lose hope...We'll face it with patience but will never raze...home," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Talks of BJP-MNS alliance are false: Devendra Fadnavis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis dismissed reports of BJP's alliance with Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS). Fadnavis said there was no such proposal. "Yes, Raj Thackeray took issues of loudspeakers...that has been our issue...but alliance talks are false," he said. MNS's Yashwant Killedar also denied reports of an alliance between BJP and MNS.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP did corruption in J'khand: Congress leader on power crisis
text: Blaming BJP for the ongoing power crisis in Jharkhand, Congress spokesperson Rakesh Sinha accused the BJP of corruption. "But what have they (BJP) done in these years? They have given nothing in the name of infrastructure to the state," he said. "They kept indulging in corrupt activities instead of providing infrastructure to the state", Sinha added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Urge people to not be provoked: Captain Amarinder on Patiala clash
text: Expressing concerns over the situation in Punjab's Patiala, former CM Captain Amarinder Singh urged people to not get provoked. "People of Patiala are peace-loving...Hope that Punjab Police will take firm action and ensure that law and order are maintained," Captain tweeted. Tension prevailed after Shiv Sena members and pro-Khalistani activists clashed.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Haryana govt did not set up a power plant, demolished 4: Surjewala
text: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala has criticised the BJP-JJP-led Haryana government over the electricity crisis issue. "This (Haryana) government did not set up a single power plant in the last eight years and demolished four functional power plants," Surjewala said. "The CM's announcement of a new power plant...sounds like digging a well when the house is on fire," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Shiv Sena suspends Harish Singla after clashes during rally in Patiala
text: Shiv Sena has suspended the working president of its Punjab unit, Harish Singla, for "anti-party activities", according to an official letter issued by the party today. This comes after clashes broke out between two groups during Shiv Sena's anti-Khalistan rally in Patiala. The rally was being led by Singla and was reportedly held without a "go ahead" from the party.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: It will spread a good message: AIMIM leader on inviting Raj Thackeray for Iftaar
text: AIMIM leader and Aurangabad MP Imtiaz Jaleel invited Raj Thackeray for an Iftaar party and said, "It will spread a good message in the country." "MNS chief Raj Thackeray is coming here for a rally on May 1. I invite him for Iftaar," he said. Jaleel further added that 99% of people are peace-loving, only 1% of people create disturbance.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Hanuman Chalisa arrests would've hurt Bal Thackeray's soul: Choubey
text: Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey on Friday claimed that people being arrested over the recitation of Hanuman Chalisa or taking Lord Ram's name would have "hurt the soul" of late Shiv Sena chief Bal Thackeray. He added that loudspeakers shouldn't be used late at night or early in the morning. "People are facing...problems due to noise pollution," he further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Congress leader Kamal Nath resigns as Leader of Opposition in MP
text: Congress leader Kamal Nath has resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Madhya Pradesh. Nath's resignation has been accepted by the Congress high command, All India Congress Committee General Secretary KC Venugopal said. Dr Govind Singh will be the Leader of the Congress Legislature Party in Madhya Pradesh, the Congress party said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Tharoor pens poem on Kejriwal's sitting posture during meeting with PM Modi
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has penned a poem on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's sitting posture during a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi. "There once was a CM of Delhi, who stretched from his head to his belly. The onscreen reticulation, revealed his pandiculation. So BJP frothed & quivered like jelly!" Tharoor wrote. BJP Delhi had called Kejriwal "mannerless CM".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: UP MLA scolds official for bulldozing house, says homes of poor shouldn't be razed
text: A video has surfaced online, showing BJP MLA Ketki Singh scolding an official in UP's Ballia for bulldozing a poor family's home. Singh could be heard saying, "I said one thing...why didn't you respect it?...[You used bulldozer's strength...we'll use the words' strength]." Later, Singh said that UP CM Yogi Adityanath has said that homes of poor shouldn't be razed.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Patently untrue: Minister on claim that T'gana CM was told to stay away from PM's event
text: Union Minister Jitendra Singh dismissed KT Rama Rao's claim that PMO had instructed Telangana CM and his father K Chandrashekar Rao to stay away from PM Narendra Modi's programmes in Telangana last year and in February. "This is patently untrue. No such message was sent by the PMO. Infact, the CM...was expected at the events on 5th February," Singh tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Bajrang Dal, VHP hold meeting with senior MNS leaders in Pune
text: Right-wing groups Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) held a meeting with senior leaders of Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) in Pune on Friday. This comes amid a controversy over loudspeakers in religious places. An MNS leader said both the groups have agreed to participate in the 'maha arti' on May 3, which will take place across Maharashtra.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Attempt being made to disturb communal harmony in India: Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that an attempt was being made to disturb communal harmony in the country. He said the Centre wasn't doing enough to control troublemakers in Delhi. Speaking about the Jahangirpuri violence, he said, "There were attacks on a particular section of the society. There was a conspiracy to spoil peace in the country."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Amravati MP & husband seek home-made food in jail, file plea in court
text: Amravati Independent MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana have filed a petition in a sessions court in Mumbai seeking home-made food in jail. The plea's hearing will take place on April 29. The couple was arrested and sent to 14-day judicial custody on Sunday after they threatened to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: I am nobody to decide role of Rahul Gandhi in Cong: Prashant Kishor
text: Prashant Kishor rejected reports which claimed that he suggested the name of Priyanka Gandhi to lead the Congress party and said that there was "no discussion" of Rahul or Priyanka in his meeting with party leaders. Kishor further said that he was nobody to decide the role of Rahul Gandhi in Congress. Kishor had recently declined offer to join Congress.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Hardik Patel not holding talks with us despite invitation: Gujarat Cong chief
text: Gujarat Congress chief Jagdish Thakor criticised Hardik Patel by saying that he is giving anti-party statements in the media and not making himself available to resolve the differences when invited for talks with party members. "I called him last week and again yesterday. Last time he said he was busy...Later, he said he was in Surat," Thakor said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Lack of planning: BJP to Jharkhand govt over power cuts
text: The BJP has accused the JMM-led Jharkhand government of failing to provide a steady supply of electricity and adequate water to people amid the heatwave, calling it a result of "lack of planning". Former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das said, "Presently, Jharkhand requires 2,300 MW to 2,600 MW of power but is getting barely 1200 MW."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: India doesn't need a national language, religion: Ex-J&K CM
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Thursday said that India doesn't need a national language or a national religion. "India is too diverse a country to have one national language. When you pick up an Indian currency note, how many languages do you find on it?" he said. India gives space to everybody, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Use bulldozers on criminals, not on temples: BJP MP to Raj govt
text: Condemning Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot over the Dausa gang-rape and murder, Rajasthan BJP MP Ram Kumar Verma said that the government should use bulldozers on criminals and not on temples. "The Home Minister who is also the Chief Minister is responsible for such incidents because he has no control over it and has become insensitive," Verma said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP moves in right direction with right ideology: JP Nadda
text: Addressing a party programme in Ahmedabad, BJP's National President JP Nadda has said that BJP "is a party that moves in the right direction with the right ideology". "Anyone who wants to compete with our party will have to toil for 50-60 years. Our ideology is gaining global recognition...BJP is a party that...will take the country forward," Nadda said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Maha govt delaying establishment of Vajpayee statue in Mumbai: BJP
text: BJP MP Gopal Shetty has accused the Maharashtra government of deliberately delaying the establishment of the statue of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee in Mumbai's Kandivali. "Permission from the 12 departments of the Maharashtra government has been granted," Gopal Shetty said. One minister belonging to the Sports department of Congress quota has not permitted it yet, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Imported oil first taxed by Centre then states: Pawar on fuel price hike
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that imported oil is first taxed by Centre and then states. Pawar added that Maharashtra decreased taxes on CNG due to which it suffered loss of ₹1,000 crore. He further said Centre should adopt uniform taxation policy on fuel in country.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Weren't told one religion will get preferential treatment in India: Omar
text: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah said, "When we decided to accede to India, we acceded to a country where every religion would be treated equally. We were not told that one religion will get preferential treatment and others will be suppressed." He added that decision perhaps would have been different if people knew about it.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Unfortunately in Maha, we don't have any 'yogis' but 'bhogis': Raj Thackeray
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray congratulated UP CM Yogi Adityanath for removing thousands of loudspeakers from religious places, "especially the masjids" in the state. "Unfortunately in Maharashtra, we don't have any 'yogis'; what we have are 'bhogis'. Here's hoping and praying good sense prevails," Thackeray said. UP government removed 10,900 "illegal" loudspeakers from religious places till Wednesday.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Centre should take steps to curb fuel price hike: Kerala CM
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said that people's suffering due to fuel price hike cannot be mitigated by blaming the states. The Centre should take steps to curb the increase in the rates, he added. This comes a day after PM Narendra Modi said non-reduction of VAT by some states was the reason for skyrocketing costs of fuel.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: I can dream of becoming UP CM again or PM but not country's President: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said SP is responsible for BJP's win in UP in the recent Assembly polls. "I can dream of becoming UP CM again or the PM but not the President of the country," Mayawati added. "SP is dreaming of making me country's President so that their path to the UP CM post is clear," Mayawati stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress can revive itself, doesn't need me: Prashant Kishor
text: After declining Congress' offer to join the party, poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that the Congress can revive itself and does not need him. "The Congress leadership and I agreed on several things with regard to the party's future plan," Kishor said. They can revive the party on their own, they have so many big leaders, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Jharkhand govt has become king of thieves: Arjun Munda
text: Union Minister Arjun Munda criticised the JMM-led Jharkhand government and said that the state government has become the "king of thieves". "What is happening in Jharkhand? Illegal mining is being done, loots, coal 'mafiagiri' is being done openly. The state government is not understanding why the public has chosen them... there's a lot of mismanagement," the former Jharkhand CM said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: AAP's Atishi to speak on Delhi govt's policies at UNGA
text: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi will speak on the Delhi government policies at the United Nations General Assembly in a meeting on the 'New Urban Agenda'. "This is a great opportunity for governments to learn from one another and help people all over the world through policies that are closely connected to the needs of citizens," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Ugly display of faith to harass others won’t be tolerated: UP CM Yogi
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said it won’t be tolerated if people indulge in an "ugly display" of their faith to harass others. "There is full respect for all the faiths, there is no interference by the state government in religious practices but common people shouldn't be harassed," he added. "We proved that UP can remain free of riots," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP didn't fight enough, workers felt abandoned: WB BJP MP
text: West Bengal BJP MP Arjun Singh said BJP didn't win the state's Assembly polls last year because "it didn't fight enough". "BJP lost [the Assembly polls] because of poor candidate selection...Organisationally, the party is very weak. It is evident from what we recently saw in Asansol," Singh said. "Many workers felt they were abandoned [during] the post-poll violence," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy: Omar Abdullah
text: Jammu and Kashmir is passing through a difficult phase, Omar Abdullah, former Jammu and Kashmir CM, said on Thursday. "The security situation is a cause of concern. There's no area in Kashmir that is free from militancy," Abdullah added. "There is very little economic activity, barring tourism. Jammu and Kashmir has high unemployment levels," Abdullah stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Prashant Kishor's proposal had nothing on leadership: P Chidambaram
text: After poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined Congress' offer to join the party, senior leader P Chidambaram said that Prashant Kishor's proposals to restore the party had nothing regarding its leadership. "PK plan had nothing on leadership issue. Didn't hear of any Priyanka for president proposal either," he said. Kishor rejected Congress' proposal after various meetings with Congress leaders.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Cong protects rioters: BJP after anti-Sikh riots accused Tytler meets Sonia
text: Reacting to 1984 anti-Sikh riots accused Jagdish Tytler's meeting with Congress' Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that the party "has always protected" and patronised rioters. "Congress will never stand for...victims of...riots...They have always rubbed salt on the wounds of...Sikh community," he added. The purpose of Tytler's visit, however, is not known.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Why should govt suffer loss of face because of your negligence?: Mamata to police
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the state's police force saying that their "negligence" led to incidents of violence and rape. She said, "Why should the government have a loss of face because of your negligence?" This comes after nine people were burnt alive in Birbhum and a minor girl was allegedly raped by a TMC leader's son in Nadia.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Bible and Quran: K'taka Education Minister BC Nagesh
text: After a Bengaluru school allegedly made Bible reading compulsory, Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We can't compare Bhagavad Gita with Quran and Bible." He said, "Bible and Quran are religious texts. But Bhagavad Gita speaks about values needed to lead life." Earlier, Archbishop of Bengaluru questioned state government's plans to introduce Bhagavad Gita as the moral science syllabus.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 2 former Karnataka CMs reply to Ajay Devgn's 'Hindi is our national language' tweet
text: Two former Karnataka Chief Ministers Siddaramaiah and HD Kumaraswamy have responded to Ajay Devgn's tweet directed at Kannada actor Sudeep, saying Hindi is our national language. Siddaramaiah said, "Hindi was never and will never be our national language. It's the duty of every Indian to respect linguistic diversity of our country." Kumaraswamy said, "India is a garden of several languages."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: TN reduced tax on petrol before Centre's action: State Finance Min
text: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to states to reduce VAT on fuel, Tamil Nadu's Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan said that the Tamil Nadu government had reduced VAT on petrol back in August 2021, prior to the central government's action. "That cut resulted in a relief of ₹3/litre to the citizens of the state," the minister said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries when attacked by Sena workers: Police
text: Mumbai police said that BJP's Kirit Somaiya received minor injuries after he was attacked by Shiv Sena workers. They added, "Bhabha Hospital in Bandra which treated Kirit Somaiya following the attack stated, 'It was not a major injury. There was minimal bleeding'." Somaiya was attacked when he went to meet MP Navneet Rana and her husband at Khar police station.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: UP has set an example by removing unnecessary loudspeakers: CM Yogi
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said the state has set an example before the country by removing unnecessary loudspeakers installed at religious sites or reducing their volumes across UP with harmony. "Instructions given for the use of loudspeakers should be implemented strictly. The people should not face inconvenience and loudspeakers should not be installed at new sites," CM Yogi added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Without Gandhi family, there would be no Congress: AK Antony
text: Senior Congress leader AK Antony on Wednesday stated that the Nehru-Gandhi family is the powerhouse of Congress, without whom, the party wouldn't exist. "Without Congress' role, you cannot think of...change of guard in Delhi," Antony added. His remarks come a day after poll strategist Prashant Kishor declined to join the party, citing a need for leadership overhaul in Congress.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP and CPI(M) are trying to defame West Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the law and order situation in West Bengal was under control and accused some sections of media of spreading misinformation. "A suicide case was turned into a rape case. BJP and CPI(M) are both trying to defame Bengal," Mamata Banerjee said. We will not let Bengal become Hathras or Unnao, she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: WB spent ₹1,500 cr to subsidise fuel prices: CM after fuel price meet
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday criticised PM Narendra Modi who urged states to reduce VAT and said that her government has spent ₹1,500 crore in the last three years to subsidise fuel prices. "Today's interaction with PM Modi was completely one-sided and misleading. The facts shared by him were wrong," she said
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Cong mute spectator to crimes against women in Rajasthan: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday criticised Congress over 'rise in crime' against women in Rajasthan. "In Hathras, the way Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi came forward and Sonia Gandhi made incessant statements...Why have Sonia ji, Rahul ji and Priyanka ji turned mute spectators now?" Thakur asked. He also accused Congress of creating tensions among different communities in Rajasthan.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Coercive, not co-operative: Rahul on PM's fuel tax appeal to states
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said 68% of all fuel taxes is taken by the Centre, yet, PM Narendra Modi abdicates the responsibility. "High fuel prices - blame states, coal shortage - blame states, oxygen shortage - blame states...(PM) Modi’s federalism isn't cooperative. It’s coercive," Gandhi tweeted. His remark comes after PM Modi urged several states to cut VAT on fuel.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM quoting only Opposition-ruled states to reduce VAT on fuel: DMK
text: DMK's TKS Elangovan accused PM Narendra Modi of quoting only opposition-ruled states to reduce taxes on fuel. "[PM Modi] won't say that Gujarat or Karnataka should reduce taxes," Elangovan said. This comes after PM Modi urged governments of Maharashtra, West Bengal, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Jharkhand and Tamil Nadu to reduce VAT on fuel during his meeting with the CMs.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Uniform Civil Code should be implemented, RPI (A) backs it: Athawale
text: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (A) supremo Ramdas Athawale said on Wednesday that party backs Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and will support it when it's tabled in parliament. "I think...there should be a common law for all," he added. Athawale's remarks come amid the proposed implementation of the UCC by some BJP-ruled states, including Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: PM called meet for COVID, taunted CMs of non-BJP states on fuel price: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised PM Narendra Modi's appeal to CMs of non-BJP ruling states to reduce VAT on fuel and said PM Modi "taunted" the CMs. "The CMs were told that PM Modi would hold a meeting on COVID...(He) was not expected to do so but CM Uddhav Thackeray and Mamata Banerjee have given the answer," Raut added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: TMC has no future in Goa: Party's state chief resigns
text: Blaming poll strategist Prashant Kishor for the upset in Assembly elections, Goa TMC chief Kiran Kandolkar on Wednesday resigned from the party. The party has no future in Goa, he said. He added he had nothing against party chief Mamata Banerjee. "Prashant Kishor is the one who leads I-PAC. If anyone has failed, it is him," said Kandolkar.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP targeting the NCP, misusing ED and CBI: Supriya Sule
text: NCP MP Supriya Sule accused the BJP of targeting the NCP and misusing Central agencies such as ED and CBI against its political opponents. "How is raking up issues like loudspeakers at places of worship going to benefit Maharashtra?" she questioned the BJP. Polarisation through communal unrest would only impact the country's economic growth and development, she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP never promotes riots but stops them: Madhya Pradesh Minister
text: Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister and BJP leader Vishvas Kailash Sarang has said that "BJP never promotes riots but stops them".
