This comes after Congress' Digvijaya Singh alleged that BJP is paying poor Muslim youth to pelt stones, adding, "These aren't facts...I'm not accusing anyone." Reacting to Singh's statement, Sarang asked, "How could you level such charges when you...don't have proof."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Don't oppose every step just to appear on TV: Mann to Opposition
text: Reacting to Opposition's criticism on Knowledge Sharing Agreement signed between Delhi-Punjab government, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said, "Opposition parties should not oppose every step being taken just to appear on TV." "Opposition parties should give us time," he added. "Navjot Singh Sidhu is questioning us on Power Purchase Agreements. When he was made Power Minister, he ran away," Mann said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Fire due to MCD's negligence: Gopal Rai over Bhalswa fire
text: A day after a massive fire broke out at Bhalswa landfill in Delhi, Environment Minister Gopal Rai accused the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) of negligence. "The people of Delhi are facing landfill fire due to MCD's negligence and 15 years of BJP's corruption," he said. The Delhi Pollution Control Committee has been asked to submit a report, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Cong revamps Haryana unit, appoints Udai Bhan as state party chief
text: Congress on Wednesday revamped its Haryana unit and named four-time legislator Udai Bhan as the new state party chief. Bhan replaced Kumari Selja, who tendered her resignation to Congress' high command recently and described herself as a "true soldier" of the party. Additionally, Congress appointed Shruti Choudhry, Ram Kishan Gujjar, Jitender Kumar Bhardwaj and Suresh Gupta as working presidents.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Opp'n hasn't reduced VAT on fuel, BJP did months before: Minister
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that the Opposition ruled states have not reduced taxes on fuel, despite BJP-led states having done it months before. "Opposition only looks at the Centre but does not reduce the taxes in their own states. Don't they want to benefit the people who voted them to power?" he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Mamata will be real game-changer in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Sinha
text: Newly-elected Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Shatrughan Sinha praised party supremo Mamata Banerjee and claimed that she could be "real game-changer" in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Sinha, who won from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency in bypoll, stated that Banerjee is "tried and tested leader who's respected by all". He added that he had left BJP as party turned into an autocracy.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Expel me if you want me to join BJP: Shivpal to Akhilesh
text: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark that why was the BJP delaying induction of Shivpal Yadav, the latter said that if Akhilesh wanted him to join BJP then he should expel him from the party. "It's an irresponsible and childish statement. I'm one of 111 MLAs of SP who won in recent assembly elections," Shivpal said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RSS is like termite, spreading poison against society: Rajasthan Congress chief
text: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra on Wednesday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) is like a "hidden termite" which is hollowing the society by spreading "poison". The Congress leader added that the RSS enjoys power behind the curtain and is not participating in direct politics to skirt accountability.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Won't happen here: T'gana CM as K'taka minister quits over contractor's death
text:
A few days after Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa resigned over a contractor's death, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao said that such an incident would not take place in Telangana. 
"We have seen a minister losing his ministry in Karnataka but that will not happen in Telangana," KCR said. Contractor Santosh Patil was found dead at a hotel in Udupi.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Electricity deliberately curtailed during sehri & iftar: Ex J&K CM
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said electricity is deliberately being curtailed at sehri and iftar hours to hassle the Muslim population observing the holy month of Ramadan. He also weighed in on the loudspeaker row and said, "Why can't loudspeakers be allowed at mosques when they're being used in other places?"
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP-led NDA govt has failed, is a 'non-performing asset': KTR
text: TRS Working President KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said the BJP-led NDA government has failed on all fronts and has become a "non-performing asset". Even though the NDA government talked about "Aatmanirbhar Bharat" (self-reliant India), there has been no improvement in the living standards of the people, Rao said. TRS should play a key role in national politics, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cong appoints late ex-Himachal CM Virbhadra Singh's wife Pratibha as state chief
text: Congress has appointed Lok Sabha MP from Mandi Pratibha Virbhadra Singh as President of Himachal Pradesh Congress Committee. Notably, Singh is the wife of late former Himachal Pradesh CM Virbhadra Singh, who was at the top post for 21 years. Moreover, Congress has appointed Mukesh Agnihotri and Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu as CLP Leader and Chairman of the Campaign Committee, respectively.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Old wine, old friends still best: Sidhu on pic with Prashant Kishor
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Tuesday met Prashant Kishor after he declined the offer to join the party and said that "old wine, old gold and old friends" are still the best. After declining Congress' offer, Prashant Kishor said that the party needs "leadership and collective will" to fix deep-rooted structural problems through transformational reforms.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Action to continue against those trying to spread fake news: Anurag Thakur
text: A day after the government said it has blocked some YouTube news channels, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Tuesday said such actions will continue against those who spread misinformation and propaganda. "Those trying to spread this kind of propaganda, fake news, myths and fear, strict action will be taken in future, too. We cannot compromise on country’s security," Thakur added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Been told BJP is paying poor Muslim boys for stone pelting: Digvijaya
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said that he has been told that some poor Muslim boys are being paid by workers of the Bharatiya Janata Party for stone pelting. "These are not facts so I am not accusing anyone. I'm checking the information and will then speak," the Congress leader said in a video.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Both Anil Deshmukh, Nawab Malik have been framed: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that whether it’s former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh or Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik, both have been "framed". "The Chandiwal Commission has submitted the report to the government. I have not seen it but we are saying from the beginning that the accusations are false," Raut added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Mathura unclean due to lack of sanitation mechanism: MP Hema Malini
text: Hema Malini, who is the BJP MP from UP's Mathura, said the city isn't very clean as crores of pilgrims visit it and there's a lack of mechanism for maintaining cleanliness. Malini, who was speaking at a public event in Gujarat, said, "I've tried and have been trying to change many things. Our (UP) CM Yogiji is helping a lot."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP, VHP hold protest march in Raj against Alwar temple demolition
text: BJP, VHP and other Hindu organisations on Wednesday held a protest march in Rajasthan against the demolition of a 300-year-old Shiva temple in Alwar. BJP MP Balaknath said, "We've demanded...action against involved officers, construction of the demolished temple and resignation of Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot." Notably, the state government has suspended three officials over the temple's demolition.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Political asylum only for homeless, I have home in Cong: KV Thomas
text: Congress leader KV Thomas on Wednesday rejected CPI(M) Kerala secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan's invitation to join the party, stating that he has a home in Congress, adding that political asylum is for the homeless. "Party positions are like tables and chairs. If that is taken away and I am given a stool, I have no problem with that," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Soft power has to be complemented by hard power: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that soft power has to be complemented by hard power to become a strong nation. "Any nation requires hard power to stay relevant, and to exist beyond boundaries, a nation needs to have soft power," he added. "In last few decades, India is emerging as hard power and expanding soft power through cinema," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Mumbai Police Commissioner wants to join Shiv Sena: Kirit Somaiya
text: BJP's Kirit Somaiya alleged that Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey ordered a police officer not to register his FIR as he wants to join Shiv Sena after 1.5 months. "We will go to Governor soon and if necessary also to HC to discuss this matter," Somaiya said. On Sunday, Somaiya had alleged that he was attacked by Shiv Sena's "gundas".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong has to put its house in order with or without consultant: Digvijaya
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Wednesday said that ultimately the party has to move and put its house in order, with or without a consultant. His remark came a day after both poll strategist Prashant Kishor and the Congress announced that Kishor has declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hope SC will reverse laws applied to J&K after Art 370 abrogation: Mufti
text: Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti said on Tuesday that she hopes SC will reverse all laws extended to Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) after Article 370 was repealed. Mufti's remarks came after SC agreed to hear pleas challenging the law used to scrap Article 370 in July. Centre revoked Article 370 and bifurcated J&K into two union territories in 2019.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Utter abuse of law: Kumar Vishvas as he seeks to quash FIR against him
text: Calling the FIR registered against him by the Punjab Police as an "utter abuse of the process of law", former AAP leader Kumar Vishvas has moved the Punjab and Haryana High Court, seeking to quash it. Punjab Police filed an FIR against him on April 12 for making provocative statements against Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: No one is punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that no one was being punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa. Accusing Devendra Fadnavis of misleading people on the Hanuman Chalisa issue, he said, "Trying to get inside someone else's home and destroying their peace is wrong." MP Navneet Rana and her husband were arrested after they threatened to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM's home.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Mamata Banerjee has killed democracy in WB: BJP's Tejasvi Surya
text: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya, who led BJP workers' protest rally against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday, said that Banerjee has killed democracy in the state, adding that "she has become Hitler". Surya said, "This [TMC] is a dictatorial government. We're being stripped of our right." This comes after the state police dispersed protesting BJP workers using water cannon.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Guj MLA Mevani sent to 5-day police custody in policewoman assault case
text: An Assam Court has sent Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani to five-day police custody after he was re-arrested for allegedly assaulting a policewoman. Mevani was initially arrested over allegedly objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi and was granted bail on Monday. His lawyer said the second arrest took place less than 30 minutes after he got bail in the first case.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Cong panel recommends removal of KV Thomas from all his posts
text: Congress' disciplinary committee on Tuesday recommended the removal of veteran party leader KV Thomas from all party posts. The move comes weeks after Thomas and fellow party leader Sunil Jakhar were issued show-cause notices for alleged anti-party activities. Thomas was served the notice after he attended a CPI(M) event in Kerala's Kannur earlier this month despite Congress' disapproval.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Nothing out of syllabus: Raj minister on Cong-related questions in exam
text: A day after the Union Ministry of Education wrote to the Rajasthan government over six Congress-related questions in Class XII state Board examination, Education Minister BD Kalla said that nothing was out of syllabus. "The RBSE (Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education) is an autonomous body and there is no interference from the state government," Kalla added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP govt in MP couldn't even supply drinking water in 18 yrs: Cong
text: Congress on Monday criticised the BJP-led Madhya Pradesh government over its inability to provide clean drinking water despite ruling for 18 years. State Congress media department President Jitu Patwari claimed that over 10 lakh water taps were still dry. He further alleged corruption in water projects saying the government is pressurising contractors to buy pipes from three specific companies.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: 'Hate-in-India', Make-in-India can't coexist: Rahul Gandhi to PM Modi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted about the exit of some global brands from India. "Modi ji, Hate-in-India and Make-in-India can't coexist!" he wrote on Twitter. The former Congress chief also shared a picture showing seven global brands, including Chevrolet, Harley Davidson, Man Trucks, Fiat, United Motors, Ford and Datsun, which have exited the country.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Product of 'parivarvad' can't be sold: BJP on Prashant Kishor not joining Cong
text: Reacting to the Congress' announcement that poll strategist Prashant Kishor has declined the offer to join the party, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress' agenda is "parivar bachao (save the family)". "If the product is bad, no matter how good a salesman (might) be...you can't sell the product of parivarvad (dynasty politics) past its expiry date," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Action should be taken if Twitter interferes with free speech in India: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said if Twitter is found either "interfering" with free speech in India or the opposite by permitting hate speech and abuse, then the IT committee should take action. "On Elon Musk: Who owns which social media company is not our concern. What matters is what they do and how," Tharoor tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Country needs alternative agenda, not political regrouping: T'gana CM
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday said the country needs alternative agenda and not political fronts or political realignment. While addressing members on 21st foundation day of Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), Rao said that he had turned down the idea of communist leaders to 'dislodge' the BJP, adding, the focus should not be on bringing down any party.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: K'taka Home Minister protecting PSI scam accused: DK Shivakumar
text: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra is protecting the main accused in the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "Government should give a notice to Jnanendra...for providing protection to Divya Hagaragi (prime accused)," he said. CM Basavaraj Bommai had earlier said that everything related to the PSI scam would be probed.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Cong MLA's son held for submitting fake papers to courts in rape case
text: Madhya Pradesh Congress MLA Murli Morwal's son Karan Morwal, who's been accused of rape, was arrested in Indore on Tuesday for submitting fake medical papers to courts. Karan forged documents while applying for anticipatory bail, claiming to have been admitted to hospital on day of alleged crime. He was previously arrested in case in October 2021 but released on bail.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Be wary of parties trying to divide people on caste, communal lines: KCR
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) on Tuesday said that people should be wary of the political parties that are trying to "divide" on caste and communal lines. "India is a great nation which treats people of all communities, castes and religions equally. If this harmony is disturbed, we would be lost forever," Rao added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tolerance inbuilt in Indian democracy: Pradhan on Hanuman Chalisa issue
text: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said tolerance is inbuilt in the Indian democracy. His remark came while he was speaking about the recent issue over Hanuman Chalisa’s recital. "In our country, tolerance is spoken about and written about. Sometimes, we also receive suggestions on it from abroad but I feel that it is in-built in our democracy," Pradhan added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong panel recommends ex-Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar's suspension for 2 yrs
text: The Congress disciplinary committee on Tuesday recommended suspension of its former Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar from the organisation for two years over anti-party activities. The panel has also recommended that veteran party leader from Kerala, KV Thomas, be removed from all party posts. The final call on the panel's recommendations will be taken by Congress President Sonia Gandhi.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Prashant Kishor declines offer to join Congress
text: Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala on Tuesday announced that poll strategist Prashant Kishor has declined Congress' offer to join the party. ''Following a presentation & discussions with Sh Prashant Kishor, Congress President has constituted an Empowered Action Group 2024 & invited him to join the party as part of the group with defined responsibility. He declined," he tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: More than me Congress needs leadership: Prashant Kishor after declining to join party
text: After declining to join Congress, poll strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "In my humble opinion, more than me the party needs leadership and collective will to fix the deep rooted structural problems through transformational reforms." He declined the offer to join the party's Empowered Action Group and also to take responsibility for elections.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Thanks for giving me credit for the term 'multi-alignment': Tharoor to Jaishankar
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday posted a selfie with External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar from the Raisina Dialogue 2022 in Delhi. "Thanks for publicly giving me credit for the term 'Multi-alignment' (in the context of India's foreign policy) which I floated 15 years ago," said Tharoor. The term didn't have many takers 15 years ago, Tharoor said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Mumbai Police video shows MP-MLA couple having tea in custody after ill-treatment claim
text: After Amravati MP Navneet Rana alleged "inhumane treatment" by police, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey shared a video showing Navneet and her husband MLA Ravi Rana having tea in the Khar Police Station. "Do we say anything more," the Police chief captioned the video. Meanwhile, the Union Home Ministry has sought a factual report from Maharashtra government over Navneet's allegation.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: J'khand CM used his position to give industrial land to wife: Ex-CM
text: Former Jharkhand CM and BJP leader Raghubar Das on Monday alleged that state CM Hemant Soren, who holds Industries portfolio, used his position to get 11 acres of land in Ranchi's industrial area allotted to his wife Kalpana. He claimed that Soren's political representative and media adviser were also given mining leases. "[Soren] is supposed to give answers," he said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Anil Deshmukh gets clean chit in money laundering case
text: Chandiwal Commission has given a clean chit to  former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case. The one member high-level enquiry commission was chaired by Justice (retired) Kailash Chandiwal to probe corruption allegations levelled by former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh against Deshmukh. The commission's report was also submitted to CM Uddhav Thackeray.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Mumbai Police filed fake FIR in my name: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya
text: Former BJP MP Kirit Somaiya on Tuesday claimed that a fake FIR was filed in his name at Khar Police Station in Mumbai which he had not even signed. Somaiya criticised Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey over the issue and also claimed that Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray had sent some "goons" to attack him.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Unique incident in India's history: Kejriwal on Delhi-Punjab knowledge agreement
text: Delhi CM and AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal signed a Knowledge Sharing Agreement with the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government and said, "It is a unique incident in the history of India." "Governments are signing an agreement to share knowledge...our goal is to learn from each other and move forward. It's a big development," he said soon after signing the agreement.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Will resign after meeting my father: RJD MLA Tej Pratap Yadav
text: RJD MLA from Bihar's Hasanpur Tej Pratap Yadav on Monday tweeted that he will submit his resignation soon after meeting his father and party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav. The MLA, however, did not clarify if he'll be resigning from party membership, his post or both. "I followed my father's footsteps and gave respect to all the party workers," Tej said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: If anyone wants to chant Hanuman Chalisa do it in homes, temples: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said if anyone wants to chant Hanuman Chalisa then they can do it in their homes or temples. "Devendra Fadnavis (BJP leader) is misleading people. No one is punished for chanting Hanuman Chalisa," Raut added. "Trying to get inside someone else's home and destroy peace to chant Hanuman Chalisa is wrong," Raut stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hope central leaders find way so that I continue to remain in Cong: Hardik Patel
text: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Tuesday said he is currently with the party and "hoped" that the central leaders find a way so that he continues to remain in the Congress. "I am in Congress currently...There are others who want Hardik to leave Congress. They want to break my morale," Patel tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Karunanidhi's birthday to be celebrated as govt function in TN: CM Stalin
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Tuesday that late DMK supremo and ex-CM M Karunanidhi's birth anniversary (June 3) will henceforth be marked as a government function. Stalin, who is Karunanidhi's son, added that stalwart's statue will be unveiled at Chennai's Omandurar estate. Karunanidhi, a five-time CM, had never lost an election in his life, Stalin also pointed out.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Cong should take 'backseat' in states where regional parties are formidable: Tejashwi
text: Talking about forming a strong Opposition alliance against BJP in the 2024 general elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav said that Congress should take a "backseat" in states where regional parties are a formidable force. Congress must focus on over 200 seats on which it is in a direct fight with the saffron party, Yadav added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: AAP protests outside Guj Vidhan Sabha over school fee hike; 8 held
text: Eight AAP members, including state general secretary Manoj Sorathiya, were detained outside Gujarat Vidhan Sabha in Gandhinagar during a protest over a fee hike in private schools on Monday. The party also shared pictures and videos of the incident online. "State government is misusing police and administration to illegally pick up AAP workers...protesting for the sake of parents," Sorathiya said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Police to question Tejasvi Surya over attack on Kejriwal's house
text: Delhi Police has asked BJP MP Tejasvi Surya to join the investigation into the recent attack on CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence. The investigating officer has called Surya, who is also Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) chief, for questioning on April 28 at Civil Lines police station, according to police. Surya has reportedly agreed to join the probe.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Arrange Ayodhya trips for Pune residents: Patil to ex-corporators
text:
Ahead of Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) elections, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil
has urged ex-corporators to maintain a "public connect" with people. Patil added that the former corporators should arrange trips to Ayodhya for the residents, where construction of the Ram Mandir is underway. "[BJP] can win PMC elections when the organisation is alive and powerful," he added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Police use water cannon to diffuse BJP protesting against Mamata govt
text: West Bengal Police on Tuesday dispersed BJP workers who were taking out a protest rally, led by BJP's Tejasvi Surya against Mamata Banerjee led government in the state with a water cannon. Meanwhile, Tejasvi Surya was on Tuesday asked by the Delhi Police to join the investigation in connection with alleged vandalism at Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Lok Sabha Speaker seeks details of Maha MP Navneet Rana's arrest
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has through the Ministry of Home Affairs asked for a "factual note" from the Maharashtra government on the arrest of Amravati MP Navneet Rana. This comes after Rana sent a letter to Birla alleging "inhumane treatment" by the police. Navneet was arrested after she gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside the CM's home.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Jakhar wishes Congress luck as panel recommends his 2-year suspension
text: Shortly after the Congress disciplinary panel recommended his two-year suspension on Tuesday, former Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar wished his party good luck. The party's disciplinary committee had on April 11 given a show-cause notice to Jakhar for alleged anti-party activities and sought a reply within a week. He had called former Punjab chief minister Charanjit Singh Channi a liability.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Those teaching Hindutva were hiding during Babri demolition: Uddhav
text: Speaking on the ongoing Azaan and Hanuman Chalisa controversy, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that those teaching him Hindutva were hiding in a "rat hole" when Babri Masjid was demolished. The decision on construction of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya was not taken by the BJP government but it was Supreme Court that paved the way for the same, he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Over 45 cr people lost hope of getting job due to PM's 'masterstrokes': Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday alleged that over 45 crore people have lost hope of getting a job due to PM Modi's 'masterstrokes'. "New India's new slogan - har ghar berozegaari, ghar ghar berozegaari (there is unemployment in every household)," he tweeted. Rahul also cited a news report that claimed 2.1 crore jobs were lost in last five years.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Upset with attitude of Cong disciplinary committee: Sunil Jakhar
text: After being issued a show-cause notice by the Congress disciplinary committee, senior Punjab Congress leader Sunil Jakhar has said that he is angry and upset with the attitude of the committee. "For years, I have acted as a disciplined worker of the Congress party," Jakhar, who has been summoned for allegedly making controversial statements against the party leaders, said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP tries to mislead people when governance fails: KTR
text: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said the BJP uses a “diversionary tactic” of raising issues such as Hanuman Chalisa and Hijab in different states in an attempt to “mislead people when governance fails". "When governance fails, the party in power, especially the BJP, tries to mislead people of the country," Rao added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Amid rumours of leaving Cong, Vijender Singh posts pic with Priyanka
text: Amid the ongoing rumours of boxer Vijender Singh leaving the Congress for AAP, the 36-year-old Olympic medallist posted a picture with senior Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday. "It was wonderful conversing with dynamic leader @priyankagandhi ji who is doing so much for the betterment of the youth. Her progressive approach can help us gain newer heights," read the caption.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: PM Modi gives equal respect to all CMs of India: Tripura CM
text: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb said that PM Narendra Modi gives equal respect to all CMs. "PM Modi gives equal importance to the CM of Tripura and CM of Uttar Pradesh, there is no disparity," Deb said. "PM specially sanctioned ₹7 crore for constructing a high-tech building for the old age homes. This is the vision of PM," he said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: HC to hear plea against lifetime minister status to ex-Goa CM
text: The Bombay High Court has agreed to hear a plea challenging the lifetime Cabinet minister status accorded to former Goa CM Pratapsingh Rane. Rane was bestowed the status in January ahead of the Assembly elections in the state. "The Constitution does not provide for conferring Cabinet [minister] status on any individual other than a current minister," argued a lawyer.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Navneet Rana alleges 'casteist abuse' in jail, says 'not allowed to drink water'
text: The MP from Maharashtra's Amravati Navneet Rana has alleged she was denied "basic human rights" and "abused in the most filthy language" over her caste in jail. Rana, writing to Lok Sabha Speaker, said she was denied drinking water only because of her caste. "I was told...'we don't let people from 'neechi zaat' Scheduled Castes use our bathrooms'," she alleged.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: NCP leader seeks permission to chant religious prayers at PM's house
text: NCP leader Fahmida Khan wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday seeking permission to chant prayers of all religions, including namaz, Hanuman Chalisa, Namokar Mantra and Guru Granth Sahib, outside PM Narendra Modi's residence in Delhi. "If Hindutva, Jainism...[can help] the country...reduce inflation, unemployment [and] starvation, I would like to do it," she said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: HC refuses to quash FIR against Amravati MP and her MLA husband
text: The Bombay High Court on Monday refused to quash an FIR filed against Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana, both arrested in connection with the Hanuman Chalisa row. The concerned FIR alleged that the couple jostled and argued with the police when they were asked to get in the police vehicle after being arrested.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Centre writes to Raj over Class 12 exam paper questions on Congress
text: Union Education Ministry has written a letter to the Rajasthan government asking for its input on news reports that the state board's Class 12 political science paper had six questions about Congress' "achievements". The questions asked included- 'Discuss in brief the Congress as a Social and Ideological Alliance' and 'Which party dominated the first three general elections in India?'
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: MP Navneet Rana being mistreated at Mumbai's Byculla jail: Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis alleged MP Navneet Rana was being mistreated at Byculla jail, not given drinking water and wasn't allowed to go to washroom in night. "The whole government machinery is scared of one woman," Fadnavis said. Navneet and her MLA husband were arrested after they gave a call for chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's home.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Ex-Mumbai Mayor arrested over attack on Somaiya, granted bail later
text: Former Mumbai Mayor and Shiv Sena leader Vishwanath Mahadeshwar and three others were arrested on Monday in connection with an attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya. However, the ex-Mayor was granted bail on medical grounds later, Mumbai Police said. Somaiya had on Saturday claimed that he was injured in an alleged stone-pelting incident by Shiv Sena workers in Mumbai.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: We know how to crush 'Dadagiri': Maha CM on Hanuman Chalisa issue
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has reacted to the Hanuman Chalisa controversy and said, "It's being said that we've ignored Hindutva. Is Hindutva a dhoti or what? Our Hindutva is 'Gada Dhari' like Lord Hanuman's Gada." He added, "If you want to recite Hanuman Chalisa, call and come home. But if you resort to 'Dadagiri', we know how to crumble it."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: CBSE is Central Board of Suppressing Education: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday termed the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) as the 'Central Board of Suppressing Education'. This comes a few days after CBSE removed several chapters from the history and political science syllabus of classes 10 and 12. He also termed the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh as the 'Rashtriya Shiksha Shredder' for modification of the syllabus.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No hope from PM Modi's Jammu visit: Mehbooba Mufti
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said her party did not see any hope in Prime Minister Narendra Modi's speech in Jammu. "He (PM) comes to visit Jammu and Kashmir, which he left no stone unturned to destroy. Our rights have been snatched. We have been reduced from a state to a Union Territory," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: I'm upset with party's leadership in Gujarat: Cong's Hardik Patel
text: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Monday said he isn't upset with Congress leaders Rahul or Priyanka Gandhi but with the party's state leadership. "Elections are coming up...Work should be done together with honest and strong people. They should be given positions," Patel said. He had earlier said his position in Congress is like a groom forced into 'nasbandi'.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cong has been tried, tested & dusted; see no future for it: KT Rama Rao
text: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday said that Congress has been tried, tested and dusted, adding that he sees no future for the party. "We've no relations with Congress. It's a redundant institution. The people of India gave them opportunities for over 50 years. The country has been let down by Congress and BJP," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Centre should make rules about loudspeakers: Maharashtra minister
text: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Monday said that "the Centre should make rules regarding loudspeakers at the national level, then the problem arising in the states will not take place." He along with Environment Minister Aditya Thackeray held a presser to discuss the state's law and order situation. The statement comes amid the loudspeaker controversy in Maharashtra.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: Charge us with sedition for reciting Hanuman Chalisa: Fadnavis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said he'll chant the Hanuman Chalisa everyday and dared the Maharashtra government to charge him with sedition. Referring to the arrest of Amravati MP Navneet Rana and MLA Ravi Rana, Fadnavis said, "Will Hanuman Chalisa be recited in Pakistan, if not Maharashtra? The way Navneet and Ravi were treated is condemnable. What was their crime?"
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Prashant Kishor hasn't said if he's joining Congress: KT Rama Rao
text: Telangana Rashtra Samithi's (TRS) KT Rama Rao reacted to speculations of poll strategist Prashant Kishor's induction to Congress, stating that Kishor hadn't confirmed if he was joining party. Rao earlier called Congress a "redundant institution", adding that TRS has no ties with it. Notably, TRS has hired Prashant Kishor's firm I-PAC to lead its campaign in 2023 state Assembly polls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Didn't mean to incite religious tensions: Navneet Rana to Om Birla
text: Amravati MP Navneet Rana wrote to Lok Sabha speaker Om Birla saying that she wanted to "rekindle the flame of Hindutva in Shiv Sena" and didn't "mean to incite religious tensions" by chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence. Rana also stated that she invited Thackeray to chant Hanuman Chalisa adding that her actions were not against him.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: Power comes and goes, some are anxious after losing Maha polls: Pawar
text: NCP supremo Sharad Pawar commented on the BJP by saying that some people are "anxious" after losing the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly polls in 2019. "Power comes and goes...Some people are getting anxious...because before the state election, claims were made of coming again to power but it did not happen and hence they are anxious," Pawar said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP forms 'weak booth committee' team ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls
text: BJP has constituted 'weak booth committee' team in a bid to make party stronger ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections, party leader Dilip Ghosh said on Monday. "There are four members per committee spread across [India]. The purpose of [this] is to expand BJP's presence wherever it's weak," Ghosh added. BJP's Baijayant Jay Panda also chaired meeting in this regard.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Cong to constitute 'empowered action group 2024' for Lok Sabha polls
text: Congress will constitute an 'empowered action group 2024' to address political challenges ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, party leader Randeep Surjewala announced on Monday. The decision was taken after a meeting on poll strategist Prashant Kishor's proposal to revamp the party. Notably, this also comes amid speculations of Kishor joining Congress, although no formal announcement has been made yet.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: No 'political twist' in Bihar, RJD not aligned with BJP, allies: Tejashwi
text: Reacting to speculations about 'political re-alignment' in Bihar after CM Nitish Kumar attended a Rashtriya Janata Dal-hosted (RJD) Iftar party, Tejashwi Yadav said that RJD has never aligned itself with RSS, BJP, or its allies. He added that RJD's opinions are not formed on "ideology of convenience". He further stated that politicians across party lines had been invited to event.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Open to implementing Uniform Civil Code but won't rush: Himachal CM
text: Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur on Monday said that the implementation of the Uniform Civil Code in the neighbouring state of Uttarakhand has sent a "good message". The Himachal Pradesh government is "open to implementing it but it won't rush," he said. "We will examine the outcome of UCC in other states and then make a decision," Thakur said.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: BJP plans outreach programme to celebrate 8 yrs of PM Modi's govt
text: To mark the completion of eight years of PM Narendra Modi's government, a team of 12 senior BJP leaders met on Monday, to plan a big outreach programme. To celebrate the occasion, grand programmes will be organised all over the country. The meeting included Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP general secretaries among others.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: Don't get involved in civil disputes: Owaisi to party workers
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has asked his party workers not to get involved in civil disputes, especially after an AIMIM corporator Nazir Ahmed Honyal was arrested in the Hubballi stone-pelting incident in Karnataka. "I have come here to advise you all to not interfere in any kind of land or construction issues...Let the law take its own course," Owaisi said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: TMC will emerge as BJP's alternative in Assam, form govt in 2026: Bora
text: Newly-appointed Trinamool Congress (TMC) Assam unit chief Ripun Bora asserted on Monday that the party will emerge as BJP's alternative in Assam and form the government in 2026 state Assembly polls. He claimed that residents of Assam will embrace TMC as it's the only opposition party in the state. Bora resigned from Congress and joined TMC on April 17.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: CM Bommai should be held responsible: DK Shivakumar on PSI scam
text: Amid the controversies surrounding the police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka, Congress state President DK Shivakumar has criticised the CM Basavaraj Bommai-led state government. "Why did the CM say in the assembly that no mistakes happened in PSI recruitment? He should also be held responsible for lies. Why did he give the case to CID now?" Shivakumar asked.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Provide relief to farmers, don't make false promises: Punjab Cong chief to Kejriwal
text: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja on Sunday asked AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal to provide relief to the farmers instead of making "fake" and "false" claims and promises. "Nobody stops you and your party’s government in Punjab from providing relief to farmers which you promised, why are you not doing that?" Raja added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hindutva is culture, not chaos: Shiv Sena on Hanuman Chalisa issue
text: Hindutva is a culture and not chaos, Shiv Sena said in an editorial in its mouthpiece, Saamana, on Monday. The statement comes amid the ongoing Hanuman Chalisa issue in the state. "The ruckus that the Bharatiya Janata Party has started in the name of Hindutva at the moment cannot be supported," Shiv Sena said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No alternative to TRS in Telangana, Opposition is hopeless: KTR
text: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) working President KT Rama Rao said that there is no alternative to the TRS in Telangana for the next year's state Assembly elections. "We have worked hard and delivered on the promises we made. The Opposition has been hopeless," he said. "I believe there's no Opposition to TRS," he added.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: BJP-AGP alliance wins 58 of 60 seats in Guwahati civic body polls; PM thanks voters
text: The BJP along with its ally Asom Gana Parishad (AGP) won 58 out of the total 60 seats in Assam's Guwahati Municipal Corporation (GMC) elections. While the BJP won in 52 wards, the AGP secured six wards. BJP had already won in three wards unopposed. PM Narendra Modi thanked voters of Guwahati for giving a "resounding mandate" to the party.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP seeks action against Atishi over Kerala officials visit claim
text: The Delhi BJP unit has sought action against AAP MLA Atishi after she said that officials from Kerala had visited the national capital to study the "Delhi model" of education. Earlier, Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty had said that the state government hadn't sent anyone. "It's surprising how Atishi can make such false claims," Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Kapoor said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: At least spare the dead: Cong to Rana Kapoor for allegations on Patel, Deora
text: Congress termed Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor's allegations against late leaders Murli Deora and Ahmed Patel, and party leader, Priyanka Gandhi, "political vendetta". "At least spare the dead," Congress said. Kapoor alleged he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka for ₹2 crore for funding Sonia's treatment and Patel told him, "You're (Kapoor) doing a good deed".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: KCR ropes in Prashant Kishor's I-PAC to campaign for 2023 T'gana polls
text: CM K Chandrashekar Rao's Telangana Rashtra Samithi has roped in political strategist Prashant Kishor's firm I-PAC to lead its campaign for the 2023 state polls, party leader KT Rama Rao said. "I-PAC is working for us officially. We aren't working with Prashant Kishor but we are working with I-PAC," he added. This comes amid reports of Kishor joining Congress.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Women's Commission can't issue notice to Chandrababu Naidu: TDP
text: Telugu Desam Party's (TDP) Varla Ramaiah has claimed that Andhra Pradesh Women's Commission chairperson Vasireddy Padma doesn't have authority to issue notices to Chandrababu Naidu and ex-party MLA Bonda Uma. The commission issued notices after Padma accused Naidu of outraging her modesty and insulting her at a Vijayawada government hospital. They had assembled there to meet a gangrape survivor.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: SP MLA Ravidas Mehrotra not allowed to meet Azam Khan in UP jail
text: Samajwadi Party MLA Ravidas Mehrotra has claimed that officials in UP's Sitapur jail didn't allow him to meet party leader Azam Khan who is lodged there. He added that they didn't even agree to hand over the Iftar food which he had taken for him. Notably, Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia chief and Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal Yadav met Khan on Friday.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: T'gana only state to have given accreditation to 18,000 journalists: TRS MLC
text: TRS MLC K Kavitha on Sunday said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao had allotted ₹100 crore for the welfare of journalists in Telangana, adding that it's the only state to have given accreditation to 18,000 journalists. She stated that ₹1 lakh will be given to families of deceased journalists. Additionally, their kin will receive a ₹3,000 pension for five years.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Kerala officials keen to implement our education model in their state: AAP's Atishi
text: Educationists and dignitaries from Kerala visited a government school in Delhi’s Kalkaji on Saturday to observe the education system there. They were hosted by Kalkaji MLA and AAP leader Atishi. "It was wonderful to host officials from Kerala at one of our schools in Kalkaji. They were keen to understand and implement our education model in their state," Atishi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Loopholes in anti-defection law, needs amendment: Vice President
text: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu called for an amendment in the anti-defection law, stating that those lawmakers switching to other parties shouldn't be offered other posts before they are re-elected. "The anti-defection law has certain loopholes. It allows wholesale defection," Naidu added. "Most of the cases of defection are not effectively dealt with and are dealt with affection," Naidu stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Attempts being made to divide Tamil Nadu on basis of caste & religion: Stalin
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Sunday said attempts are being made to divide the state on the basis of caste and religion. "Some people want to stop the development of the state by dividing us. The people of Tamil Nadu should realise this and act," Stalin added. "Only a peaceful country can achieve all kinds of development," Stalin stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Accept money KCR gives, his bank balance will reduce: T'gana BJP chief
text: While accusing Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao of misappropriating government funds, state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay said that the people of state should accept the money that he distributes. "His bank balance will reduce...or else he will become richer and...you will become poor...Whatever the money he is distributing in election it is your money given by...PM Modi," he added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Ranas’ arrest display of arrogance of power: Devendra Fadnavis
text: Following Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's arrest on Saturday, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that power has gone to the head of the state government. "The Ranas had come to Mumbai to recite Hanuman Chalisa. The state government’s act is a display of arrogance. It shows power has gone to its head," Fadnavis added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Be it democracy or development, J&K is setting example: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday hailed the development work done in Jammu and Kashmir in the last two to three years. "Be it democracy or development, today Jammu and Kashmir is setting a new example," Modi said, addressing the public in Jammu on National Panchayati Raj Day. Many private investors are interested in coming to J&K, he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Incidents of violence in country systematic conspiracy of BJP: Chavan
text: Former Chief Minister of Maharashtra Prithviraj Chavan on Sunday said that the incidents of violence in the country are a systematic conspiracy of the BJP. "The BJP is deliberately trying to disrupt law and order. No protests are reported from the senior level of the BJP. This means that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has tacitly agreed to it," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Police allowed attack under MVA govt pressure: Fadnavis on Somaiya attack
text: Following the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya, former Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that police allowed Shiv Sena workers to carry it out under the pressure of the Maha Vikas Aghadi government. Maharashtra BJP president Chandrakant Patil alleged that the MVA government is doing violence with the help of police.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP govt doing whatever they want, killing democracy: Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday met the family of the female Inspector who died by suicide in Amethi and said that police are taking such steps because they have to work under pressure. "Yogi Adityanath government is doing whatever they want and killing democracy," he said, adding that SP will raise the matter in the upcoming Assembly session.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 6 Shiv Sena workers arrested for ruckus outside Maha MP's house
text: The Khar Police on Sunday arrested six Shiv Sena workers for allegedly creating a ruckus outside Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's residence in Mumbai. This comes after hundreds of Shiv Sena workers protested outside the couple's house on Saturday after the latter declared to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's house in Mumbai.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Complete breakdown of law & order: Chidambaram on bulldozer demolitions
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said that the recent bulldozer-enabled demolitions reflect a "complete breakdown of law and order", alleging that the method of removing encroachments is aimed at Muslims and the poor. He further said that the BJP leaders' justification of bulldozer-enabled demolitions "flies in the face of the law."
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 10 more Shiv Sena workers arrested for ruckus outside Maha MP's house
text: Khar Police on Sunday arrested 10 more Shiv Sena workers for allegedly creating a ruckus outside Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana's house in Mumbai. "A total of 16 workers have been arrested...Police will present everyone in the court [on Monday]," Mumbai Police said. Both Ravi and Navneet have been sent to 14-days judicial custody.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ex-Cong MLA Manilal Vaghela joins BJP ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls
text: Former Congress MLA Manilal Vaghela joined the BJP on Sunday in the Vadgam town of Banaskantha district ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections due this year. Vaghela had resigned from Congress last year, citing displeasure over the party sidelining him. Notably, Vaghela had won from Vadgam in 2012 Assembly polls but was denied a ticket from the constituency in 2017 elections.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Rahul Gandhi, Congress biggest strength of PM Modi: KT Rama Rao
text: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday alleged that Congress is the main reason BJP is getting stronger day by day. He added, "Rahul Gandhi and Congress party is the biggest strength of (PM) Narendra Modi." KTR has further challenged PM Modi and the BJP to take responsibility for mass killings and conflicts or communal incidents happening across the country.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Shiv Sena workers still giving threats: Somaiya over 'attack'
text: Following the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya, a BJP Mumbai unit delegation will meet the Union Home Secretary in New Delhi on Monday, the state BJP said. "We'll give a detailed report and demand a special team for inquiry," Somaiya said. "Fake FIR was registered against me. Shiv Sena workers are still giving threats," Somaiya stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong extorts money from powerful people: Malviya on painting issue
text: BJP's Amit Malviya has accused Congress of "extorting" money from people in positions of power. He alleged that Congress was selling India's highest civilian honour. Malviya's remarks came after Yes Bank co-founder Rana Kapoor told ED he was compelled to buy MF Husain painting from Priyanka Gandhi at ₹2 crore, adding that he wouldn't be considered for Padma Bhushan otherwise.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Gujarat Cong leader Gadhvi joins AAP, says 'starting new inning'
text: Gujarat Congress leader Kailash Gadhvi joined Aam Aadmi Party in Ahmedabad on Sunday. Addressing the media at the party office, he said, "Today, I'm starting a new inning", adding, "I'm not here to talk about old things but talk about a new Gujarat". Gadhvi had earlier met AAP convener Arvind Kejriwal and said he'll join the party with 300 supporters.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: MVA govt propagating violence in front of police: Maharashtra BJP chief
text: After BJP leader Kirit Somaiya claimed that Shiv Sena’s "gundas" assaulted him with stones in presence of police persons, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil stated that now the MVA government is propagating violence in front of police. "The attack on Kirit Somaiya was not just an attempt to threaten him but to kill him," Patil added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Police to take action against those found guilty: Maha HM over 'attack' on Somaiya
text: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Sunday said that a probe is underway into the alleged attack on BJP leader Kirit Somaiya by Shiv Sena workers. "It's true there was stone-pelting…Police will take appropriate action against those found guilty. A case has been registered in the matter," Patil added. Somaiya alleged that Shiv Sena "gundas" assaulted him with stones.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rajiv Gandhi introduced Panchayati Raj system, fulfilled Gandhiji’s dream: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi fulfilled Mahatma Gandhi’s dream of strengthening villages by giving the Panchayati Raj System to the country. "It was Mahatma Gandhi’s dream that the villages of the country should become strong," Rahul Gandhi tweeted on the occasion of the National Panchayati Raj Day.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Amravati MP & her MLA husband arrested amid Hanuman Chalisa recital row
text: Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana were arrested on Saturday from their home by Mumbai Police. This came hours after the couple cancelled their plan to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence. They have been booked under section 153 (A) (promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race etc), police said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: My resignation permanently with Sonia: Raj CM on leadership change rumours
text: Amid rumours of leadership change in Rajasthan Congress, CM Ashok Gehlot has said that his resignation letter is permanently present with party chief Sonia Gandhi. Gehlot said, "The CM will change when it has to be changed and no one will get to know anything about it." This came after Sachin Pilot met Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: I'm injured, Sena gundas assaulted me, wanted to kill me: Kirit Somaiya
text:
Bharatiya Janata Party leader Kirit Somaiya took to Twitter to say that Shiv Sena’s
“gundas” assaulted him with stones and wanted to kill him “in presence [of] 50 police persons, in compound/campus of Khar Police Station”. “I am injured...sitting in my car...Till action against police officials and...mafia Sena gundas is not taken, I will stay in my car,” he wrote.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: AAP claims Centre plans to demolish Delhi temple, holds protest
text: AAP on Saturday claimed that the BJP-run central government is planning to demolish Neelkanth Mahadev temple in Delhi's Sriniwaspuri and shared a purported notice by the Housing and Urban Affairs Ministry regarding the same. The party workers, including AAP MLA Atishi, also staged a protest there. "AAP won't allow bulldozers to run over a single temple in Delhi," Atishi said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Forced to buy ₹2-cr painting from Priyanka, money used for Sonia's treatment: Rana Kapoor
text: Yes Bank co-founder Rana Kapoor has told Enforcement Directorate he was "forced" to buy an MF Husain painting from Priyanka Gandhi for ₹2 crore. He added that the sale proceeds were utilised by Gandhi family for the medical treatment of Congress President Sonia Gandhi in New York. It was revealed in the chargesheet filed by ED in a special court.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP MP demands apology from Raj CM on 300-yr-old temple's demolition
text: After a 300-year-old Shiva temple was demolished in Rajasthan's Alwar, a delegation led by BJP MP Swami Sumedhanand Saraswati visited the spot to take stock of the situation. Saraswati demanded an apology from Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on the incident, adding that an FIR should be registered against the officials responsible. He further demanded that the temple should be reconstructed.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: If Ravan offers CM's post to Shiv Sena they will go with him also: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Narayan Rane said that the Shiv Sena would go "wherever there is power and money". "Shiv Sena leaders can go with anyone. If Ravan comes and offers them the CM post for five years then they will go with him also," Rane added. His remarks came amid the ongoing loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will induct ground-level leaders from BJP, Cong in Himachal: AAP
text: Aam Aadmi Party leader Satyendar Jain said that the party will induct ground-level leaders from the BJP and the Congress in Himachal Pradesh. "Only top leaders of BJP and Congress will remain and the rest we will clear. We are doing background checks and will only take good people. AAP will work honestly in Himachal Pradesh," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: No break for next 6 months: BJP to its workers ahead of Guj polls
text: BJP workers in Gujarat have been asked to work without a break for the next six months after May 4 to prepare for the upcoming Assembly elections in December, state party chief CR Patil said. He added they'll not be holding any programs from May 1 to 4 and that'll be the "only break...party workers will get" before the polls.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Unconstitutional: Athawale on MNS chief's warning over loudspeakers
text: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Saturday termed MNS chief Raj Thackeray's stand on loudspeakers as "unconstitutional". Calling Thackeray a "militant leader" Athawale said, "He can put...loudspeaker on temples but can't ask to remove them from mosques." Thackeray threatened to play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers if the state government didn't remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Cong, BJP both are responsible: Owaisi on temple demolition in Raj
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Saturday said that both the Congress and the BJP are equally responsible for the demolition of 300-year-old Shiva temple in Rajasthan's Alwar. Owaisi said, "I condemn the decision. The Municipality Board was headed by BJP and Congress government accepted the decision to demolish the [Alwar] temple." "They [both] should apologise to the public," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Amit Shah failed to protect Delhi from communal riots: Sharad Pawar
text: Speaking about the Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Union Home Minister Amit Shah "failed" to protect the national capital from communal riots. "Amit Shah should have taken steps to keep Delhi unified and undivided but he failed to do so. You have power but you can't even handle a city like Delhi," Pawar added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 'Himachal too will get honest govt,' Arvind Kejriwal tells CM Jairam Thakur
text: Replying to Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur's "Delhi's model is not acceptable in Himachal" comment, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said, "Delhi model means honest government." He further asserted, "Like Punjab and Delhi, now AAP will give honest government in Himachal...too." Jairam had earlier said societal and political circumstances in Delhi and Himachal are different.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Delhi BJP to ask AAP govt to rename 40 villages
text: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Saturday said that the party would ask the Aam Aadmi Party-led government to change the names of 40 villages, which "are a symbol of slavery", in the national capital. The villages include Hauz Khas, Masoodpur, Zamrudpur, Humayunpur, Begumpur, Yusuf Sarai and Fatehpur Beri, according to BJP members.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Razing of religious places, poor's houses weakens our Constitution: Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati has criticised the demolition of "religious places and residences of the poor" done by state governments of both, the BJP and Congress. "In (Congress-ruled) Rajasthan, demolition of a temple under the guise of encroachment and residences of poor in BJP-ruled state in the name of encroachment is disgusting politics. It weakens our Constitution," Mayawati tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Nothing political: Bihar CM Nitish on attending RJD's Iftar party
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, who attended an Iftar party hosted by RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Friday, dismissed speculations about changing political equations saying there was "nothing political" behind his decision. He added, "Many people are invited to such Iftar parties. What connection does it have with politics?" Notably, Kumar had last visited former CM Rabri Devi's residence in 2017.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Manipur media to boycott state govt, BJP news over unpaid ad dues
text: The media outlets in Manipur have decided to boycott news related to the state government and BJP unit over their respective unpaid advertisement dues from today, according to a joint statement by the state publishers and journalists' unions. Earlier, media outlets had threatened to boycott the state government, BJP unit and Congress unit if dues aren't paid by April 23.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: It is time to make Naya Himachal Pradesh: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that it is time to make 'Naya Himachal Pradesh'. Kejriwal, while addressing a rally in Kangra, requested the people to give AAP a chance to form government in the state. He added, "I urge all the good people in BJP and Congress to leave their parties and join...AAP."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP will hold early elections in Himachal & Gujarat, claims Kejriwal
text: Addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal claimed that the BJP will hold early elections in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. He, however, added that "it doesn't matter whenever BJP conducts elections, power should come in the hands of common man." "BJP is scared of AAP in Himachal and Gujarat...Actually they're scared of the public," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Mevani arrested for insulting religious sentiments: Assam Police
text: Assam Police have said that Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani was arrested for allegedly hurting the religious sentiments of a community in his tweets. "Primary offence committed by Jignesh Mevani under IPC 295(a) is insulting the sentiments of religion, through his tweets wherein he equated Nathuram Godse to Devata (God)," police said. The MLA was arrested by Assam Police on Wednesday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: TMC's Mondal skips CBI summons for 6th time in cattle smuggling case
text: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal on Saturday skipped summons by the CBI in connection with a cattle smuggling case. Mondal, who was discharged from a hospital on Saturday after suffering from breathing issues, cited health as the reason for being unable to appear today. Notably, this is the sixth time he has skipped a summon by the agency.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Everyone should demand Uniform Civil Code: UP Deputy CM Maurya
text: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya on Saturday said that everyone should demand and welcome Uniform Civil Code. He said, "UP government is also thinking in this direction...We're in favour of it and it's necessary for UP and...people of [India]." Earlier in March, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami had said his government has decided to implement the Uniform Civil Code.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: PM Modi set a target to make India number 1 in world by 2047: Shah
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a target of making India number one in the world by 2047, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said on Saturday. He made the comment at a function in Bihar. Separately, Shah, in a reference to RJD, said, "Mere avoidance of putting up posters of Lalu Prasad (Yadav) cannot erase...memories of the jungle raj."
author: Shailesh

headlines: Ripun Bora appointed Trinamool Congress' Assam unit president
text: West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee appointed Ripun Bora as the President of the All India Trinamool Congress Assam unit. TMC General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee issued a notice which stated that Mamata Banerjee has appointed Ripun Bora as Assam TMC's President with immediate effect. Ripun Bora left Congress and joined TMC on April 17.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Don't give us threats of imposing President's rule here: Sanjay Raut
text: Reacting to MP Navneet Rana's threat of chanting Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's residence, 'Matoshree' in Mumbai, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said, "If you try to come to our residence, then we also have the right to answer in the same language." "Don't give us threats of imposing President's rule here," Raut added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: BJP MLA's sons booked for assaulting forest guards in MP's Sheopur
text: The two sons of BJP MLA Sitaram Adivasi have been booked after they were allegedly seen assaulting forest department staff in MP's Sheopur in a viral video. The incident reportedly took place on Thursday when forest guards at Budhera forest range's Piprani post stopped the MLA's sons from illegally mining stones. Police said that both parties have filed a complaint.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP high command to decide on Cabinet expansion, rejig: K'taka CM
text: Amid rumours about Cabinet expansion or rejig in Karnataka, Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that the BJP high command would take a decision. "I will get to know about it only after discussion with the party high command," he said. This comes ahead of the Karnataka Assembly elections next year. There are 29 ministers in the state Cabinet, including Bommai.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Attempt by Shiv Sena, Maha CM to kill me: BJP leader as mob attacks car in Mumbai
text: BJP leader Mohit Kamboj has alleged that his car was attacked by a mob in Mumbai while returning home from a wedding, near Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence. "This was an attempt to kill me by the Shiv Sena and Maharashtra CM...to suppress my voice," Kamboj said. "Governance in Maharashtra proving to be worse than West Bengal," he added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Sena workers protest outside MLA-MP couple's home over 'Hanuman Chalisa' warning
text: Heavy police force was deployed outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence after independent MLA Ravi Rana and his wife independent MP Navneet Rana threatened to chant Hanuman Chalisa outside the premises. Shiv Sena workers on Saturday morning broke through barricades in protest and tried to enter the premises of the couple's residence and dared them to step outside, police said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Amarinder Singh Raja takes charge as Punjab Congress chief
text: Congress leader Amarinder Singh Raja on Friday took charge as Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee President. "Discipline, dedication and dialogue will be my 3-D mantra for working for and strengthening the party," he tweeted. "I hope the mistakes of the past will not be repeated now. There is a need to reinvent Congress," former Punjab Congress president Navjot Singh Sidhu said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Notice to MP over Hanuman Chalisa recitation outside Maha CM's house
text: After MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana said they plan to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside the residence of Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, they were sent a notice by the Mumbai Police. The notice was sent under Section 149 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, which allows the police to act in the interest of preventing cognisable offences.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: Over 6 cr members enrol for Cong's internal polls to elect new president
text: Over six crore Congress members have enrolled themselves to participate in the party's organisational elections, Congress Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said. "Around 2.6 crore members were enrolled through digital membership. Membership has been done through papers too," he said. The party will get a new president by the end of September 2022, Mistry further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Mauritius PM visits Varanasi, offers prayers at Vishwanath Temple
text: Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth, who is on an eight-day visit to India, offered prayers at Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Varanasi. On Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a bilateral meeting with Mauritius PM after the inauguration of the Global Ayush Summit. PM Modi and his Mauritius counterpart took part in a roadshow in Ahmedabad on Tuesday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Cong leader writes to CM Mamata on 'miserable' condition of Muslims in WB
text: West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee seeking her attention to the "pathetic and miserable condition of the Muslim minority" in the state. "Despite your government being in power in West Bengal for more than a decade, the minorities are still marginalised, backward and neglected sections of the society," he wrote.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP old-timers in West Bengal should be given respect: Dilip Ghosh
text: Former BJP State President Dilip Ghosh has said that leaders who have been associated with the BJP for a long time in West Bengal should be given "respect" and "importance" by the party. "The party has fought for so many years with the help of a large number of dedicated and deserving leaders. They helped the party grow," Ghosh said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: No power born in India to divide country: Salman Khurshid
text: Senior Congress leader Salman Khurshid has said that "no power has been born to divide the country of India". "My opinion is clear...A few people can confuse the public but the soul of the country cannot be broken because there is no force to break India," Khurshid said. "This belief should never be allowed to get hurt," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Many unseen hands behind Hubli violence: Karnataka Home Minister
text: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Friday said that many "unseen hands" were behind the recent violence in Hubli. "Some people are trying to create unrest in...society against a particular community and some organisations are involved in it. We're aware who they are," Jnanendra added. Four policemen were injured and several vehicles were damaged in the April 16 stone-pelting incident.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Cong wants to break trend of Raj govt changing every 5 yrs: Pilot
text: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the party is aiming to retain power in the 2023 Rajasthan Assembly polls and break the 30-year-old tradition of the government changing in the state every five years. Pilot, who met Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Thursday said that the latter is "very keen...we all work unitedly to form government in Rajasthan again".
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Bihar CM Nitish attends RJD's Iftar party; Tej claims 'secret' talk
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday attended Iftar party at RJD leader Rabri Devi's residence in Patna and was pictured sitting with the party's Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav and his brother Tej Pratap. Following this, Pratap told ANI, "We'll form a government...I'd a word with Nitish ji secretly." However, Tejashwi said that they'd invited people from all political parties.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Building owned by ex-BJP MLA, who switched to SP, bulldozed in UP
text: An "illegal" building owned by SP leader Roshan Lal Verma was demolished by the authorities in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur. The former MLA had switched to the SP from BJP ahead of recently-held state Assembly election. The structure was constructed on a government land, District Magistrate Umesh Pratap Singh said.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SP should have helped Azam Khan: Shivpal after meeting him in jail
text: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party Lohia (PSPL) leader Shivpal Singh Yadav met SP leader Azam Khan in Sitapur jail on Friday. Soon after his meeting, he said, "If SP, under the leadership of Mulayam Singh Yadav, had raised the issue of Khan in Parliament, then PM Narendra Modi, who has immense respect for the SP patriarch, would have listened."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP glorifies Godse, but foreign VIPs taken to Sabarmati Ashram: Shiv Sena
text: The Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece Saamana has commented on BJP over the recent visit of UK PM Boris Johnson to Ahmedabad's Sabarmati Ashram. "It's a wonder that they (BJP) support the ideology of Nathuram Godse but when foreign guests (like Johnson) arrive, they take them to Gandhi's Sabarmati Ashram to weave the yarn," the editorial in Saamana said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: I've no plans to join BJP but I welcome their recent decisions: Hardik Patel
text: Congress leader Hardik Patel refuted the rumours of him joining BJP and said, "I've no plans to join BJP." "I welcome the political decisions that have been taken by BJP recently. The party is strong in Gujarat as they have leadership with decision-making abilities," he added. Patel further stated that Congress needs to work on its decision-making skills.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Mann is an honest man: Sidhu after calling him a 'rubber doll'
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Friday praised Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, saying that he is an "honest man" and he considers the latter his younger brother. This comes a day after Sidhu called Mann a "rubber doll" controlled by Delhi. "I've never raised a finger at [Mann]. If he fights against [mafia] my support is with him," Sidhu added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Help shopkeepers threatened by BJP: Manish Sisodia to AAP MLAs
text: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia directed Aam Aadmi Party MLAs to help landlords and shopkeepers. He alleged that some people associated with BJP are 'threatening them by running bulldozers at their shops if they don't pay them money'. He wrote a letter to AAP MLAs saying that they can also register a complaint against such people.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: Will never promote religious conversions, PFI should be banned: Goa CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant criticised Popular Front of India (PFI) over their statement countering his anti-conversion remark and said that he would recommend the Centre to ban the organisation. "We'll never promote religious conversions in the state," he said. PFI had said that people of Goa shouldn't pay attention to the CM's statement and focus on common people's issues.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: It's his business: Dilip Ghosh on reports of Prashant Kishor joining Cong
text: Reacting to reports of Prashant Kishor joining the Congress party, BJP leader Dilip Ghosh said, "It's his business." "He joined TMC, earlier he was in Nitish Kumar's party...Whichever party he works for, gets its membership...He will have a membership card of every party, will show the card saying I'm from your party, give me order," Ghosh added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong snatched rights of Himachal Pradesh, BJP safeguarded it: Nadda
text: BJP chief JP Nadda, while addressing a public rally in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra on Friday, said that Congress has always snatched the rights of the state while the BJP government has safeguarded the rights. He said, "Congress leaders only talk about dynastic politics, casteism, communalism...But PM Narendra Modi has taken development forward by giving a tough competition to all this."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Not even 1 poll promise fulfilled by Punjab AAP govt so far: Chugh
text: BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh on Friday said the AAP government in Punjab hasn't fulfilled 'even a single poll promise' so far. He claimed that the party's promised immediate implementation of 300 units of free electricity has now been pushed back till July. He also accused AAP of using the state's resources to fulfil political motives in other states.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: HD Kumaraswamy asks K'taka CM to call meeting of religious leaders
text: JD(S) leader and former CM HD Kumaraswamy asked Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to call a meeting of religious leaders of all communities of the state amid recent communal tensions. Hitting out at BJP and Congress for disturbing peace, he said, "The issue of use of loudspeakers and sound pollution has started now, there was no such issue till now."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: We have reserve stock of 2.23 cr tonnes of coal: Minister to Rahul
text: Union Power Minister RK Singh hit out at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, saying India has a reserve stock of 2.23 crore tonnes of coal. "Rahul Gandhi has tweeted that there is a coal crisis. He doesn't have any information," he said. This comes after Rahul Gandhi said that only eight days of coal was left in stock.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Punjab CM 'a rubber doll' being controlled by Delhi: Sidhu
