text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and said that Mann has become a "rubber da gudda (rubber doll)" who is being controlled by Delhi. "Punjab's CM should be 'ankhila' (a self-respecting man) who could not be pulled by strings," he added. "Someone is playing the game but someone else is dancing and speaking," he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Everyone should follow the law: Karnataka CM on loudspeaker row
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said in reference to the ongoing loudspeaker issue in religious places that "everyone should follow the law". "Instructions have been issued for resolving the loudspeaker issue harmoniously through holding peace committee meetings," CM Bommai said. He added, "There is a High Court order on Azaan. A circular has already been issued in accordance with that."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Jairam is a remote-controlled CM: Congress' ex-HP president Sukhu
text: Congress' former Himachal Pradesh president Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has called Chief Minister Jairam Thakur a remote-controlled CM. "The government is running from Shimla, but the decisions are being taken from Delhi," he said. Sukhu also accused Jairam of being more focused on his party's (BJP) work rather than devoting time to redressal of public grievances.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Tharoor shares meaning of word 'quockerwodger', says 'useful addition to vocabulary'
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday shared the meaning of the word 'quockerwodger'. "A useful addition to our political vocabulary," he wrote with the meaning. "In politics, a quockerwodger was a politician acting on the instructions of an influential third party, rather than properly representing their constituents," the meaning stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco: Goa BJP leader to PM
text: Goa BJP leader Shekhar Salkar has requested PM Narendra Modi to take back Padma awards from actors promoting tobacco products. "I have no words to condemn the way Akshay Kumar has joined the gang of Amitabh Bachchan, Shahrukh Khan, Ajay Devgn to promote cancer through a surrogate advertisement of tobacco product," he said. He added these actors should be ashamed.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Sonia Gandhi keen on a united Congress in Rajasthan: Sachin Pilot
text: Ex-Rajasthan Deputy CM and Congress leader Sachin Pilot, who met party chief Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Thursday, said that Gandhi is "very keen" on a united performance by the party for upcoming state Assembly elections. Pilot added that they also discussed organisational polls and party strengthening strategies. Rajasthan is set to go to the polls in 2023.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Prashant Kishor wants to join the party without any preconditions: Cong Gen Secy
text: Congress General Secretary Tariq Anwar said that Prashant Kishor is willing to join the party without any preconditions and his induction would certainly help the party. He further said that Sonia Gandhi wants to take senior leaders into confidence and seek their opinion on Kishor's entry into the party. "Kishor is a brand and he has proven that," Anwar added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: After Kumar Vishwas, Cong's Alka Lamba summoned by Punjab Police
text: Punjab Police has summoned Congress leader Alka Lamba in connection with her alleged derogatory statements against Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal before the Punjab state elections. After she received the summons, Lamba tweeted, saying she was not afraid of threats from AAP government in Punjab. This comes after former AAP leader Kumar Vishwas was booked by Punjab Police.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Lack of coordination among NDA led to BJP's defeat in Bochahan bypoll: JD(U) leader
text: JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said that "lack of coordination among NDA partners" led to the recent defeat of BJP in Bochahan assembly seat by-election in Bihar. "The BJP's central leadership should intervene and consider the JD(U)'s long-standing demand for a coordination committee in Bihar," he added. RJD candidate Amar Kumar Paswan won the Bochahan election by margin of 36,617 votes.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Bulldozer represents the arbitrary order: Congress' P Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said the bulldozer represents the "arbitrary order". His remark came in reaction to the demolition drive in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri area. "Once arbitrary orders override law, we are on the road to hell," Chidambaram tweeted. "The Supreme Court represents ‘law’. Yesterday, we saw the bulldozer defy the law. Let’s see what happens today," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP turned K'taka into corruption capital of country: Congress' Shivakumar
text: Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that BJP-led state government has transformed Karnataka into "corruption capital of the country". He further claimed that the government had failed to bring justice to contractor Santosh Patil. "They are...protecting the accused (KS Eshwarappa)," he said. Shivakumar earlier demanded Eshwarappa's arrest in the alleged suicide of Santosh Patil.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: AAP will form govt in K'taka like it did in Delhi, Punjab: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said his party will form the government in Karnataka just like it did in Delhi and Punjab. The previous Congress government in Karnataka was called "20% commission government" and the current BJP government is called "40% commission government", Kejriwal said. "Delhi has 0% commission government because there's a hardcore honest government," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: PM gave me certificate of 'imandaar' CM: Arvind Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday claimed that PM Narendra Modi had given him the "certificate of imandaar (honest) CM". "PM made the CBI raid my residence. Officials entered my bedroom but they couldn't find anything. Eventually, PM gave me the certificate of 'imandaar' CM. Ours is an honest government," Kejriwal added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Jharkhand leaders urge Guv to disqualify BJP MLA over caste certificate
text: A delegation of Congress, RJD and JMM leaders on Tuesday submitted a memorandum to Jharkhand Governor Ramesh Bais seeking the disqualification of BJP MLA Sammari Lal over his caste certificate. "Since Sammari Lal is a resident of Rajasthan, he is not qualified to get his caste certificate made from Jharkhand," said the memorandum.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Cong leaders visit Jahangirpuri to meet families affected by demolition
text: A group of Congress leaders visited Delhi's Jahangirpuri to meet the families affected by the demolition drive conducted by the MCD yesterday. The delegation will submit a report of the incident to party chief Sonia Gandhi, said Congress leader Imran Pratapgarhi. Former MLA Hari Shanker Gupta said the group wasn't there to disturb peace but only to meet the families.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Uttarakhand BJP MLA vacates Champawat seat for CM Dhami
text: BJP leader Kailash Gahtori, who won the election from the Champawat Assembly seat, resigned as MLA to make way for CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. "The resignation of MLA Kailash Gahtori has been accepted. The Chief Minister will now contest from this seat," said BJP state chief Madan Kaushik. Notably, Dhami had lost election from Khatima to Congress' Bhuwan Chandra Kapri.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP has made bulldozer a symbol of its illegal power: Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said that the BJP has made bulldozers a symbol of its illegal power. "Muslims and other minorities, backward and Dalits are on their target. Now even Hindus are becoming victims of their hysteria. The BJP is actually running this bulldozer on the Constitution itself," Akhilesh added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Punjab being used to increase AAP's footprint in other states: Cong
text: Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa on Wednesday said Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is using Punjab's resources, security and bureaucracy to leave "imprints in Haryana, Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh". He added that AAP MP Raghav Chadha takes calls on posting of IAS and IPS officers in Punjab. All of AAP's pre-poll promises are being tweaked, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Didi 'most suited' opp'n candidate for 2024 PM post: Ripun Bora
text: TMC leader Ripun Bora has said that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is the "most suitable" opposition candidate to compete against PM Narendra Modi in the 2024 General elections. "I have full respect for all the opposition leaders but considering the ground reality, I have seen Mamata Banerjee is the only one fighting aggressively against Modi," Ripun Bora added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Not one drop of water will flow out of Punjab to other states: Cheema
text: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on Wednesday said that not even a single drop of the state's water will be allowed to flow out to any other state. His response came a day after AAP MP Sushil Gupta promised Sutlej Yamuna Link canal water to every village in Haryana if the party comes to power there.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: AAP politicising police: Sidhu after Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday said the AAP government is politicising the police force to use it for their own interests and to target those who raise their voice against AAP's Arvind Kejriwal. This comes after Punjab Police booked Kumar Vishwas over "inflammatory statements" against Kejriwal. "Punjab's CM has become a 'rubber da gudda' (rubber doll)," Sidhu added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 'Appeasement politics' in J'khand to blame for pro-Pak slogans: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Deepak Prakash alleged that "politics of appeasement" in Jharkhand is responsible for alleged pro-Pakistan slogans that were raised in Giridih on Thursday. "Since Hemant Soren’s government...[came] to power, there's been a continuous gathering of anti-national forces," he said. At least 10 persons were booked for shouting the slogans during nomination filing process for Panchayat polls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: India now identified with minority persecution, Islamophobia: Tharoor
text: Congress' Shashi Tharoor criticised Centre for carrying out anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and called the action "unconstitutional". "India's image is going downhill...Everything I hear from my friends abroad is deeply negative. We're being identified with minority persecution and Islamophobia," he said. "Government's job is to build up the nation, not bulldoze it down," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tell Centre not to harass industrialists: Mamata to Guv Dhankhar
text: Addressing people during Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee urged Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar to tell the central government not to "harass" industrialists through central agencies. She also thanked Dhankhar for attending the event and said, "I am happy that the Governor joined me here. We appreciate your support. Please always keep doing so."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 4 lakh students shifted from private to govt schools in Delhi this year: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during his Karnataka visit said that government schools in the national capital are better than private schools and four lakh students shifted from private to government schools in Delhi this year. Praising the work done by his government, Kejriwal said, "Delhi government has been successful in providing best medical treatment to two crore people for free."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Vote for BJP if you want criminals to come to power: Delhi CM Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday told the people of Karnataka to vote for BJP if they wanted criminals to come to power in the state. "But if you want better schools, vote for the AAP. If you want hooligans, vote for them, but if you want hospitals, vote for Kejriwal," he further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Owaisi has Jinnah's DNA, believes in Sharia law: Giriraj Singh
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi for comparing Delhi's Jahangirpuri anti-encroachment drive with Turkman Gate incident during the Emergency and said that leaders like Owaisi view all issues through "Hindu versus Muslim angle". "They do so because they have Jinnah's DNA and believe in Sharia law, not the law of the land," Singh added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM Modi can't imprison truth, MLA Mevani's arrest undemocratic: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that the arrest of MLA Jignesh Mevani was "undemocratic" and "unconstitutional", adding that PM Narendra Modi can't imprison truth. "Modi ji, you can try to crush dissent by abusing the state machinery," he said. Congress leader KC Venugopal also termed Mevani's arrest as unconstitutional and alleged authoritarianism by the BJP.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 'I don't know, who is he?': Assam CM on Jignesh Mevani's arrest
text: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma claimed ignorance on Thursday when asked about Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani, who was arrested on Wednesday night in connection with allegedly offensive tweets about PM Narendra Modi. "I don't know. Who is he? I'm not aware of the specifics. Who will do vendetta politics when I don't know him?" he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Imran Khan govt fell due to strained ties with ‘establishment’: Ex-minister
text: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan-led government was ousted as its relations with the "establishment" were strained, said PTI leader and ex-minister Fawad Chaudhry. "Had our [relationship] with the establishment been good, we would have still been in the government," he said. This comes amid rumours of discord between Pakistan's army and the former government.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: TRS leader's son held for kidnaping, raping 20-yr-old after drugging her in T'gana
text: TRS ward councillor Mohammed Khaja's son Sheik Ghouse Pasha and his friend have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and gang-raping a 20-year-old woman for two days after drugging her in Telangana's Kodad. The woman alleged when she regained consciousness, she escaped and informed her family about the incident. She added she was beaten up so badly that she was unconscious.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas, he says Kejriwal will one day betray Punjab CM
text: Punjab Police have registered a case against Kumar Vishwas for promoting enmity by allegedly making false statements against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Tagging Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, Vishwas tweeted, "I'm warning you that the man sitting in Delhi, whom you are allowing to play with the power given by the people of Punjab, will one day betray you and Punjab."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: All should condemn atrocities by TRS leaders: Telangana BJP chief
text: BJP Telangana unit President Bandi Sanjay Kumar has said that everybody should condemn the "atrocities by the TRS leaders". He further urged the party workers to hold black flag protests against the "atrocities, murders and abetment of suicides by the TRS leaders". This came after a BJP activist, Sai Ganesh, reportedly died by suicide in Telangana's Khammam on April 16.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP using riots as tool to win civic body polls in Delhi: Sanjay Raut
text: In an apparent reference to Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the BJP has to win elections through riots and do politics. Raut said, "Delhi is UT...The law-and-order is [being] taken care of by the Center...But since the last few days, there've been riots." "[Reason] behind this is the civic body polls," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP has declared war, is punishing Muslims for daring to stay alive: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi took to Twitter to say that the Bharatiya Janata Party has declared war against the poorest. "In the name of encroachment it's going to destroy homes in Delhi like UP & MP. No notice, no opportunity to go to court...simply punishing poor Muslims for daring to stay alive...@ArvindKejriwal must clarify his dubious role," the tweet read.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Hubballi rioters will be tried as per existing law: Karnataka CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has said that those involved in the Hubballi riots will be tried as per the existing laws in the state. "When riots took place in Uttar Pradesh, certain action was taken according to the situation prevailing over there. We are reviewing the situation in Karnataka. We will go by our law," Bommai said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Flagged infighting, but Congress didn’t act: Ripun Bora after joining TMC
text: Former Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora, who recently joined Trinamool Congress, said that he always alerted the party high command about the "corrosive effects of infighting, but no action was taken". "Some of my senior colleagues kept demanding my removal. When they couldn't replace me, they did everything to not let me become the CM," he said during an interview.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP working as carrier of Hindutva: Devendra Fadnavis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that the Hindutva concept is an intricate part of Indian DNA and the BJP is working as the carrier of Hindutva. Fadnavis added, "Hindutva is a concept that is not based on pooja or karma. Hindutva is a concept that is geographically connected with India," Fadnavis added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Switch off bulldozers of hate, switch on power plants: Rahul to PM
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to "switch off bulldozers of hate and switch on power plants". Gandhi's reference was to the use of bulldozers in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and Madhya Pradesh. Referring to the coal shortage issue, Gandhi added, "Modi ji, stagflation is looming. Power cuts will crush small industries, leading to more job losses."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Prashant Kishor has become brand in country: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot
text: Political strategist Prashant Kishor has become a brand in the country, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said. "In 2014, he was with PM Narendra Modi, then with (Bihar CM) Nitish Kumar and then with Congress in Punjab and many others," Gehlot added. "We also take advice from experts and agencies. His experience might be useful in uniting the Opposition," Gehlot stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We don't divide people, we stay like family: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that in Bengal we don't divide people on the basis of caste, creed or religion, "we stay like family". "Irrespective of one being from any part of the country, whenever one's in Bengal, one's part of our family and should be comfortable here," Banerjee further said while addressing Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong isn't dead, will play role of constructive opp'n in Punjab: Sidhu
text: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu, while speaking about the party's loss in the state Assembly elections this year, said that the "Congress party has lost but isn't dead". He added that Congress will be playing the role of a constructive opposition in Punjab and that they will "work to provide the solution to the problems of people".
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Telangana BJP to launch state-wide protests against 'atrocities’ by TRS
text: The Telangana unit of the BJP has decided to hold state-wide protests on Wednesday against the "atrocities, murders and abetment of suicides by the TRS leaders". This came after a member of the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh, B Sai Ganesh, allegedly killed himself by consuming pesticide in Khammam after accusing TRS leaders of corruption.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Discrimination: KTR on govt's decision to move GCTM to Guj from Hyd
text: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday said that the Centre's decision to move WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine (GCTM) to Gujarat from Hyderabad is discrimination against Telangana. KTR tweeted, "The saga of PM Narendra Modi Ji's discrimination against Telangana goes on unabated." Notably, PM Modi on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for WHO GCTM at Jamnagar in Gujarat.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Rahul sowing seeds of hatred, maligning country's image: BJP leader
text: BJP leader and Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that Rahul Gandhi is sowing seeds of hatred and maligning the country's image. "This is all you can expect from someone whose history is linked to corruption and riots," Thakur said. Gandhi had previously criticised the government for their use of bulldozers in violence-hit areas in Delhi and Madhya Pradesh.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not Arjun; punishment for Muslims: Owaisi
text: President of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that the bulldozer runs only on Ansar, not on Arjun, adding that "collective punishment" is being given to Muslims. He also asked why only shops in front of the mosques were demolished and not ones in front of the temples. "This is a targeted demolition," Owaisi added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 12 states face power crisis due to coal shortage: Maha Minister
text: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said that 12 states are facing electricity issues due to the shortage of coal and that his department was working to mitigate the shortage. "Shortage is also due to lack of rakes (trains). We require 37 rakes per day, while we get only 26. Each rake can transport 4,000 metric tonnes of coal," Raut said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Bulldoze BJP HQ, Amit Shah's house to stop riots: Raghav Chadha
text: AAP MP Raghav Chadha said communal riots in India will stop if BJP headquarters and Home Minister Amit Shah's house are bulldozed. "BJP rehabilitated Rohingyas and people from Bangladesh in large numbers so that they can help the party in orchestrating these riots...Ask BJP where these people have been rehabilitated to know where future riots will take place," Chadha added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ban RSS, Bajrang Dal and VHP along with PFI: K'taka Cong leader
text: Karnataka Congress leader MB Patil called for a ban on RSS, Bajrang Dal, Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), along with Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI). "Ban AIMIM also, we don't have any reservations, let it get cleared at once, by doing so showcase your (BJP-led government's) strong will...Congress party will fully support," Patil said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: People have lost faith in WB police: BJP's Anirban Ganguly
text: Amid political violence in West Bengal, BJP's Anirban Ganguly has said that the people of West Bengal have lost faith in the state police. Demanding CBI investigation in the recent rape cases, he said, "The SIT is never successful in the investigations because TMC is pressurising them to not do the investigation properly."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Bulldoze BJP HQ to stop hooliganism in country: Manish Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that the BJP headquarters should be bulldozed to stop hooliganism in the country. "The illegal constructions have been demolished, now the homes of those BJP netas should be demolished who gave protection to them," Sisodia said. BJP has only encouraged fighting and has done nothing for schools and hospitals, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Centre’s regressive policies dampening farm sector growth: KCR
text: Calling the Centre's policies on agriculture regressive, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday said that they are dampening the growth of the farm sector in the country. He said that the policies would reduce output instead of boosting it. His remarks came in a meeting with the state Agriculture Minister and officials to assess preparedness for rainy season crops.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: RSS, PFI should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest: CPI(M) leader
text: CPI(M) Kerala State Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan said that ban on communal outfits was not a solution to check the growing "communal virus" in the country. Speaking about RSS and SDPI workers' killings in Palakkad, he said that the crimes were well-planned. "Both, RSS and PFI, should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest," Balakrishnan added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Main accused in Jahangirpuri violence a BJP leader: AAP MLA Atishi
text: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, Ansar, is a BJP leader. "It is clear that the BJP is behind the Jahangirpuri riots and it should apologise to the people of Delhi. BJP is a party of hooligans," AAP's Atishi said in a tweet.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Probe ordered against Assam CM Sarma ahead of Guwahati civic polls
text: Assam State Election Commission has instructed to initiate a probe against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma for alleged model code violations during campaigns for Guwahati civic polls. A complaint was filed by Asom Jatiya Parishad (AJP) president Sanjeev Bora against Sarma, accusing him of promising 'land patta' to landless residents. The complaint further alleged that Sarma sought to bribe wards.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP-ruled states should remove loudspeakers from mosques: Ex-VHP chief
text: Ex-Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Pravin Togadia has said that BJP should remove loudspeakers from mosques in those states where it's in power. "We had demanded...removal of loudspeakers from mosques in Maharashtra some 10 years ago," he added. Togadia's comments come as Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Contempt petition filed against Raut for levelling allegations against HC judges
text: Indian Bar Association has filed a contempt petition-cum-PIL against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut and others for levelling "false, scandalous and contemptuous allegations" against judges of Bombay High Court in granting relief to BJP's Kirit Somaiya. The PIL also seeked action against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil and 'Saamana' Editor Rashmi Thackeray in the matter.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Duty to shut anything causing problems in a secular state: Assam CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Monday said it's a duty to shut anything irritating students or other communities in a secular state. "If there's a genuine demand around exams (to not play loudspeakers), don't play it," Sarma said. He also expressed concerns regarding several attempts made by fundamentalists to create a base in Assam with the help of sympathisers.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Prashant Kishor meets Sonia, other top Cong leaders for 2nd time in 3 days
text: Political strategist Prashant Kishor met Congress chief Sonia Gandhi at her residence at 10 Janpath in Delhi on Monday. This is their second meeting at Sonia's residence in the last 3 days. The meeting comes amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and P Chidambaram were also present.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Tribals will continue to fight for their heritage, tradition: CPI(M) leader
text: CPI(M) West Bengal Secretary Mohammed Salim has criticised the ruling TMC government's Deucha Pachami coal block mining project in the Birbhum district. "This is the (tribals') heritage and tradition...They will fight and we will continue our support to them," Salim said. He also claimed that the Trinamool's land acquisition supporters were shown black flags by the tribals on Monday.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Party will decide on plan to expand, rejig Cabinet: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said BJP President JP Nadda will hold a meeting regarding the state and thereafter decide on Karnataka Cabinet's expansion or reshuffle. This comes as BJP gears up for Karnataka Assembly polls which are scheduled to be held next year. There are currently 29 ministers in the state Cabinet against the sanctioned strength of 34.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Goa CM should withdraw comments on 'religious conversion': Cong leader
text: Congress' Michael Lobo reacted to Goa CM Pramod Sawant's comments on 'religious conversion', stating that Sawant should withdraw the "unwarranted" remarks. "[Sawant's] trying to polarise one section of the society...[he] needs to take everyone along," Lobo added. Sawant had said that Goa government will never allow religious conversions in the state, adding that people should be vigilant about it.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Previous govts left Punjab with a debt of ₹3 lakh crore: CM Mann
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday blamed state's previous governments for its debt. "Previous governments...left a debt of ₹3 lakh crore on Punjab. But where has this loan been used? We'll investigate and recover [the amount],” AAP's Punjab unit tweeted quoting Mann. Notably, Mann sought financial package of ₹1 lakh crore for state from PM Narendra Modi after assuming charge.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Cong's 3-day 'Chintan Shivir' likely to be held in Raj from May 14
text: Congress' three-day 'Chintan Shivir' is likely to be held in Rajasthan's Jaipur from May 14 onwards, sources said on Monday. Around 400 party leaders are expected to gather at meeting, which will focus on party's poll results in recently-held Assembly elections in five states. Notably, Rahul Gandhi was made party's Vice-President at Congress' last 'Chintan Shivir' in Jaipur in 2013.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Delhi's law & order is under Centre: Sharad Pawar on Jahangirpuri violence
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday reacted to the violence in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, saying that Delhi's law and order situation comes under the Central government. Pawar added, "We never heard of communal violence during Ram Navami. The reason behind this is the BJP and some of their organisation."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Deleted, was creating chaos: MP BJP chief's wife on Hindu-Muslim unity tweet
text: Madhya Pradesh BJP chief VD Sharma's wife Stuti Mishra said that she has deleted her tweet on 'Hindu-Muslim unity' because it was creating "unnecessary chaos". "It's difficult to share thoughts on a topic of religious fight. Was not [aimed] to hurt anyone's opinion. Let karma do the rest," she said. She had earlier tweeted about a "caring" Muslim shopkeeper.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: HC grants interim relief to Khadse's wife in Pune land scam case
text: The Bombay High Court has granted interim relief to senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Eknath Khadse in the Pune land scam case. The next hearing will take place on April 25, Mandakini's advocate Mohan Tekavde said. The case is related to the alleged money laundering pertaining to a land at Bhosari in Pune.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: I haven't replied to Congress' show-cause notice: Sunil Jakhar
text: Ex-Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday said he hasn't replied to the show-cause notice issued to him by the Congress disciplinary committee. The notice was issued on April 11 for going against "party line" and using "objectionable words" for the Dalit community. Jakhar has denied making any statement against the community saying his remarks were put "out of context".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Dejected parties taking refuge in vote bank, divisive politics: Nadda
text: Reacting to Opposition parties' joint statement criticising Centre over incidents of communal violence, BJP President JP Nadda said, Opposition is "casting aspersions on our hardworking citizens". Unfortunately, this thrust towards development politics is being bitterly resisted by "rejected and dejected parties" which are "once again taking refuge in vote bank and divisive politics", he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Fundamentalism more dangerous when practised by majority: Kerala minister
text: Kerala minister MV Govindan said fundamentalism is more dangerous when practised by the majority than the minority. His remark came in reaction to the killings of RSS and SDPI workers in Palakkad. He added, the majority fundamentalism "is working towards formation of a Hindu Rashtra" and the hatred towards minorities is part of the attempt to create to achieve that.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Maha govt must ban leaders' rallies who create communal tensions: Patole
text: Congress' Nana Patole said on Monday that the Maharashtra government must ban public rallies of political leaders who try to create communal tensions. Patole's remark comes a day after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray announced that he'll conduct a rally in Aurangabad on May 1. Thackeray had earlier demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Indian economy will be worse than Sri Lanka, Ukraine with riots politics: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that India's economy will be worse than that of Sri Lanka and Ukriane with the "politics of riots". "In big cities of the country...the way situation is tense or such a situation has been created, it's highly unfortunate...Riots are happening in national capital. Delhi is a centre-administered state...it is a union territory," he added
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Sonia meets Prashant Kishor at her residence, 3rd meeting in 1 week
text: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday again met political strategist Prashant Kishor at her residence in Delhi. This is their third meeting in a week amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of Assembly polls later this year and the Lok Sabha elections in 2024. Senior Congress leaders Digvijaya Singh, KC Venugopal, Ambika Soni and Randeep Surjewala attended the meeting.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Will perform 'aarti' on loudspeakers at Maha temples on May 3: MNS leader
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers will perform 'maha aarti' at their local temples across the state, on May 3, on the occasion of Akshaya Tritiya, MNS leader Nitin Sardesai said on Tuesday. "The aarti will be performed using loudspeakers," he added. His comment comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray gave May 3 as ultimatum to remove mosque loudspeakers.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Mamata best suited to lead opposition, Cong busy with infighting: Ripun Bora
text: Trinamool Congress leader Ripun Bora on Tuesday said Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is best suited to lead an opposition front in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "Congress' leaders in various states are fighting against each other rather than fighting the BJP," Bora added. Notably, Ripun Bora joined the TMC on Sunday after quitting Congress.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Neither Cong nor NCP, Shiv Sena will dump each other: Cong Minister
text: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home Satej Patil has said that "neither the NCP nor the Shiv Sena will dump the Congress, nor will Congress" dump them. Patil has also revealed that the state Congress unit has invited senior leader Rahul Gandhi to visit Mumbai. "He (Rahul) is expected in the second week of May," the Congress leader said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: No one is indispensable: Cong MP Bordoloi on Ripun Bora joining TMC
text: Congress MP Pradyut Bordoloi reacted to ex-Assam party unit chief Ripun Bora's recent switchover to Trinamool Congress (TMC), terming the move "unfortunate", adding that "nobody is indispensable". Bordoloi added that the Congress "has very strong DNA" in Assam and wasn't dependent on Bora's support. Bora has said that only the TMC is capable of fighting against BJP.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Kejriwal to visit Bengaluru on April 21, attend farmers' convention
text:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will visit Bengaluru on April 21 and attend a convention of farmers on the invitation of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha chief and farmer leader Kodihalli Chandrashekhar. 
AAP's Karnataka Convener Prithvi Reddy said the party is the platform for people who fight for farmers' cause. He said AAP wants to get such people elected to Vidhana Soudha.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Those who do 'puja' can't create disturbance: Nitish on clashes
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while speaking about clashes that took place in some states during Hanuman Jayanti, said, "How could a person who wants to do puja...create...communal disturbance." He added that fringe elements are the ones who are involved in creating disharmony. He further said there wasn't any incident in Bihar as he "doesn't give any space for communal disturbance".
author: Shreya Das

headlines: PM failed to achieve targets of economic growth in 8 yrs: Subramanian Swamy
text: Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy said in eight years in office, PM Narendra Modi has failed to achieve targets of economic growth. "On the contrary, the growth rate has declined annually since 2016," Swamy tweeted. "Modi inexplicably is clueless about China. There is scope to recover but does he know how?" Swamy added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Why is PM silent on incidents of riots and violence? : Congress' Surjewala
text: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said BJP and its government are at war with its own people. "While parts of India are ravaged by riots and violence, why is the Prime Minister so conspicuously silent? Why does he not denounce hatred no matter where it comes from?" Surjewala added. "Why do perpetrators of hate get political patronage?" Surjewala stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong seeks disqualification of its two Rajkot corporators for joining AAP
text: The Congress has written to the Commissioner of the Rajkot Municipal Corporation requesting him to disqualify two Congress corporators who joined AAP last week. Congress' Rajkot city unit President Pradeep Trivedi alleged that the duo, Vashram Sagathiya and Komal Bharai, were elected as corporators on Congress tickets and therefore, they should be disqualified for joining another party.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle vandalised in Mumbai; BJP blames Shiv Sena
text: BJP's 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle, one of the 40 screen-mounted vans, was found vandalised in Mumbai's Chembur on Tuesday morning, the party said. BJP leader Pravin Darekar said that Shiv Sena was behind the attack and asked the police to arrest the "hooligans" involved without delay. BJP uses the vehicle to campaign against Shiv Sena ahead of Mumbai civic elections.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Akhilesh extends support to Dalit boy who was made to lick feet in UP
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav extended support to the Dalit boy who was assaulted and made to lick the feet of an accused as seen in a viral video and promised him admission in Kendriya Vidyalaya. Yadav also ensured safety of his entire family. SP blamed BJP for this incident and said that caste discrimination is "a gift given by BJP".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Raghav gets legal notice for calling BJP 'Gundon-Lafangon ki party'
text: Punjab Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha leader Ashok Sareen sent a legal notice to AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Sunday for calling BJP "Gundon ki, Lafangon ki party" and "Bharat ki Zahil Party". The notice demanded that Chadha issue a written apology to Sareen and BJP within three days, failing which a civil and criminal complaint would be filed against him.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Ex-Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora joins TMC after quitting Congress
text: Former Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora on Sunday quit the party and joined TMC in presence of MP Abhishek Banerjee. While tendering his resignation, Bora said, "Instead of fighting against BJP, a section of senior...leaders of Assam Congress have been maintaining secret understanding with BJP government especially the CM." He added, "I shall continue my fight more vigorously against BJP."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: 56 inches can't mask 56 lakh: Moitra on NYT COVID-19 deaths report
text: Criticising the Narendra Modi-led Central Government over COVID-19 deaths in India, TMC MP Mahua Moitra tweeted that "56 inches can't mask 56 lakhs". She added, "Lying and stalling data publication doesn't make truth go away." Her comments came after The New York Times report claimed WHO estimated India's death toll to be 40 lakh, nearly eight times the official figure.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP is trying to divide society: Kamal Nath on Khargone violence
text: Following the clashes that took place in MP’s Khargone, former MP CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath on Sunday said that BJP is trying to "divide" the society. "These riots that took place in Khargone are against the culture of our country. Our culture is to unite the society but BJP is trying to divide it," Nath added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Connivance between SDPI and CPI(M): Kerala BJP Vice President
text: The Vice President of BJP's Kerala unit, KS Radhakrishnan, has alleged that there is some "sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)". "The state government acts like the policemen in old Hindi films. There is a sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)," Radhakrishnan said by referring to the alleged murder of an RSS worker on Saturday.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Aaditya Thackeray to visit Ram Temple site in Ayodhya in May
text: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray will be on a one-day visit to UP's Ayodhya in the first week of May during which he'll be going to the Ram Janambhoomi site. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray confirmed that he will visit Ayodhya on June 5. Notably, MNS and Shiv Sena are involved in a row over loudspeakers outside mosques.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: PM should directly intervene: RJD MP Manoj Jha on Delhi violence
text: RJD MP Manoj Jha has urged PM Narendra Modi to directly intervene and give a "strong message" in regards to the recent Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi. "The Jahangirpuri incident isn't isolated. If you look at the images of different places...then there is a pattern. I request PM for his direct intervention...give a strong message," Jha said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Attacks on processions designed way to divide country: JP Nadda
text: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday said that the Congress party is behaving in the most irresponsible manner. Addressing the party workers in Karnataka's Hosapete, Nadda said, "You must have seen the attacks on Ram Navami procession or something else at some other place...I can say it's a designed way to divide the country," Nadda added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Punjab CM, ministers to visit Delhi govt schools, mohalla clinics
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and the members of his Cabinet will reportedly visit government schools and mohalla clinics in Delhi on Monday. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who is expected to accompany them, had said the ministers will be shown the "remarkable improvement" achieved by the AAP government. Notably, the Opposition has criticised AAP for running Punjab government through "remote control".
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: UP exemplary in dealing with violence: Minister on Delhi violence
text: Uttar Pradesh government has been exemplary in dealing with cases of violence, UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta said on Sunday regarding the incident of violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. “Those indulging in violence have been dealt with sternly and will be dealt with sternly," Gupta said. I don't think anyone has the...daring to indulge in violence in UP," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Corruption and Congress are synonyms: BJP chief JP Nadda
text: BJP President Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said corruption and Congress are synonyms. "Where there is BJP, there is a mission; where there is Congress, there is a commission," Nadda said while speaking at the Karyakarta Samavesh in Karnataka. "Even under adverse conditions, India is ready to make economic leaps under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP mentally divided India, worst is yet to come: Cong spokesperson
text: Congress Chief Spokesperson Atul Londhe said BJP has already "mentally divided" India and Hindus will be further segregated as "upper castes-lower castes". Centre's plans to impose Hindi has also sowed a north-south division, Londhe added. Speaking on the claims that BJP is using central agencies to retain power, Londhe said, "No [Maharashtra government] leaders get any kind of relief."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: AAP must clarify if it supports UK MP's anti-India views: BJP leader
text: BJP leader and ex-Army chief JJ Singh said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) must clarify if it supports the "pro-separatist and anti-India" views of British Labour Party MP Tanmanjeet Singh Dhesi. This comes after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and AAP Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha met Dhesi on Friday. Singh added that Mann must disclose what transpired during their meeting.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Manish Sisodia shares Guj govt schools' pics 'without desks', 'broken toilets'
text: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi’s visit to Gujarat, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted pictures of government schools in Gujarat "without desks" and "broken toilets". "Dear PM, you may not see the pictures of these schools from the modern centre of Vidya Samiksha Kendra, where there is no desk to sit, there are spider webs...Toilets are broken," Sisodia tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong members booked for unlawful assembly at K'taka CM's B'luru home
text: A case has been filed against 36 Congress members, including former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, state party chief DK Shivakumar and party General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala, in Bengaluru on charges of unlawful assembly at state CM Basavaraj Bommai's residence. The party members have been booked under IPC Sections 341, 143 and KP Act Section 103, the ANI reported.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than law: Raj Thackeray
text: Amid loudspeaker row, MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that no one has opposed the offering of prayers. "Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than the law. After May 3, I'll see what to do," Raj added. "We don't want riots in Maharashtra...But if you (Muslims) do it on loudspeaker, then we'll also use loudspeakers for it," Raj stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP gave money to woo voters during Kolhapur by-polls: Maha MoS
text: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home (Urban) Satej Patil said BJP ran a vicious campaign and distributed money to woo voters during the recently concluded Kolhapur North by-polls. Adding that BJP also gave free tickets of 'The Kashmir Files', Patil said, "Voters didn't succumb to such tactics as they voted for Maha Vikas Aghadi. This victory...belongs to people of Kolhapur."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Former AAP HP chief 'characterless', was about to be terminated: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Saturday called Aam Aadmi Party's Himachal Pradesh unit president Anup Kesari "characterless" and said that he was about to be terminated. He also criticised the BJP for inducting Kesari, who allegedly has complaints against him and talks ill of women. "That is his rightful place," Sisodia further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP govt ruined health services in UP, poor dying: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday accused the ruling BJP of "ruining" the health services in Uttar Pradesh, alleging that the poor are "dying" due to lack of treatment. "People were orphaned during the COVID-19 pandemic. Even today, there is no sign of improvement and chaos is prevailing," he alleged.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Rahul Gandhi lacks stability, can't be entrusted with responsibilities: PJ Kurien
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is a leader who has “no stability” and cannot be entrusted with responsibilities, senior party leader PJ Kurien said. "The captain cannot leave the ship when it is in trouble. After the 2019 elections, he resigned abruptly from the post (of Congress chief). But, he continues to take important decisions in the party," Kurien added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sleeper cells trained by police: Kerala BJP Vice President on RSS worker’s killing
text: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan claimed that there are "sleeper cells" in the police force receiving training from police and armed forces. His remark came after an RSS worker was killed in Palakkad. "Primary duty of the state is to protect the life and property of citizens. But a murder happened within the vicinity of the police," Radhakrishnan added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Spread teachings of gods in right way, don’t be 'andh bhakts': Maha CM
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said people should spread the teachings of their gods in the right way rather than becoming "andh bhakts". "The true follower will understand the teaching of his God and spread it to all. The blind follower will only praise superficially and then sometimes change his affection," Thackeray added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hindu outfit demands arrest of BJP's Eshwarappa
text: A Hindu outfit named the Akhila Bharath Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) has demanded the arrest of former Karnataka Minister and BJP leader KS Eshwarappa. "The BJP is using Hindus for the sake of power but is not protecting them. The government should have sacked Eshwarappa, instead he submitted his resignation owing to pressure," said ABHM state President Rajesh Pavithran.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Non-BJP CMs likely to meet to discuss political situation: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday said a conference of non-BJP Chief Ministers is likely to be held in Mumbai to discuss the prevailing political situation in India. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee had earlier written to non-BJP CMs on the same matter. Issues including unemployment, inflation and attempts to create communal discord will be discussed, Raut added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: NCP MP Amol Kolhe dances at staffer's wedding in Pune, video surfaces
text: A video has surfaced that shows Nationalist Congress Party MP Amol Kolhe dancing on dhol beats at a wedding ceremony in Pune district of Maharashtra. Kolhe was reportedly dancing at the wedding of his staffer Tejas Zodage in Narayangaon. The Member of Parliament was wearing a white ethnic attire on the occasion.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably: VD Satheesan
text: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state's intelligence system in the wake of the last week's back-to-back political killings in Palakkad. "Attempts are being made in Kerala for communal polarization. The victims are ordinary people and the conspirators are laughing. The intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably," the Congress leader said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: CM Kejriwal is an irresponsible leader: Delhi Congress chief
text: Delhi Congress President Anil Chaudhary has called CM Arvind Kejriwal an "irresponsible leader" after violence took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday. "Kejriwal is just playing the blame game. This is a statement from an irresponsible leader. When Congress was in power, Shiela (Dixit) ji stood for the people and maintained peace and harmony," Chaudhary said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Congress' Jadhav Jayshri Chandrakant wins Kolhapur North by-polls
text: Congress on Saturday managed to retain the Kolhapur North Assembly seat in Maharashtra as its candidate Jadhav Jayshri Chandrakant defeated BJP's Satyajeet Kadam by over 19,000 votes in the by-polls. The by-polls were necessitated after Congress MLA Chandrakant Jadhav died of COVID-19 in December 2021. Congress fielded his widow from the seat and she got 97,332 votes.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Congress wins Khairagarh Assembly seat in Chhattisgarh by-polls
text: Congress leader Yashoda Nilamber Verma on Saturday won the Khairagarh Assembly by-polls in Chhattisgarh by a margin of over 20,000 votes. Her nearest rival, BJP's Komal Janghel, got 67,703 votes. "The winning of Congress candidate is an outcome of Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel's policies in the state. Our leader took decision in favour of public," state minister Amarjeet Bhagat said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Complaint against Punjab CM for allegedly visiting gurudwara after getting drunk
text: Bharatiya Janata Party's Tajinder Bagga has filed a police complaint against Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann for allegedly entering Gurudwara Damdama Sahib while being drunk on Baisakhi. Taking to Twitter to announce the same, Bagga said, "I request Punjab Police DGP to take action on my complaint." He also shared a screenshot of the complaint.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Every Indian paying price for hate fueled by BJP-RSS: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took to Twitter and accused the Bharatiya Janata Party and RSS of spreading hate in the country. He wrote, "Every Indian is paying the price for the hate-fueled by BJP-RSS." He also shared an article by Sonia Gandhi where she criticised the BJP government for the alleged rise in 'hatred' and 'crimes against minorities'.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: We're shocked at PM's silence: 13 Opposition leaders condemn communal violence
text: Thirteen leaders of Opposition parties have issued a statement condemning recent incidents of communal violence that broke out in several states. "We're shocked at the silence of the PM who's failed to speak against the...actions of those who propagate bigotry," said the statement, signed by Congress, NCP chiefs Sonia Gandhi and Sharad Pawar. CMs of three states also signed it.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: CBI denied further custody of Deshmukh over unsatisfactory grounds
text: A special CBI court on Saturday denied the central agency further custody of former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh calling the grounds stated by the CBI "not good and unsatisfactory". CBI had sought three more days of his custody in connection to a corruption case. The court sent Deshmukh and three other accused to judicial custody till April 29.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: PM lying, 40 lakh died in COVID pandemic: Rahul shares NYT report
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi was lying about the COVID-19 situation in the country. He shared a New York Times report which claimed that WHO has estimated over 40 lakh COVID-19 deaths in India. "Not five lakh, but 40 lakh Indians died in COVID-19 pandemic due to the government's negligence," tweeted Gandhi.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Salute to voters: Mamata Banerjee after TMC's victory in WB by-polls
text: TMC chief and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee today thanked the voters after the party won the Ballygunge Assembly by-polls and the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls. Banerjee further "saluted voters for reposing faith in TMC and for giving a decisive mandate". TMC leader Babul Supriyo won the Ballygunge by-polls, while TMC's Shatrughan Prasad Sinha won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: TRS to hold foundation day celebrations in Hyderabad on April 27
text: Telangana Rashtra Samithi will hold its party formation day celebrations in Hyderabad on April 27. The day-long foundation day celebrations, which will kickstart by hoisting the party's flag, will be held at the Hyderabad International Convention Centre. TRS President K Chandrashekar Rao has directed all leaders and representatives to be present at the venue by 10 am on April 27.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Spreading hatred since decades: BJP replies to Sonia's 'virus of hate' remark
text: BJP National General Secretary Tarun Chugh has criticised Congress President Sonia Gandhi's 'virus of hate' remark which she said in her newspaper article on Saturday. "Congress kept the virus of hatred, to its zenith for decades, destroyed the country's culture for vote bank politics, that Congress is advising us today," Chugh said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Those capable should give up reservation: BJP MP Jaskaur Meena
text: Jaskaur Meena, a BJP MP from Rajasthan, has said that those capable should give up the benefits of reservation. "I am sitting in front of you as an MP, though I could not even go to school...after becoming an MP, my children do not avail benefits of reservation," she said. Meena served as a Union Minister during the Vajpayee government.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Many things to learn from TMC: BJP MP after party's defeat in WB by-polls
text: After BJP's defeat in the recently held by-polls in West Bengal, BJP MP Saumitra Khan said that there are many things to learn from Trinamool Congress. Khan said, "The inexperienced leaders should be replaced...else there will be more debacles for...BJP." "TMC knows how to play politics...Ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha elections, they'll conduct Hindu festivals for public connect," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Congress is like a dead horse, no point flogging it: Raghav Chadha
text: Reacting to political strategist Prashant Kishor's meeting with the Congress, Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha said Congress is like a "dead horse" and "there is no point flogging it". "Congress Party cannot give an alternative to the country. Only Arvind Kejriwal can challenge PM Narendra Modi and BJP," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP MLA booked for threatening alleged live-in partner in Navi Mumbai
text: Navi Mumbai Police has registered a case against BJP MLA from Airoli Ganesh Naik after a 47-year-old woman, who claimed to be in a relationship with him, alleged he threatened her. She said they were in a relationship for 27 years and had a son. She alleged that Naik threatened to kill her and himself by showing a revolver.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: We're happy: Shatrughan Sinha's wife on his win in Asansol by-polls
text: After Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Prasad Sinha won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls on Saturday, his wife Poonam Sinha said that they're happy "as the people of Asansol have welcomed them with open hands". She said, "It feels like we are from Asansol only. It can only happen in India where people love each other." Shatrughan Sinha defeated BJP's Agnimitra Paul.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP broke myth one party can't form govt in U'khand 2nd time: CM
text: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who was re-elected to the post following BJP's win, said they "broke the myth" that one political party cannot form government after one term in the state. Dhami, while attending 'Ayodhya Parv' in Delhi, further said, "People used to say I became Uttarakhand CM at...wrong time". Notably, Dhami had lost his seat in the elections.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Kerala is in grip of goons: V Muraleedharan after RSS worker killed in Palakkad
text: After an RSS worker was killed in Kerala’s Palakkad on Saturday, Union Minister V Muraleedharan said the state is in the grip of "goons". "I would like to urge CM to rein in all such elements who are creating anarchy in the state," Muraleedharan added. The deceased, Srinivasan, was allegedly attacked by a group of assailants at his shop.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi praises Gujarat CM for his 'effective leadership' in state
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wrote to Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel lauding the work he has done since taking oath as the CM. PM Modi said that the decisions he has taken in the past 200 days for the state's development reflect his 'effective leadership'. In the letter, he also referred to the support received by BJP in assembly elections.
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: Apocalypse of hatred, intolerance, untruth engulfing country: Sonia Gandhi
text: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre in an article she wrote in a newspaper. "An apocalypse of hatred, bigotry, intolerance and untruth is engulfing our country today. If we don't stop it now, it will...damage our society beyond repair," Gandhi wrote. "Let us contain this raging fire, this tsunami of hate that has been unleashed," she added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Let TN send essentials to Sri Lanka from Thoothukudi: CM to Centre
text: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has requested the Centre to allow the state to ship essential commodities from the Thoothukudi port to Sri Lanka as humanitarian aid to the people, especially the Tamils. During his meeting with PM Modi in March, MK Stalin spoke about Tamil Nadu's willingness to provide essential commodities and life-saving medicines to the Lankan Tamils.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Even Lord Ram will be restless over Khargone developments: Sanjay Raut
text: In his weekly column 'Rokhthok', Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that even Lord Ram would be restless over the developments in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. "If someone wants to stoke fire of fundamentalism...and disturb peace to win elections...they are sowing seeds of a second Partition," Raut stated, adding, "Stoking communal...fires in name of Lord Ram...is insult to idea of Ram."
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: BJP needs armies of illiterate goons, will never make good schools: AAP's Raghav
text: AAP's Raghav Chadha criticised BJP for felicitating the accused who were arrested for vandalising Arvind Kejriwal's residence and said that BJP will never work towards making good schools for people as "it needs armies of illiterate goons". "They won't even generate employment...if they do so then how'll they get lumpen elements for carrying out their violent agenda," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Chhattisgarh Cong MLA's son booked for assaulting policeman
text: Ritik Nayak, the son of Congress' Raigarh MLA Prakash Nayak, has been booked for allegedly assaulting a policeman and a truck driver inside a police station in Chhattisgarh on Saturday, an official said. The victims have filed two separate FIRs against Ritik, the official added. No arrest has been made in connection with the cases, the official further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 3 people accuse TRS leaders of corruption, kill selves in T'gana
text: A member of the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS), B Sai Ganesh, allegedly killed himself by consuming pesticide at a police station in Khammam after accusing TRS leaders of corruption. In another such incident, a real estate developer and his mother allegedly died by suicide in Kamareddy district. A suicide note was recovered, where the victim accused TRS leaders of extortion.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: May month to be dedicated to women in Himachal Pradesh: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said the month of May will be dedicated to the women in Himachal Pradesh. The BJP leader said, "During this one month, attention would be given to the women-related issues and all sorts of tests would be conducted." On AAP's visits to the state amid upcoming elections, Thakur said, "[AAP] has no ground here."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Atmosphere spoiled for poll gains: Raut on Jahangirpuri violence
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday reacted to the violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, alleging that the country's atmosphere is "being deliberately spoiled to gain political advantage in elections". "Such incidents never happened before on Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti," he added. Nine people, including eight police officers, were injured in the incident.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Manipur media threatens to boycott govt, BJP, Cong for not paying ad dues
text: Manipur's media outlets have threatened to boycott the coverage related to the Manipur government, ruling Bharatiya Janata Party and opposition Congress over the non-clearance of their respective advertisement bills. In a joint meeting between newspaper publishers and media unions, it was decided that the three concerned groups will be boycotted if they fail to clear their bills by April 23.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: TMC's Babul Supriyo wins Ballygunge Assembly by-polls
text: Former Union Minister and TMC leader Babul Supriyo won the Ballygunge by-polls on Saturday by defeating BJP's Keya Ghosh. As trends suggested his win, Supriyo appreciated West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee by saying, "Didi guided us for working on ground." Meanwhile, BJP's Agnimitra Paul, who lost the Asansol Lok Sabha seat to TMC's Shatrughan Sinha, said, "Babul Supriyo's victory...was predictable."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: K'taka minister, booked for contractor's alleged suicide, resigns
text: Days after he was booked for a contractor's alleged suicide, BJP leader and Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa handed over his resignation to CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Friday. He said he was resigning "to prevent embarrassment to the BJP". The deceased contractor, Santhosh Patil, claimed Eshwarappa and his aides demanded a 40% commission to clear his nearly ₹4 crore bill.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Lalu Yadav's RJD wins Bochahan Assembly seat in Bihar by-polls
text: Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD on Saturday won Bochahan Assembly seat in Bihar by-polls by over 36,000 votes, data released by Election Commission on Saturday shows. RJD's Amar Kumar Paswan got 82,562 votes while his nearest rival, BJP's Baby Kumari got 45,909 votes. Geeta Kumari from Vikassheel Insaan Party got the third-highest votes while Congress candidate Tarun Chaudhary got 1,336 votes.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: TMC's Shatrughan wins Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls by over 3 lakh votes
text: Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Prasad Sinha on Saturday won the Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls by over three lakh votes, helping his party win the constituency for the first time. Sinha defeated BJP's Agnimitra Paul. The seat had fallen vacant after singer-politician Babul Supriyo left BJP and joined TMC. "I was confident poetic justice will prevail," Supriyo said about Sinha's win.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Harbhajan to donate Rajya Sabha salary for education of farmers' daughters
text: Cricketer-turned-politician Harbhajan Singh on Saturday pledged to donate his salary as a Rajya Sabha member toward the education and welfare of farmers' daughters. "I've joined to contribute to the betterment of our nation and will do everything I can," said Singh while announcing the decision on Twitter. Singh was nominated as Rajya Sabha member by the AAP government in Punjab.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 8 accused of attacking Kejriwal's house garlanded at BJP Delhi office
text: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Thursday welcomed and garlanded eight BJYM workers, who were arrested on March 31 in connection with the attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house, at the party office. Gupta said they were jailed while protesting against "anti-Hindu" Kejriwal. "Each of our workers will always fight against anti-Hindu forces," he tweeted.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Sonia, Rahul & senior Cong leaders meet Prashant Kishor in Delhi
text: Congress interim chief Sonia Gandhi, her son and former party chief Rahul Gandhi and other senior party leaders like Ambika Soni, Digvijiya Singh, Mallikarjun Kharge and KC Venugopal met poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Saturday. The meeting at Sonia's Delhi residence lasted for nearly four hours. "Kishor has given detailed presentation on 2024 polls strategy," Venugopal said after the meeting.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Ram wasn't God, Tulsidas-Valmiki created this character: Ex-Bihar CM
text: Former Bihar CM and HAM chief Jitan Ram Manjhi has said Ram wasn't a God but a character created by Tulsidas-Valmiki. "They created 'kavya' and 'mahakavya' with this character...It states a lot of good things and we revere that...I revere Tulsidas-Valmiki but not Ram," he added. Manjhi claimed there are only two castes in the world - rich and poor.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Prashant Kishor asked to join Congress at meeting with top party leaders: Reports
text: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor was asked to join Congress during a meeting with top Congress leaders at party chief Sonia Gandhi's residence on Saturday, reports said. As per AICC General Secretary KC Venugopal, Kishor gave a detailed presentation on the 2024 Lok Sabha polls strategy to Sonia. The strategy will be examined by a group of Congress leaders, he added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 'Akhand Bharat' only when people from all castes live with unity: Gehlot to Bhagwat
text: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's "India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 years" remark, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said, "Akhand Bharat will be made when each person from all castes starts living with brotherhood and love." He further said that BJP and RSS are using names of Sardar Patel, BR Ambedkar and Mahatma Gandhi just for their political benefits.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Shut down your loudspeaker: MNS to Raut on comparing Raj Thackeray with Owaisi
text: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has put up posters outside Shiv Sena's Saamana newspaper office which read, "Whom did you call Owaisi? Sanjay Raut shut down your loudspeaker." This comes after Sanjay Raut said that BJP was using Raj Thackeray in Maharashtra similar to how it had used AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi in Uttar Pradesh during assembly elections.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RSS should merge with BJP and become political party: Rajasthan CM
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) should merge with BJP and become a political party. He added that "RSS works to make BJP win by staying behind" and they should now come forward. Gehlot's comments come after RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that 'Akhand Bharat' will become a reality in 15 years.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP govt did more work for STs than Oppn did in 6 decades: Bhatia
text: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Friday said the BJP government did more work for Scheduled Tribes than what the Opposition did during their nearly six-decade-long rule. Bhatia said, "PM Modi emphasised on Eklavya Model Residential School for better education of children of SC/ST society." Under the scheme, 452 new schools will be built in the next five years, Bhatia added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Bihar CM opens ₹550-crore soft drink bottling plant at Begusarai
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday opened a soft drink bottling plant, which is said to be worth ₹550 crore, at Asurari in Begusarai. State Industries Minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said the Pepsi bottling plant of Varun Beverages Limited would generate employment and give preference to locals. He further announced that 17 ethanol units would be opened soon in Bihar.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Met Congress rebel MLAs, formed 'Team Sidhu': Navjot Singh Sidhu
text: After reports claimed that rebel Congress MLAs were planning to leave the party, former Punjab Congress President Navjot Singh Sidhu said that he held a meeting with rebel MLAs where 'Team Sidhu' was formed. 'Team Sidhu' will look into the problems raised by party MLAs, Sidhu said. "I will continue to fight for the interests of Punjab," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Those who wanted to send CM Yogi to Math will now face sticks: Aparna Yadav
text: BJP leader Aparna Yadav, who is the daughter-in-law of SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav, has commented on the opposition after the BJP's recent win in UP Assembly polls. "When I joined the BJP...some people had said that they have prepared to send (CM Yogi) Adityanath to the (Gorakhnath) Math. Now...it is time for them to face the sticks," Aparna said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: AAP's unit in Himachal Pradesh is finished: Anurag Thakur
text: Reacting to AAP leaders' visits to Himachal Pradesh ahead of the state Assembly polls, BJP leader Anurag Thakur said, "They have no ground here, their unit is finished." Thakur's statement comes after AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari along with general secretary organisation Satish Thakur and Una chief Iqbal Singh joined BJP on April 9.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Nothing will be achieved by painting JNU saffron: RJD's Manoj Jha
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal MP Manoj Kumar Jha condemned the 'Bhagwa JNU' posters and putting up of saffron flags outside Jawaharlal Nehru University campus. He said, "What will happen if the saffron flag is planted in JNU? This is a university. Understand the university's global philosophy. Nothing will be achieved by colouring university saffron, green, red and yellow."
author: Priyanshi Mathur

headlines: India will talk non-violence but also carry a stick: RSS chief Bhagwat
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, while addressing a gathering of saints in Haridwar on Wednesday, said India will talk about non-violence but will also carry the stick as "the world only understands power". He further said that India's journey of progress has begun and "those who want to stop it will be either removed or finished, but India will not stop".
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Muslims are hurt when their children are attacked in pointless hate: Khurshid
text: Amid the Madhya Pradesh government's decision to bulldoze the houses of the accused in the Khargone violence, Congress leader Salman Khurshid has said that Muslims "are hurt when their children are attacked in pointless hate". "When the State chooses to bypass the rule of law and destroy homes and lives, what respect is left for patriotism?" Khurshid asked.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will do everything to bring Uniform Civil Code: Shivpal Yadav
text: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia (PSPL) leader Shivpal Singh Yadav demanded the implementation of Uniform Civil Code and said, "We will do everything, even protest if needed, to fulfil the dream of Lohia and Ambedkar." "Ambedkar raised the issue of Uniform Civil Code in Constituent Assembly. Lohia had raised the issue too in Parliament. So we are supporting it," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP felicitating those who launched a 'murderous attack' on CM: AAP
text: Criticising BJP for felicitating the eight accused who were arrested for vandalising Arvind Kejriwal's official residence, AAP's Manish Sisodia said BJP was felicitating those who launched a "murderous attack on the CM's house". "This proves that the BJP not only enlists goons but also promotes goondaism and rowdyism," Sisodia added. The eight BJYM members got bail from the High Court.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Time is right for 'One Nation One Language': BJP's AP Abdullakutty
text: Days after Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark, BJP National Vice President AP Abdullakutty said that it is the right time to go for 'One Nation One Language'. "Today Hindi is not only an Indian language but also an international language. The Narendra Modi government is not against regional languages," he added. "Opposition parties misunderstood Amit Shah's intention," he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Don't fall into BJP's trap, vote for AAP in Himachal polls: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has urged residents of Himachal Pradesh to vote for the AAP in the upcoming state Assembly elections, cautioning them against falling into the BJP's trap. Sisodia accused the BJP of announcing freebies out of the fear of losing the state polls. "BJP has never believed in...concept of providing things to people at...cheaper rate," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Tejashwi Yadav thanks voters after RJD wins in Bihar by-polls
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday thanked voters after the party claimed victory in the Bihar by-polls. Tejashwi tweeted, "Hearty thanks to the public. People suffering from unemployment, inflation...have done a...job of defeating the anti-people policies." Notably, RJD's candidate Amar Kumar Paswan won the Bochahan Assembly seat in state by-polls by over 36,000 votes.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 yrs: RSS chief Bhagwat
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said India will become 'Akhand Bharat' in 10-15 years. He made the comment in response to Akhil Bharatiya Akhara Parishad chief Mahant Ravindra Puri's statement that astrological predictions suggest the Akhand Bharat dream will be realised in 20-25 years. "You spoke about 20-25 years, but if we increase our speed, I say 10-15 years," Bhagwat added.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: SDPI worker killed in front of father in Kerala, party blames BJP-RSS
text: A 44-year-old worker of SDPI, the political wing of PFI, was allegedly killed in front of his father in Kerala's Palakkad district on Friday. The deceased, Subair, was returning from Friday prayers with his father when a car hit their bike. A four-member gang emerged from another car and attacked him. The party has blamed BJP-RSS for his death.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: PM's portrait removed from govt office in Tamil Nadu, video surfaces
text: A controversy erupted after a video purportedly showed PM Narendra Modi's portrait being removed from Veppathur Town Panchayat's office in Thanjavur district in Tamil Nadu. The panchayat chairman allegedly removed the portrait at her husband's instructions. Subsequently, BJP workers in Kumbakonam lodged a complaint. The video was shared by several BJP leaders, including Tejasvi Surya.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: I'll come out innocent, will become minister again: KS Eshwarappa
text: Karnataka Minister for Rural Development and Panchayat Raj KS Eshwarappa, who is slated to resign today after his name figured in a contractor's alleged suicide case, has said he'll be proven innocent and will become a minister again. "If I continue as a minister when the investigation is on, there'll be a feeling that I may influence it," he said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Father would be blessing PM Modi: Ex-PM's son on museum for PMs
text: Neeraj Shekhar, who is a BJP MP and son of late PM Chandra Shekhar, thanked PM Narendra Modi for the Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya, a museum dedicated to every PM of India since independence. Calling PM Modi a true statesman above party lines, Shekhar wrote, "Wherever he is, my father would be blessing PM Modi...So would all other Prime Ministers."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Don't know who is saying so: Hardik denies reports of leaving Cong
text: Gujarat Congress leader Hardik Patel has denied rumours of him leaving the party. "There is a rumour that I am leaving Congress, I do not know who is spreading so," Patel said. "There will be small fights...within the party, but we have to work together to make Gujarat a better place," Patel, who joined the Congress in March 2019, said.
author: Mohammad Anab
