headlines: Babasaheb rose above discrimination and laid down the Constitution: CM Yogi
text: Speaking at an event organised to mark Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar's 131st birth anniversary, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that Ambedkar was a person who rose above "discrimination". "Think of the times and social conditions that existed 131 years ago. But Babasaheb...laid down the Constitution...without ever hinting at the prejudice and inequality he faced," CM Yogi Adityanath said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: India has to grow big, those blocking way will be eliminated: RSS chief
text: Addressing a gathering in Haridwar, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that India has to grow big and its rise is incumbent upon the rise of 'dharma'. Comparing India's progress to that of a vehicle that only has an accelerator and no brakes, Bhagwat said that those trying to stop it "will either step aside or be eliminated".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Sharad Pawar first to use the word 'Hindu terror': Devendra Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra ex-CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised NCP chief Sharad Pawar and said that his party has an old track record of "appeasement politics and polarising the society on communal basis". He further said that Pawar was the first person to use the word "Hindu terror". The NCP has grand plans on bringing a Muslim quota in Maharashtra, the BJP leader added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Shouldn't bulldozers be used against those who trouble the poor: MP CM
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, while reacting to criticism from opposition over the demolition of houses of people accused of pelting stones in Khargone, asked, "Shouldn't bulldozers be used against those who trouble the poor?" "This government is softer than a flower for the public, but we will not let goons and criminals survive in the state," Chouhan added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Resignation not enough, arrest Eshwarappa: Cong on K'taka contractor's suicide
text: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar demanded arrest of state minister KS Eshwarappa in connection with the death case of contractor Santosh Patil and said that "resignation is not a solution". "A case of corruption has to be registered, then he (KS Eshwarappa) has to be arrested," Shivakumar said. The contractor's family has alleged that he was tortured, Shivakumar further added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Ashamed: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Mamata's Nadia rape case remark
text: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Wednesday reacted to Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's comment on alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia, stating that she's "ashamed". Paul claimed that case was handed over to CBI as Calcutta HC doesn't trust Bengal's administration. Mamata had remarked that the rape victim could have had an affair with accused or been pregnant.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP, AIMIM spreading communal violence in country: Congress leader
text: Congress leader Sajjan Singh Verma on Thursday blamed the BJP and AIMIM for spreading communal violence in the country. "BJP and...AIMIM played a crucial role in Khargone communal violence. They deliberately want to create an atmosphere of tension in India," Verma said. He claimed that BJP never talks about real issues, adding, "They only want people to remember their religion."
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Speak on inflation and not loudspeakers in mosque: Aaditya tells Raj Thackeray
text: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray reacted to the ongoing loudspeaker row and said, "Instead of removing loudspeakers, one should use the same to speak about rising inflation." "One should speak about petrol, diesel or CNG," he added. His statement comes after Raj Thackeray said, "Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3rd otherwise, we will play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: According to BJP, only Hindus were harmed in Karauli violence: Owaisi
text: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi has alleged that "according to the BJP, only Hindus were harmed" in the communal clashes which took place in Rajasthan's Karauli. "A minister of Rajasthan government said that a total of 80 shops were burnt in Karauli, out of which 73 belonged to Muslims," Owaisi said. He further alleged that Muslims were targeted by "Sangh rioters".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Bhagwant Mann’s character is purer than 24 karat gold: Raghav Chadha
text: Aam Aadmi Party national spokesperson Raghav Chadha said that the character of Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is "purer than 24 karat gold". His comments came after SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal accused Maan visiting Takht Damdama Sahib while being drunk. Sukhbir also said that Mann had visited the holy place in a drunken state even earlier.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Former Gujarat Congress MLA Pravin Maru joins BJP
text: Former Congress MLA from Gujarat's Gadhada constituency Pravin Maru on Thursday joined BJP at the party's state headquarters in Gandhinagar. Maru had resigned as Congress MLA in March 2020. "I had been with the Congress party for 30 years, but it failed to form a government," Maru said. "Whichever responsibility BJP gives me, I will accept it," he further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: In my era, people slapped DCs to get noticed as politicians: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Janardan Mishra has claimed that during his era, people used to "slap District Collectors (DCs) or commissioners to get noticed as politicians". Mishra made the remarks while addressing a BJP workers' gathering in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. "We were aware that slapping senior officials will establish us as political leaders at least for...next one or two years," Mishra added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Local admin doesn't invite me to govt events as I'm Dalit: BJP MP
text: BJP MP from Maharashtra's Latur Sudhakar Shrangare has accused the local administration of not inviting him to government events as he's a Dalit. This comes after a Dr BR Ambedkar statue was unveiled in the district by Union Minister Ramdas Athawale and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday. "I'm not invited purposely. They can't see my work," Shrangare said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Mamata can't question character of victim: WB BJP chief on Nadia rape case
text: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar criticised CM Mamata Banerjee for her "rape or love affair" remark on the alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia district and said, "Case should be registered against the CM." "She (Mamata Banerjee) can't question the character of the victim," he added. Her comments have "ashamed the Bengali community", he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Mama will rebuild the houses burnt in Khargone violence: MP CM
text: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assured action against Khargone violence culprits and said that those whose houses were burnt in the violence, need not worry. He said, "Their Mama will re-build their houses." On April 10, during Ram Navami procession, clashes broke out, where several houses and vehicles were set on fire.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Stones pelted at Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao's house in Hyderabad
text: Unidentified persons pelted stones at senior Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao's house in Hyderabad's Amberpet, police said. A car parked in front of the house was also damaged in the incident. Rao, while condemning the attack, criticised the state government for failing to ensure his security. He claimed he had approached Telangana DGP after receiving threat calls in the past.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: SP leader resigns citing Akhilesh's silence over 'atrocities against Muslims'
text: Samajwadi Party leader Mohammad Kasim Raeen resigned from the party citing "no action" by Akhilesh Yadav and others against "rising incidents of atrocities meted out to Muslims" in UP. He said that the party is "not interested" in raising its voice against incidents like imprisonment of Azam Khan and his family and demolition of MLA Shazil Islam Ansari's petrol pump.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: U'khand cabinet gives nod to set up panel to draft Uniform Civil Code
text: The Uttarakhand cabinet has given nod to set up a panel comprising legal experts and stakeholders to work on the implementation of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the state. "Keeping our pre-poll promise, we cleared a proposal to constitute a committee to draft Uniform Civil Code at the very first meeting of our cabinet," CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: K'taka AAP demands arrest of state minister KS Eshwarappa
text: The Karnataka unit of AAP has demanded state Minister KS Eshwarappa's arrest in connection with the death of contractor Santosh Patil. "The resignation alone of KS Eshwarappa is not enough, he should be arrested immediately and all the scams in his...department must be thoroughly investigated," said AAP state President Prithvi Reddy. Notably, Congress has also demanded the BJP leader's arrest.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Raj Thackeray is BJP's loudspeaker, people will shut it down: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that MNS chief Raj Thackeray has become BJP's loudspeaker. "This loudspeaker is blaring out of desperation but people will shut it down," Raut added. Raj Thackeray had warned that MNS workers will install speakers outside mosques and play Hanuman Chalisa if loudspeakers from mosques are not removed till May 3.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Protesting farmers in H'yana file 'missing' complaint of local MP
text: Farmers, who've been holding a protest seeking compensation for their damaged crops for a month in Haryana's Hisar, have filed a "missing" complaint of the local BJP MP Brijendra Singh with police. A Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) leader claimed that "the public is searching for Singh as development projects are halted". A police spokesperson confirmed that the complaint was filed.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: K'taka minister, named in contractor suicide case, to resign tomorrow
text: Karnataka minister and BJP leader KS Eshwarappa, who was named in an FIR linked to a contractor's alleged suicide, said on Thursday that he will hand over his resignation to CM Basavaraj S Bommai on Friday. "I thank you all for cooperation," he said. Earlier, Eshwarappa had dismissed the contractor's purported suicide note and declared that he won't be resigning.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Cong leaders DK Shivakumar, Siddaramaiah arrested over protest against Eshwarappa
text: Congress leaders DK Shivakumar, Siddaramaiah, Randeep Singh Surjewala and other party workers were arrested on Thursday as they protested demanding Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa's resignation. Police stopped them from marching towards CM Basavaraj Bommai's residence. FIR was registered against Eshwarappa after contractor Santosh Patil, who had accused him of corruption, died by suicide.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Allow us to write exams wearing hijab: Student urges K'taka CM
text: Aliya Assadi, one of the students who approached the Karnataka High Court against the state government's order banning hijab in educational institutions, on Wednesday urged CM Basavaraj S Bommai to allow Muslim students to write exams while wearing hijabs. "You...have a chance to stop our future from getting ruined," she tweeted. The pre-university exams will start later this month.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Will send them even to Israel: Mann on Punjab officers-Kejriwal meet
text: Amid controversy over Punjab government officers meeting Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has said he'll send officers to Israel if needed. "I...sent the officers to Delhi for training. They can go anywhere to learn good things," he added. After the meeting, the Opposition had alleged Kejriwal was governing Punjab through a "remote control".
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Matter of pride that most of our PMs are from humble families: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said it's a great pride for Indians that most of our PMs belonged to humble families. "Coming from a remote countryside, from a very poor family, coming from a farmer's family, reaching the post of PM, this strengthens the faith in the great traditions of Indian democracy," he said at the inauguration of 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya'.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: With woman as CM, crime against women shameful: TMC MP on Nadia rape
text: Lok Sabha MP Saugata Roy said that even one case of crime against women is shameful in West Bengal as it has a woman CM. "Everyone is extremely concerned about crime against women," he said amid criticism of state government over a 14-year-old's alleged rape in Nadia. Notably, CM Mamata Banerjee was criticised for her "rape or love affair" comment.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: My position in Cong is like a groom forced into 'nasbandi': Hardik
text: Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel on Wednesday criticised his party and said, "My position in the party is that of a newly married groom who has been made to undergo nasbandi (vasectomy)." He claimed he isn't invited to meetings or involved in decisions. "Many in the Congress feel that Hardik was not properly utilised by the party," he added.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Cong exits Akbar Road office, whose rent was unpaid since '13: Reports
text: Congress on Tuesday started shifting its Sewa Dal office from 26, Akbar Road in New Delhi weeks after an RTI reply revealed that its monthly rent was unpaid since 2013, claimed reports. A senior Congress leader claimed that new rooms are being constructed at the party's headquarters at 24, Akbar Road to make space for the Sewa Dal office.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Whether you like it or not, farm laws will come back: BJP MP
text: BJP MP from Rajya Sabha Suresh Gopi on Wednesday claimed the three farm laws, which were repealed by the Centre, will come back. "I am a BJP man...am extremely angry over the withdrawal of the farm laws...Whether you like it or not...the farm laws will come back," he said. The government rolled back the laws after continuous protests by farmers.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: At least 1,000 BJP leaders in Himachal Pradesh to join AAP: Sisodia
text: At least 1,000 local BJP leaders in Himachal Pradesh will join the AAP, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said on Thursday. "Several big leaders of the BJP are also in touch with us. The BJP is completely scattered in the state now," Sisodia said. He added that the leaders feel BJP won't do anything for the state.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Make 'Akhand Bharat' in 15 days, not 15 years: Raut to Mohan Bhagwat
text: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's reported remarks that "Akhand Bharat will be made in 15 years", Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that if he wants to build 'Akhand Bharat', he should do it in "15 days and not 15 years". "First POK is to be included in India and then Pakistan, Sri Lanka and others also," Raut added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Ex-Gujarat MLA, suspended before 2017 elections, rejoins BJP
text: Former BJP MLA Kamabhai Rathod, who was suspended from the party ahead of the 2017 Assembly elections, rejoined BJP on Wednesday. BJP had suspended him following his announcement of independent candidature after he was denied a ticket from the party. "BJP is like my mother...I had even worked for the party during the 2019 Lok Sabha polls," Rathod said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP will take necessary action: Leader on K'taka contractor's death
text: BJP's National General Secretary Dushyant Kumar Gautam said on Thursday that the party will take necessary action if allegations levelled against Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa in contractor Santosh Patil's suicide are found to be true. Eshwarappa, who was accused of corruption by Patil, has refused to resign over his death. An FIR has been filed against Eshwarappa in the case.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Can't have a state that is known only for violence: WB Guv Dhankhar
text: Reacting to the recent incident of rape in Nadia district and commotion in Kolkata HC, Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said, "We can't have a state that is known only for violence, gets into headlines for crime against women." "Recent events were painful. Even before such incidents, there was an urgent need to improve the situation in the state," Dhankhar added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP troubled by unity in Raj, trying to create communal tension: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday alleged that BJP was troubled by the unity in the state and was trying to create communal tensions. If any person tries to disturb peace in Rajasthan, strict action will be taken against them, Gehlot said, on a day BJP MP Tejasvi Surya and other BJP leaders were stopped from visiting Karauli.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP govt doesn't calculate electoral benefits before public welfare: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the BJP government never calculates electoral benefits before public welfare. There is an environment of "pro-incumbency" in the country, unlike during the earlier regimes, Goyal added. "Welfare of the poor is our priority…People are happy with government’s welfare work and the recent results of the Assembly elections in several states indicate that," Goyal stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tamil should be the link language of India: BJP leaders in TN
text: Days after Union Minister Amit Shah said that people from different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, BJP leaders in Tamil Nadu advocated Tamil to be made the link language of India. "Tamil could qualify as the link language of India and steps should be taken in this direction," said BJP leader and former Union Minister Pon Radhakrishnan.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Our doors are open for Cong's Hardik Patel: AAP Gujarat chief
text: AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia said his party's doors are open to welcome Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel. "We will definitely welcome such a revolutionary youth leader of Gujarat. We have seen his acceptability and liking," Italia said. Patel had said his position in Congress was "like a newly wedded groom who has been made to undergo a vasectomy".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Khargone riots a pre-planned conspiracy by PFI: MP BJP chief
text: BJP's Madhya Pradesh chief VD Sharma said that the Khargone violence incident was a "pre-planned conspiracy" and alleged that it was sponsored by the Popular Front of India (PFI). "Madhya Pradesh is a peaceful state, if in such a state, procession was attacked then it suggests a pre-planned conspiracy by organisations like PFI. Strict action should be taken," Sharma said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP high command not interfering in contractor's suicide case: Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there's no interference of BJP high command in contractor Santosh Patil's suicide case. He added that no action will be taken against Minister KS Eshwarappa, who has been booked for abetting Patil's suicide, until the preliminary inquiry is completed. "Based on the outcome of the investigation, we will decide," Bommai said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Violence doesn't break out if state govts don't want it: Owaisi
text: Speaking on violence in Gujarat during Ram Navami procession, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that it's the responsibility of the state government and they failed to maintain law and order. "Not right for anyone if violence breaks out anywhere...Inquiry Commission reports of past 20-25 years say that if state governments don't want it, violence doesn't break out," he further added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 'Were you sleeping?’: Owaisi to Guj govt over Ram Navami violence
text: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday criticised the Gujarat government and asked if they were "sleeping" during the violence that took place on Ram Navami. "Accept your failure. You yourself are complicit," he said, adding that more police personnel should've been deployed to bring the violence under control. "The government wanted violence," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Third Front against BJP not possible without Congress: Sharad Pawar
text: Talking about Opposition's unity for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Third Front against BJP is "not possible" without the Congress party. "Congress is still the second biggest party in the country that is why it is important to take them along," Pawar added. Opposition leaders like Mamata Banerjee have called for formation of Third Front.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Former Gujarat Congress MLA Indranil Rajguru joins AAP in Rajkot
text: Former Congress MLA from Gujarat Indranil Rajguru joined the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday in Rajkot. Rajguru said the party has emerged as the "best" option to serve people, adding, "AAP has the strength to uproot the BJP in Gujarat." Rajguru resigned from the Congress in 2018, claiming that he was unhappy with the functioning of the party organisation.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Cong is 'Gangotri' of corruption: Bommai on Cong's protest over contractor's death
text: Reacting to Congress' demand to arrest KS Eshwarappa in contractor Santosh Patil's death case, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "Congress doesn't have any moral right to protest." "Congress is a Gangotri of corruption. Postmortem was done yesterday and now preliminary inquiry will come and based on that we'll proceed," he added. "Bommai wants to save his corrupt minister," Congress said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Punjab govt won't purchase new vehicles for Ministers: CM Mann
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday ruled out any possibility of the state government purchasing any new vehicles for Ministers. Previously, Mann defended the "remote control" allegation by the Opposition and said that the senior officials of the state government had gone to Delhi for training purposes on his orders.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: What is the case involving K'taka minister and a contractor's suicide?
text: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa is accused of abetting the suicide of a contractor Santhosh Patil. In letters to the Centre, Patil said he and six other contractors invested ₹4 crore for road projects in Belagavi in 2021 but suffered losses due to delay in payments. He accused Eshwarappa and his associates of demanding a 40% commission for clearing the bill.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Won't take body till accused are arrested: Late K'taka contractor's family
text: Prashant Patil, the brother of contractor Santhosh Patil who allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka, has said the family won't take his body till those named in FIR aren't arrested. "Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, Basavaraj and Ramesh must be arrested...We want justice," he said. In a purported suicide note, Patil blamed Eshwarappa for his death and demanded punishment for him.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Nawab Malik's properties, including 5 flats in Mumbai, attached by ED
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday said it has attached eight properties linked to jailed Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik and his family in connection to a money laundering case involving Dawood Ibrahim. The attached properties include a unit at Kurla in Mumbai, a 147-acre agricultural land at Osmanabad in Maharashtra, three flats in Kurla and two residential flats in Bandra.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Sex with minor is rape: Mahua Moitra after Mamata Banerjee's 'love affair' remark
text: Speaking on the alleged rape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal, TMC MP Mahua Moitra said sex with a minor is rape and a crime. She said, "I won't tolerate such things." This comes after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's remark, "How do you know if she was raped or was pregnant or had a love affair?"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Senior BJP leader Harmel Dhiman, 2 others from Himachal join AAP
text: National Executive Member of BJP and Vice-President of BJP's Himachal Pradesh SC Morcha, Harmel Dhiman on Wednesday joined the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in presence of Satyendar Jain. Along with Dhiman, two other BJP leaders from Himachal Pradesh, Devraj and Jagdish Pawar also joined AAP. "At least 1,000 people from BJP will join AAP soon," Jain said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP's Tejasvi Surya, others detained on way to Rajasthan's Karauli
text: BJP Yuva Morcha chief and MP Tejasvi Surya was on Wednesday detained by Rajasthan Police at Hindaun-Mahwa border as he tried to visit violence-hit Karauli along with others. "Section 144 is not in place at where we are now...It's our constitutional right to go to Karauli," he said. Earlier today, he met victims of the violence at a Jaipur hospital.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Lawyer sent to 14-days judicial custody over protest at Pawar's Mumbai home
text: A Mumbai court sent advocate Gunaratna Sadavarte to 14-days of judicial custody in connection to the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai residence last week. Satara Police will take Sadavarte into their custody tomorrow. Reportedly, his wife Jayashree Patil has also been named as an accused for allegedly instigating the protest.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Will not allow imposition of Hindi in Tamil Nadu: BJP's Annamalai
text: Days after Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark, Tamil Nadu BJP leader K Annamalai said that the state unit of the party will not allow the imposition of Hindi in the state. "If we require for work, education or other purposes, we can learn Hindi but it cannot be imposed. None of us here, including me, speaks Hindi," Annamalai said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Journalist arrested in Pune over protests outside Sharad Pawar's home
text: A journalist has been arrested from Pune in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's home in Mumbai. A group of MSRTC employees had staged a protest outside Pawar's residence on April 8, accusing him of not doing anything to help them. At least 115 people have been arrested in the matter so far.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Don’t need to be taught what Hindutva is, it’s in Shiv Sena's blood: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that his party does not need to be taught what Hindutva is. "It (Hindutva) is in Shiv Sena's blood. Whenever Hindutva was attacked, at that time, it was not the BJP that came to the forefront. It was us, Balasaheb Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray," Raut added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre negating federalism: AAP to SC in plea for control over services in Delhi
text: The Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government told Supreme Court that Centre has been "negating federalism" by taking away its power. A "democratically elected government" should not be left without powers to even transfer officials, the party said. The statement was made while the apex court was hearing case between Centre and AAP on issue over the bureaucracy in the national capital.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: No place for riots, chaos in UP: Adityanath on Ram Navami celebration
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that the state had set an example on Ram Navami by demonstrating that "there is no place for riots and chaos" in UP. "Forget about riots and ruckus, there was not even any tu-tu main-main (argument) during the celebration," he added.  "This is a proof of UP's new progressive way of thinking," Adityanath further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Don't give Raj Thackeray so much importance: Ajit Pawar amid Azaan row
text: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said he will soon reply to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's warning about removal of loudspeakers from mosques. "Raj Thackeray must not be given so much importance, when...right time comes, I'll surely answer on it," Pawar said on Wednesday. Thackeray warned against statewide protests if the government fails to remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Man booked for making indecent remarks against UP CM Yogi Adityanath
text: Police have booked a man in UP's Budaun for allegedly making indecent remarks against CM Yogi Adityanath. According to SSP OP Singh, a video had surfaced on social media wherein the man, identified as Mahendra, can be seen making indecent remarks against the CM. An FIR was lodged in this regard based on BJP office-bearer Anuj Saxena's complaint.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: We gave dharna in Delhi but anti-farmer Centre didn't pay heed: TRS MLC
text: Telangana produces 40% of India's rice, TRS MLC K Kalvakuntla said on Wednesday. "That's why we're called the rice bowl of India," Kalvakuntla added. "Since production is so high, we require help from the Central government. We gave dharna in Delhi but the corporate-friendly and anti-farmer Central government didn't pay heed to it," Kalvakuntla stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP lacks leadership, I do not see it as threat to BJP: Himachal Pradesh CM
text: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, CM Jairam Thakur said he does not see AAP as a threat to BJP because it neither has leadership nor organisational network on the ground. "They benefitted from Punjab’s political circumstances…Himachal is a different ballgame. Here, the basic character of politics has long been dominated by two parties, BJP and Congress," Thakur added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3: Raj Thackeray
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday reiterated his call to remove loudspeakers at mosques. "Loudspeakers at mosques should be shut by May 3rd otherwise, we will play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers," Thackeray added. "I want to tell the state government, we will not go back on this subject, do whatever you want to do," Thackeray stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Case filed against Digvijaya Singh for his tweet on Khargone violence
text: A case was filed against Congress leader Digvijaya Singh for allegedly spreading religious animosity by tweeting a fake photo related to a violence incident in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. Singh shared an image of young teenagers waving a saffron flag at a mosque, referring to the violence that erupted during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. Later, he removed the tweet.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Matter of concern: Chirag on bomb explosion near CM Nitish's 'Jansabha' site
text: Reacting to the bomb explosion incident near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' in Nalanda district, LJP supremo Chirag Paswan said, "It's a matter of concern and I condemn it." "There is repeated negligence, investigation should be done into the matter. This is the second attack on him within a month," he added. Earlier, a man attacked Nitish Kumar in Bakhtiyarpur.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP should change its name to Modi-Shah party: Congress’ Kuldeep Rathore
text: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Kuldeep Singh Rathore said BJP has become a party of two people and it should change its name to "Modi-Shah party". His remark came in reaction to BJP chief JP Nadda’s "Congress is neither Indian nor national" comment. "He should know the history of Congress before making such a remark," Rathore added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Request PM to immediately withdraw 'Achhe Din': Kharge on rising inflation
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that inflation was at its highest in the last 17 months and asked PM Narendra Modi to withdraw his "Achhe Din" statement. Taking to Twitter, he said, "At 7%, inflation is now highest in 17 months. I humbly request PM to immediately withdraw these 'Achhe Din'. People of India have had enough of 'good times'."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP chief JP Nadda forms team to look into Hanskhali rape-murder
text: BJP chief JP Nadda has reportedly formed a five-member committee to look into the alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in West Bengal's Hanskhali. The committee, which includes MP Rekha Verma and UP minister Baby Rani Maurya, has been asked to submit its report at the earliest. Earlier, the Calcutta High Court ordered CBI to investigate the case.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Actions by state govts amid incidents of violence 'inappropriate': Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said state governments' actions in Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Rajasthan amid recent cases of violence were 'inappropriate'. Mayawati tweeted that the incidents disturbed peace and harmony, adding, "The actions initiated by (the state) governments prima facie seem to be revengeful." "Will such examples lead to a new India?" she further wrote.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Centre should have objected to Blinken's remarks on rights abuses: Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said on Wednesday that Centre should have objected to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's remarks on 'rise in rights abuses' in India. "[This] statement made by...US in front of our ministers...is detrimental for [India]," he added. Blinken said on Tuesday that US was monitoring "concerning developments", including rights abuses in India.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Time to speak on inflation, unemployment: Pawar on loudspeaker remark
text: Responding to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's comment on the removal of loudspeakers from mosques, Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar said it's time to speak on "inflation and unemployment, but no one speaks on it". Raj Thackeray on Tuesday warned of state wide protests if the state government failed to remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Sidhu's wife Navjot Kaur hospitalised, to undergo surgery for stone removal
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu's wife Navjot Kaur Sidhu has been hospitalised in Amritsar after she was seriously ill for the past two days. Navjot Kaur will undergo surgery for the removal of a stone on Tuesday, a spokesperson of the cricketer-turned-politician said. She's a former Amritsar East MLA and campaigned actively in the recent Punjab Assembly polls.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Bomb hurled near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' site in Nalanda
text: A bomb was hurled near Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' (public meeting) in Nalanda district on Tuesday. One person has been detained in connection with the incident. This comes days after Kumar was attacked by a man, who is believed to be mentally unstable, during an event at his hometown Bakhtiyarpur in Patna.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Sidhu Moose Wala releases song on his Punjab poll defeat; AAP criticises him
text: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala has released a song titled 'Scapegoat', which is based on his defeat as Congress candidate in the recent state Assembly elections. AAP leader Malwinder Singh Kang accused Moose Wala of referring to people of Punjab as 'gaddar' (traitors) in his song. "Punjabis are neither traitors nor hypocrites," AAP MLA Jeevan Jyot Kaur tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: I'm not at fault: K'taka Minister as contractor blames him in suicide note
text: Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa has claimed that he wasn't responsible for the suicide of contractor Santosh Patil who has blamed him for his death in a note. "We have to wait for the verdict...in the case I had filed against Patil. I make it very clear that I'm not at fault anywhere," Eshwarappa said. Patil had accused him of corruption.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: FIR against Congress' Digvijay Singh over post on Khargone violence
text: An FIR has been registered against senior Congress leader Digvijay Singh over a tweet on the Khargone violence that broke out during a Ram Navami procession. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan criticised Singh and termed his tweet a conspiracy to spread religious frenzy in the state. MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra had warned Singh of a legal action.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Former Jammu & Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti placed under house arrest
text: Authorities placed former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti under house arrest in Srinagar on Tuesday to prevent her from going to Anantnag district. Mufti claimed that she intended to visit the family of a Kashmiri Pandit who was attacked in Shopian. "Government of India wilfully spreads fake propaganda about Kashmiri mainstream and muslims responsible for pandit exodus," she added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Goa CM allots portfolios to 3 new ministers, Dhavalikar gets Power dept
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant allotted portfolios to newly-inducted ministers Ramkrishna alias Sudin Dhavalikar, Nilkanth Halarnkar and Subhash Phal Dessai on Tuesday. Dhavalikar has been given the Power, New and Renewable Energy and Housing portfolios, while Halarnkar will handle Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Factories departments. Dessai has been given Social Welfare and two other departments.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Sanjay Raut, Eknath Khadse's phones tapped by BJP in 2019: Maha Home Minister
text: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil claimed that Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's phone was tapped for 60 days and NCP's Eknath Khadse's phone was tapped for 67 days in 2019 before formation of MVA government. He alleged that BJP was behind the phone tapping incidents in which IPS Rashmi Shukla was accused of illegally tapping phones of Maharashtra leaders.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Bengal police acting as TMC polling agents: BJP's Malviya on bypolls
text: Amid ongoing Lok Sabha and Assembly bypolls in West Bengal, BJP's Amit Malviya alleged on Tuesday that the state police were acting as "polling agents" for Trinamool Congress (TMC). He further alleged that the media was denied access to cover the polling. Malviya's comments came after BJP's Agnimitra Paul alleged that TMC workers hurled stones at her convoy in Asansol.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Bringing deprived classes to mainstream is BJP's objective: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday evening said that BJP's objective is to bring the deprived and voiceless classes to the mainstream. "Over the years, many programmes have been drawn to bring equality in India, but have not been implemented effectively. Our government has formulated action plans to deliver our promises," he further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: No question of resigning: KS Eshwarappa after contractor's death
text: Karnataka Minister KS Eshwarappa on Tuesday said that he won't be resigning after contractor Santhosh K Patil, in his suicide note, claimed that the minister was solely responsible for his death. "I had lodged a defamation case against the person who accused me of (corruption). He should've fought it in the court, I'm nowhere related to his suicide," Eshwarappa said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Growing Muslim population isn't threat but radical thinking: Giriraj
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh has said that the "increasing population of Muslims isn't a threat, but radical thinking is a threat to India". He added the repeated incidents of stone-pelting on Ram Navami or any procession aren't a "coincidence, but an experiment". His remarks came amid communal violence incidents that broke out in India's several parts during Ram Navami processions.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Trying to save culprits: WB Cong chief on CM's 'love affair' remark
text: Responding to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's 'love affair' remark on the Nadia rape case, the state's Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that she was trying to "save the culprits". "Despite being a woman, CM is giving statements that there was a love affair and other things. She is saying all this to divert public attention," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 300 new One-Stop Centres to open for violence-hit women: Irani
text: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday said that the government plans to open additional One-Stop Centres (OSCs) to provide support to women affected by violence in private or public spaces, family, community, or at the workplace. Irani said that in collaboration with Women's Helplines, about 70 lakh women have been helped by the Central and state governments so far.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Maha govt’s image would’ve been different if Pawar was CM: State Cong leader
text: Maharashtra Minister and Congress leader Yashomati Thakur said that the government’s image would have been different if NCP chief Sharad Pawar had been made the CM of the state. "Sharad Pawar had been the CM of Maharashtra four times but today in this hour of need we want him again to guide us," she added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Mann is a 'rubber stamp', Kejriwal has taken over Punjab: Amarinder Singh
text: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Tuesday called current Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann a "rubber stamp" and alleged that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has taken over Punjab. His remark came following Kejriwal's meeting with the officials of the Punjab State Power Corporation Limited (PSPCL) in the absence of CM Bhagwant Mann.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Telangana farmers dump paddy outside BJP MP’s house
text: Farmers dumped paddy in front of the residence of BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri in Telangana's Nizamabad on Tuesday to protest against the Centre over its refusal to buy rice from the state. "He [Dharmapuri] is hiding in Delhi and has betrayed us as he's yet to take cognisance of paddy procurement issue. Centre must procure from us," said the protesters.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Where is the FIR?: Ex-AAP Himachal chief on 'misbehaviour' allegations
text: Former Himachal Pradesh AAP chief Anup Kesari, who recently joined BJP, denied AAP's allegations against him of "misbehaviour" against women and said, "Show me the complaint and the complainant." "Is there any proof? Is there any FIR? I rose through the ranks in that party, and when I quit, I got this shabby treatment," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Record for highest price rise in India goes to Cong: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the credit and record for highest price rise in India go to Congress. "Congress has no moral right to protest against price rise," Bommai added. "The rising prices have made life difficult for the common man," Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar had said earlier.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath calls on Amit Shah in Delhi
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath called on Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday during his visit to the national capital. "Held a discussion with UP CM Yogi Adityanath and Deputy CMs Keshav Prasad Maurya and Brajesh Pathak over the development and governance initiative being undertaken in the state," Shah tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: People of Punjab will soon get good news: CM Bhagwant Mann
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said his government will soon give "good news" to the people of the state, indicating that it could announce 300 units of free electricity to households. The Opposition criticised AAP earlier today and alleged that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was trying to control the Punjab government through remote control.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Govt should run bulldozer on problems of people: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that the government should "run a bulldozer" on issues like inflation and unemployment. "Inflation and unemployment have exhausted the people of the country," Gandhi tweeted. "The government should run a bulldozer on these problems but there’s hatred and panic on BJP’s bulldozer," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Electoral bond one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday described electoral bond scheme as "one of the biggest scams in Indian democracy", adding that it swings election process in favour of ruling party at Centre. Gehlot alleged that BJP puts pressure on industrialists to obtain donations through electoral bonds. "These bonds are becoming a way to use black money in elections," he added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP's rigging crossed limits in UP Legislative Council polls: Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that BJP's rigging crossed all limits in Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council polls. "The BJP has no faith in the Constitution, democracy and the process of fair elections. It is trying to weaken constitutional institutions in order to remain in power by means of money and deceit," Yadav said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Punjab, other states go to Delhi to understand CM's governance: AAP
text: Hours after the Opposition alleged that the Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was ruling Punjab through a "remote control", AAP leaders said that Punjab, other states go to Delhi to understand Kejriwal's model of governance. "Arvind Kejriwal is our party's national convenor. We take his guidance so there is nothing wrong with that," the party leaders were quoted as saying.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: MP govt cannot bulldoze country's law, Constitution: Brinda Karat
text: Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Brinda Karat on Tuesday condemned the Madhya Pradesh government saying it cannot bulldoze the 'law and Constitution of the country'. Her comments came after the government demolished houses of those who pelted stones at a Ram Navami procession in Khargone on Sunday. "If the houses are illegal, then serve notice to them," she added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: TMC's Supriyo alleges electoral malpractice by BJP in WB bypolls
text: Accusing the BJP of engaging in electoral malpractices, TMC's Ballygunge Assembly by-poll candidate, Babul Supriyo, on Tuesday claimed that "BJP candidate Keya Ghosh entered a couple of booths last night". He added, "TMC has lodged an official complaint with the Election Commission. We got a reaction from them." He also claimed that EVMs weren't working properly in over 20 places.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP wins 33 of 36 seats in UP Legislative Council elections, loses Varanasi seat
text: The BJP on Tuesday won 33 out of 36 seats in the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council biennial elections. The ruling party had already won nine seats unopposed. BJP candidate Sudama Patel lost the Varanasi seat to independent candidate Annapurna Singh, wife of jailed gangster Brijesh Kumar Singh. The Azamgarh and Pratapgarh seats were also bagged by independent candidates.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Ready to enter politics if people want, says Robert Vadra
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's husband Robert Vadra said he is ready to enter politics if people want. "If people wish I should represent them and if I can bring some change for them, then I will definitely take this step," he added. When asked about the present political scenario in the country, he said he feels "uneasy".
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: How do you know if she was raped or had affair?: Mamata on minor's gangrape
text: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee reacted to the death of a 14-year-old girl after being allegedly gang-raped in Nadia. Banerjee asked, "How do you know if she was raped or was pregnant or had a love affair?...Even family knew it was a love affair." She added, "If a couple's in a relationship, how can I stop them? This isn't UP."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Violence erupts in Bengal's Asansol amid bypolls; BJP candidate alleges attack
text: Violence broke out in West Bengal's Asansol, where polling for the by-elections in Asansol Lok Sabha constituency and Ballygunge Assembly seat is underway.  BJP candidate Agnimitra Paul alleged that police took no action after people from the TMC hurled stones at her convoy. "TMC is trying to ensure that the polling agent does not enter the booth," she added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Abusing Centre over fuel price hike is not correct: Karnataka Minister
text: Karnataka Tourism Minister Anand Singh has said that people are "using their freedom of speech to abuse the Centre" over the fuel price hike which is "not correct". The BJP Minister said that if PM Narendra Modi was not in power then "petrol would (have) cost between ₹200 to ₹250 and diesel (at) ₹150".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: If someone takes stand against non-veg food it's not wrong: Athawale on JNU clash
text: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Monday said that Ram Navami is a holy festival for Hindus and if someone takes a stand to not eat non-veg food then it's not wrong. His comment came following the clash at JNU. "Whatever happened in JNU wasn't right and shouldn't have happened...All ideologies must be accepted. Culprits should be booked," Athawale stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress expels ex-MLA Surjit Dhiman for 'anti-party' activities
text: Ex-Congress MLA Surjit Singh Dhiman was expelled from the party’s primary membership for alleged "anti-party" activities on Sunday. The move came after Dhiman reportedly questioned the appointment of Gidderbaha MLA Amarinder Singh Raja Warring as Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee's (PPCC) new chief. Meanwhile, Congress stated that expulsion orders were issued against Dhiman for his "indiscipline".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: 50 youth Congress workers arrested during protest in Indore
text: At least 50 MP Youth Congress workers were arrested in Indore on Monday for protesting against unemployment and irregularities in recruitment exams, police said. The workers, including the state youth wing's chief Vikrant Bhuria, were arrested when they tried to jump over barricades to enter the collectorate, an official said. "They...were arrested as a precautionary measure," the official added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: 'Bullet train of crime' running in UP in BJP's 2nd term: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav while commenting on UP's law and order situation said that a "bullet train of crime" is running in the state. He added, "In the second term of...BJP...criminals are more fearless...Incidents of bank robbery, locker theft, rape, shooting and murder are taking place unabated." He further stated the CM has no control over the administrative machinery.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Congress issues show-cause notices to KV Thomas & Sunil Jakhar
text: Congress' disciplinary action committee on Monday issued show-cause notices to party's ex-Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar and former Union Minister KV Thomas. Jakhar was issued notice for his alleged remarks against ex-Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi, while Thomas was sent one for attending CPI(M)'s event in Kannur. Jakhar and Thomas have been given one week's time to respond to notices.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Shiv Sena does politics in name of Lord Ram, not BJP: Raosaheb Danve
text: Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve on Monday said that Shiv Sena does politics in Lord Ram's name and not the BJP. "Shiv Sena has sold their Hindutva patent to Congress and NCP. BJP doesn't politicise in the name of Ram," he said. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said that BJP keeps communal issues at the forefront of politics.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Rahul Gandhi should become the Congress President: Bhupesh Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi should take charge as the Congress President. "The dates for the Congress organisational elections have been announced and those who want to contest are free to file nomination. I believe that Rahul Gandhi should take charge as Congress chief," Baghel said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Can't stand 1 min in Guj's Bhavnagar govt schools' toilets: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday shared pictures of government schools in Gujarat, claiming that in the state Education Minister Jitu Vaghani's home district Bhavnagar, people "can't stand a minute" in the toilets. There were "spider webs" in the rooms, he also claimed. "It's...sad to see this plight of government schools," Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said about the pictures.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: No untoward incident in WB on Ram Navami: CM Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that the state did not witness a single untoward incident on Ram Navami this year, while several were reported from different parts of the country. She further said that many festivals are held in the state, but West Bengal has never witnessed an untoward incident.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: This is why Melania saw Delhi govt schools: AAP on Delhi, Guj schools' pics
text: AAP on Monday shared pictures of Delhi and Gujarat's government schools, saying, "Now we understood why [ex-US President Donald Trump's] wife Melania Trump refused to visit Gujarat government schools, and instead chose to see Delhi's." The pictures include those of Melania meeting students in Delhi government schools. Earlier, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia visited government schools in Gujarat.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Uma Bharti gives up food after not being allowed to perform ritual at shrine
text: After the ASI denied permission to BJP leader Uma Bharti to perform ritual at Madhya Pradesh's Someshwar Mahadev temple on Monday, she decided to give up food. "I am deeply anguished...To control my emotions and to have peace of mind, I have given up food till I can worship at Someshwar Mahadev temple," Bharti told PTI.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Fighting Hindutva is major challenge for CPI(M): Sitaram Yechury
text: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury said on Monday that combatting the "Hindutva communal agenda" is a major challenge for the party. He further alleged that besides northern states, the northeast region of India is also becoming "rapidly and most dangerously communalised". Yechury's remarks come a day after he was re-elected as the party's General Secretary for a third consecutive term.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Nitish became Bihar CM due to BJP's 'Reham-o-Karam': Tejashwi
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, while asserting that his party will win the Bochaha by-poll seat, said that Nitish Kumar became Bihar CM in 2005 because of BJP's 'Reham-o-Karam'. He added, "People know that the CM is running a circus instead of running the govt. They're not working on issues of the state, failing to fulfil promises."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP's neo-Hindutva followers trying to create 'before partition' situation: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena criticised the JNU campus incident on Ram Navmi and said that BJP's neo-Hindutva followers are trying to create a "before partition" situation in the country. Calling BJP "selfish" and "hollow", Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' said, "Violence in JNU happened over non-vegetarian food, but BJP is defaming name of Lord Ram. Ram is being dragged into controversy."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Karan Mahara becomes the new President of Uttarakhand Congress
text: Congress President Sonia Gandhi appointed former Ranikhet MLA Karan Mahara as the new President of the Uttarakhand Congress unit. Mahara will take over the reins from former Srinagar MLA Ganesh Godiyal. Bajpur MLA Yashpal Arya has been appointed as the CLP leader while Khatima MLA Bhuwan Kapri, who defeated CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, is appointed as the deputy CLP leader.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: AAP dissolves its Himachal Pradesh working committee amid defections
text: Himachal Pradesh's Aam Aadmi Party state working committee has been dissolved, party's election in-charge for the state Satyendar Jain tweeted. "The new state working committee will be reorganised soon," he added. This comes after AAP's Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari, general secretary organisation Satish Thakur, Mahila Morcha chief Mamta Thakur and others joined BJP.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I urge Hindus to pick up swords: VHP leader on Kashmiri Pandits’ issue
text: Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader Sadhvi Saraswati appealed to the Hindu community to carry "swords" to avoid situations like the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the Valley. "Are we waiting for the day when we will also be ousted from our houses…I urge you to pick up swords," Saraswati added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Let Muslims live peacefully: Karnataka ex-CM Yediyurappa
text: Calling for an end to communal violence, former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Monday said, "Let them (Muslims) live peacefully and respectfully." He said he has asked CM Basavaraj Bommai to ensure such incidents do not take place. "We hope that Hindus and Muslims should live like the children of the same mother," said the senior BJP leader.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: PM Modi should address the nation: Gehlot on Ram Navami violence
text: Reacting to incidents of violence on Ram Navami, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said, "PM should address the nation that whoever incites violence will not be spared." "On Ram Navami, violence erupted in some states. We talk about Maryada Purushottam Ram and violence is breaking out on his Jayanti. You can imagine the direction in which country is heading," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: WB has turned into Hathras: Cong MP on Mamata's remarks on gangrape
text: Congress MP Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has condemned West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's remarks over the death of a 14-year-old girl after being allegedly gangraped in Nadia. He said, "Bengal has turned into Hathras...Why is the CM playing...role of devil’s advocate?" "How do you know if [the victim] was raped or was pregnant or had a love affair?" Mamata had asked.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Laws should be enacted after thorough debate & discussion: Om Birla
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday said the primary responsibility of the legislature is to fulfil the aspirations of the people while laws should be enacted after thorough debate and discussion. "Democratic institutions from Panchayat to Parliament should follow this," Birla said. He was speaking at the inaugural session of the 8th CPA India Regional Conference organised in Guwahati.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Khargone incident is unfortunate, police administration wasn’t prepared: Digvijaya
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Monday termed the clashes in MP’s Khargone as "unfortunate". "Police administration was not at all prepared, it's due to their lack of preparation that such an incident took place. They're accountable for it," Singh added. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan yesterday said that the harshest action will be taken against rioters, who have been identified.
author: Sakshi Sharma
